Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job Description
3+ years of design experience
An available online portfolio

We are looking for a UX Designer to join us as we innovate and streamline campaign planning, management, and reporting experiences, making the complex seem simple. You’ll be involved in all aspects of product development from brainstorming the next innovation to working collaboratively with user research, engineering, product management to bring it to life.

We are looking for a user experience designer that loves learning, and is passionate about conceiving experiences in the abstract and then driving that vision into solid design deliverables such as complex workflows, wireframes, user interface designs, interaction models, and prototypes. You have comprehensive understanding of the current state of web technology and best practices, with a critical awareness of implications on user-centered design and functionality. You are detail-oriented, comfortable working on technical teams, skilled in using data to make decisions and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

At Amazon we put our customer’s first in everything we do – including our advertising programs. We are investing heavily in building solutions that enable brands to connect with their customers—globally and at scale—where they shop, read, watch videos, and share online. The AUX team excels at distilling the needs of a diverse user base into experiences that balance efficiency with robust utility.

Key responsibilities:

Create user-centered designs by considering market analysis, data, customer feedback, user research and technical constraints/opportunities.
Quickly and thoroughly create user flows, wireframes, design mockups, and prototypes to effectively conceptualize new product initiatives.
Relentlessly simplify and distill complex processes into intuitive and elegant UI.
Establish and maintain detailed user-interface patterns and specifications—working closely with developers to see your design through to deployment.
Communicate complex, interactive design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
Ability to create interactive experiences with prototyping software or by hand
Understanding of HTML, Javascript and CSS that informs design and interaction decisions
Desire to work in a start-up style environment, where iteration is encouraged
Visual design acumen demonstrated through owning product design end-to-end
Proven ability to work cross-team and synthesize feedback and input from business leaders, product management, and engineering
Experience designing digital advertising solutions or enterprise products
Experience with designing products for global markets.
Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills including the ability to communicate complex, interactive design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionUser Experience Designer, Hearst Newspapers
Hearst Newspapers is seeking a user experience designer to join its Experience Design team.
The UX designer will work closely with design, product, and engineering teams on all aspects of the digital newspapers business. In particular, the designer will elevate the experience of Hearst’s marketing technology solutions, including subscription and identity management platforms. This person will also have an opportunity to contribute to a design system that powers reader experiences on Hearst’s apps and websites.
The ideal candidate has 3-5 years of experience in interaction design or user experience design, is comfortable presenting and defending recommendations to stakeholders, is willing to work in close collaboration with product and engineering teams, and is excited about solving UX problems through testing and iteration.
Responsibilities
 Design highly usable experiences to remove hurdles in identity and subscription management flows.
 Identify pain points in existing experiences across all of Hearst’s user-facing platforms.
 Design highly scalable and repeatable solutions for reader engagement on Hearst’s websites and apps.
 Help maintain and evolve Hearst Newspapers’ design system and product design language.
 Validate assumptions and hypotheses through research and usability testing, and present and defend designs and concepts to product
stakeholders.
 Articulate requirements through the use of wireframes, prototypes, and dev-ready designs.
 Execute detailed and thoughtful designs, inclusive of user states and error handling. Exceptional attention to detail; able to deliver polished, organized, and clean design files for use in software development.
An Ideal Candidate has the following qualities:
 Ability to handle projects from concept to completion.
 Willingness to partner and collaborate with Engineering and QA teams to bring experiences to life
 Is organized, able to act independently, and able to switch rapidly between different projects in a fast-paced environment
 Has basic knowledge of front-end web programming languages, including html, CSS and javascript.
 Is comfortable with design and prototyping software (sketch, figma, invision, etc)
 Experience with user testing tools
 Experience designing ecommerce flows
 Knowledge of web accessibility best practices
 Willingness to take risks and a hunger to shape the future of news.

Degree Level :

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionThe Company
Cover Genius is a global Insurtech with a vision to protect all the customers of the world’s largest online companies. Partners such as Booking.com, eBay, Shipstation and AXS have integrated XCover, our insurance distribution platform that enables companies in a wide range of industries to sell or distribute any line of insurance in any country.

Our team and products have been recognised with dozens of awards including by the Financial Times who ranked Cover Genius as the #1 fastest growing company in APAC in 2020. Our diverse team across 10 countries and many language groups commits itself to diverse cultural programs, in particular “CG Gives” which makes social entrepreneurs out of us all and funds development initiatives in global communities.
Our People are Bold, Authentic, Purposeful and Inspired
Our People are not Perfect, Traditional, Complacent or Cautious
About the Role
We are seeking an experienced and energetic UI/UX Designer to be based in our San Francisco office. This is a fantastic opportunity to work within an innovative tech business in one of the world's largest and oldest industries that really needs the change that we're bringing in conjunction with our partners.
You will be the UI/UX Designer responsible for crafting engaging user experience concepts for new and existing partner integrations. Reporting to the Head of Design and working closely with the Partner Services team, you will use your human-centered design approach to provide our partners - the largest online companies globally - with solutions for their millions of customers.
Skills & experience you bring to the table
Minimum of 5+ years experience in UX/UI design
Solid experience designing interactive UI solutions in software-only environments in collaboration with a variety of business teams
Expertise in Figma and standard design software such as Adobe Suite etc
Strong portfolio with a proven track record at delivering high quality UX/UI design and able to evidence the impact on customer experience and conversion rates
Experience working in an agile/scrum development process, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams
Experience in delivering solutions for large scale e-commerce projects
Experience in working with design systems
Working knowledge of HTML and CSS
Experienced in delivering interactive prototypes
Experienced with video editing and animation
Experienced in fast paced environments, delivering solutions at short notice
Experienced in working with marketing and content teams to provide design deliverables for campaigns and other projects
Why Cover Genius?
Cover Genius not only cares about being the best in our industry, we care about our team. We’re a business that understands life can be fluid and so we flex to ensure we provide the environment to suit that. What does that mean?
Flexible Work Environment - we are outcome focussed and understand that for our people to perform at their best flexibility is critical. Soon after the declaration of the COVID-19 global pandemic the entire CG team was granted an extra 15 days of Wellness Leave to take throughout 2020.
Employee Stock Options - we want our people to share in our success, we reward them with ownership for their contribution in creating a world-class company.
Work with like-minded people who are passionate about both the work we're doing and giving back. Our CG Gives programs enables us to all become philanthropists through our peer recognition and rewards system.
Unlimited leave. It's easier and more flexible for everyone.
Social Initiatives - pictures speak a thousand words!
Sound interesting? If you think you have the best composition of the above, send us your resume and let's chat!
job_descriptions.52907e4d89919a11:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJob Description – UX Designer

At our client, the UX Designer works closely with users, product managers, and engineering to understand and translate user needs, business requirements, and technical limitations into great products. Using the tools of the trade, the UX Designer conceives of and conducts user research, interviews, and surveys; translates findings into user flows and journey maps; and creates sites maps, wireframes, and prototypes. The UX Designer, in collaboration with product management and engineering, design the overall functionality of our products. The UX Designer is responsible for design choices that deliver excellent user experiences based on research, heuristics, usability standards, and user feedback.

Roles and Responsibilities
Translate concepts into storyboards, mockups, prototypes, and designs that lead to intuitive and delightful user experiences.
Facilitate the realization of the product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and testing user experiences for digital products, both mobile, desktop and web applications.
Collaborate closely with product managers, front-end developers and other solution team members to flesh out task flows and user experience.
Make strategic design and user experience decisions related to core and new functionality and features.
Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.
Take a user-centered design approach, rapidly test, and constantly iterate your designs.
You will assist in creating and maintaining our design standards, reference materials and style guide in conjunction with the marketing team.
Basic Qualifications and/or Experience
UX and/or interaction design experience working on complex digital solutions and applications.
Healthcare payments or revenue cycle management experience is a plus
Exposed to and understanding of native mobile and/or responsive web design.
Expertise in key design tools such as Adobe XD or equivalent a must
CSS, HTML, and Bootstrap skills are a valued-plus.
Prior work with agile product and engineering teams, focused on iterative collaboration in developing and implementing designs.
Demonstrated abilities in producing quick, low-fidelity sketches; synthesizing real user feedback into designs; creating click-through prototypes to test and validate working hypotheses with users; storytelling and presenting to users and team members.
Highly motivated, results-driven, passionate about user experience and design
Shows and shares work early and often
Seeks and accepts critiques – offers critiques respectfully.
Collaborative and desiring to work in a dynamic, team-based environment.
Possesses portfolio of previous work that demonstrates understanding and abilities in UX design.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionReal Capital Analytics is seeking a lead UI/UX Designer who is obsessed with customer experience and has a passion for the digitization of commercial real estate and finance industry.
As part of our in-house team, you will work alongside two other designers to interview clients, complete design sprints, design experience and interfaces, and create UI/UX assets from initial brief through to final execution. You will work closely with Product, Clients, Internal Stakeholders, and Development teams in an agile environment. The lead UI/UX Designer must have strong knowledge of UI/UX and familiarity of web technologies.
The role will predominantly focus on B2B UI/UX design and so the successful applicant will have extensive experience in a B2B UI/UX design role. An understanding of commercial real estate and finance will be helpful in this position, but not necessarily a prerequisite.
Responsibilities
Drive user-centered design adoption in multiple work streams
Design user flows in web, mobile, and proprietary software settings
Gather requirements from internal and external stakeholders and contribute to the product roadmap in collaboration with product owners and developers
Conduct qualitative research to gain an understanding of reasons, opinions, and motivations of users using unstructured or semi-structured techniques
Create mock-ups, wireframes and prototypes ahead of development
Test new and existing products using prototypes, both internally and with external clients
Prototype new functionality and products, both for desktop and mobile to aid product development
Work closely with the product team to provide user experience input
Ensure a cohesive and consistent experience across our branded software suite
Requirements
Minimum of 5 years of UI/UX experience, preferably for B2B SaaS products
Ability to own and articulate design decisions
Understanding of usability and responsive design best practices
Proficiency with design tools such as Adobe XD and Figma
Knowledge of HTML5, CSS, Javascript is a plus
Experience designing in an Agile environment that includes SaaS and B2B products preferred
Commercial real estate and finance industry experience preferred
Portfolio or examples showcasing experience in planning and creating intuitive digital experiences should be submitted with application

About Capgemini
Capgemini is a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services. The Group is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year+ heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company of 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of €17billion.
Visit us at www.capgemini.com. People matter, results count.
What We Offer
Your career matters to you and is important to us too. Because your goals and needs are constantly evolving, we offer visibility, leeway and support to help you grow and progress in your career. This approach builds notably on our comprehensive competency framework, our personal development, training and career management programs, and our University innovative and business-focused learning curriculums.
We promote a culture of diversity. We believe working with talented individuals from different backgrounds and points of view is a strategic advantage and an ongoing opportunity. Diversity enriches our creative solutions and adds value for our clients.
With the digital tech sector growing at a rapid pace and women significantly underrepresented in the industry, we are determined to inspire and recruit more women into technology and build diverse teams that reflect the clients we serve.
Our Shared values have been at the heart of the group since our formation. They are honesty, boldness, trust, freedom, team spirit, modesty and fun. These values influence the way we meet client needs while respecting the regulatory requirements of each country in which we operate, and the way we promote ethically sound practices within Capgemini and in our partnerships.
Capgemini is committed to building a workforce of employees with diverse backgrounds and work experiences. We strongly encourage women, veterans and active military service personnel to apply.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionReonomy leverages big data, partnerships and machine learning to connect the fragmented, disparate world of commercial real estate. By providing unparalleled access to property intelligence, Reonomy products empower individuals, teams, and companies to unlock insights and discover new opportunities.
Headquartered in New York, Reonomy has raised $128 million from top investors, including Sapphire Ventures, Bain Capital, Softbank, Primary Ventures, Georgian Partners, Wells Fargo Strategic Capital, Citi Ventures, and Untitled Investments. Our clients represent the biggest names in CRE, including Newmark Knight Frank, CBRE, Cushman & Wakefield, and Tishman Speyer.
If you're excited by growth, innovation and the ability to shape one of the biggest markets, join us as our journey is just beginning!
ABOUT THE ROLE:
The Product & User Experience team is searching for our next UX Designer to join our fast-growing team. As a Product Designer, you'll be an advocate for our users while directly impacting business goals by working on the most well-designed web app in the Commercial Real Estate (CRE) space. In this role, you will partner with product managers, researchers, and engineers to lead design and tackle complex problems to deliver enterprise-level solutions. We will look to this person to be a user expert who is passionate about uncovering the needs of our sophisticated users to innovate and execute on product initiatives. If you're an entrepreneurial design professional with experience working on SaaS products - this job is for you!

In order to be considered for this opportunity all candidate must include a portfolio with personal design contributions or work samples. If a password is required to access your portfolio, you must include it in your application.
Responsibilities Include:
Partner with product managers, researchers, and engineers to launch user-centered products
Help define and prioritize both long and short-term vision and roadmap for R&D squads
Lead the design of new products and features across the entire design lifecycle
Partner with researchers to better understand user needs and conduct usability tests
Create detailed workflows and diagrams that define user experience pathways clearly
Build wireframes and prototypes for complex web and mobile applications
Effectively communicate research findings and design deliverables to internal team members
Act as an internal evangelist and educator on behalf of our users
ABOUT YOU:
BA/BS or advanced degree in Interaction Design, HCI, Graphic Design, or related field
1-5 years of professional experience in user experience / product design
Experience working with complex SaaS products with a sophisticated user set
Up-to-date on interaction and visual design best practices
Demonstrated knowledge of user research and evaluation techniques
Fast learner, self-motivated, and detail-oriented
Excellent leadership, communication, and teamwork skills
High levels of empathy, humility, and self-awareness
Background designing products for the financial, real estate, or geospatial industries a plus
Benefits:
Competitive salary
100% coverage on medical, vision and dental health plans
Company stock options
Unlimited Vacation
401k plan
Access to our Continuing Education Stipend
Perks: WFH package, FREE ClassPass membership, FREE Headspace premium membership, FREE Citi Bike membership, & team outings!

We connect people to what matters most to them; texting with friends, advertising that resonates, or binge watching their favorite show. Our differentiated approach centers around technologies that push the envelope and deliver the ultimate customer experience. We're building a workforce that attracts and retains the best talent, not only to meet the needs of our customers, but that also reflects the diverse communities we serve. We're not the only ones who have seen it; we've recently been recognized by Forbes as one of America's Best Employers as well as by the Human Rights Campaign, DiversityInc Magazine, and Cablefax for our diversity & inclusion program.
Responsibilities
We are looking for a talented fulltime UX Designer to work on Optimum.com and Suddenlink.com to improve our customers and prospects user experience. You will combine interfaces and workflows to enhance user experience.
In this role, you should be an analytical and creative designer who is able to grasp user needs and solve problems. A strong portfolio of successful UX and other technical projects is essential.
Ultimately, you will make our product more user-friendly and intuitive to attract and retain customers.
Responsibilities
Understand product specifications and user psychology
Conduct concept and usability testing and gather feedback
Create personas through user research and data
Define the right interaction model and evaluate its success
Translate conceptual designs into wireframes, mockups and prototypes around customer needs that lead to intuitive user experiences.
Identify UX problems and devise creative solutions (e.g. usability, findability)
Collaborate with UX Strategist other team members to continually devise and implement A/B tests to iteratively improve the performance KPIs of designs
Communicate design ideas and prototypes to developers
Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs
Keep abreast of competitor products and industry trends

Qualifications / Requirements

Proven experience as a UX Designer, UI designer or similar role
Strong portfolio of design projects
Background in project management and research
Familiarity with interaction design and information architecture
Proficient in design software

The ability to iterate your designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently

Analytical mind with a business acumen
The ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams
BSc in Design, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field
Preferred Experience
3+ years of UX design experience
Jira experience
The ability to lead, collaborate, and influence (with and without formal authority) engineering, design, and product management teams
Familiarity with Adobe Analytics, GA 360, and ContentSquare to make the right recommendations.
Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry's latest trends and technologies.
A self-starter who can manage projects in a fast-paced environment and remain focused amidst frequently changing requirements

job_descriptions.29e8f1cb8d5aabe0: Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAt Directive, we take our product (world-class performance marketing) serious. Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionPutting our clients and their needs first remains the top goal for our User Experience team. As a User Experience Associate, you'll be responsible for project work as well as helping shape the direction of our teams. Working as a valued member of a multidisciplinary design team, you'll be involved in complex projects, and will participate in user research and design planning to respond to feedback.
In addition to primary project work, you'll contribute to design systems such as our pattern library, visual design library, and motion library, as well as mentor others on the team. You'll hone your communication skills by presenting your work to diverse stakeholders and the broader technology organization.
This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
Three to five years of UX experience
Exceptional skills with standard UX software such as Sketch and Invision
Experience with generative and evaluative research methods, motion design or video or an interest in learning those skills
User-centric design approach that involves rapid testing and iteration of designs
Understanding of how design translates to code
Ability to use prototyping tools to convey design intent
Demonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities on tight deadlines without compromising quality
Understanding of accessibility and the ability to apply that to designs
Open minded, collaborative and flexible work style
Comfortable receiving feedback and critiques
Strong communication skills with the ability to articulate the value of UX and the rationale behind your research process and design decisions

To be considered for this position, you must have a portfolio available for review.JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. Job detailsJob TypeFull-timePart-timeFull Job DescriptionYou Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible - and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
The American Express Mobile Team are looking for a talented and passionate mobile product Designer to join our team in New York. The successful candidate will have experience leading digital initiatives and the ideation & development of mobile products and services.
The Global Mobile team is responsible for the product strategy, UX/UI and delivery of mobile apps for American Express Card members globally. This includes the Amex Mobile app available on iOS and Android in 20 markets around the world and used by millions of customers each month. Our team is a combination of high-performing design, product and marketing teams who are responsible for the definition and delivery of features in the Amex App – bringing data-driven and customer focused insights into our design & development process.
The senior product Designer will work with Principle Designers from concept to completion of 2-4 product work streams for the American Express Mobile App team based in New York. The candidate will be responsible for delivering user-based outcomes in the mobile product portfolio and for the personal and career development of Product Designers in the new New York design team.
THE ROLE
Take responsibility for the user interface: identify problems, propose solutions, recommend implementations, and execute UX/UI solutions to improve the user experience.
Create pixel-perfect, world-class user interfaces and original, eye-catching visual design.
Deliver high quality work on schedules in a dynamic, agile product environment.
Produce interactive prototypes for internal experimentation and usability testing, and test UI in a rigorous, data-driven way.
Demonstrate a command of usability and accessibility standards in partnership with visual and interface design disciplines and principles.
Have a broad experience and a deep understanding of users to recommend UX/UI features that solve customer needs.
Write intuitive style guides and design specifications with a focus towards engineering implementation.
Familiarity with Sketch, invision, Adobe’s creative suite applications and other prototyping tool.

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
Minimum Qualifications
Service Design / Design Thinking
Designing for Native Mobile Platforms (iOS and Android)
UX / Interaction Design
UI / Visual Design
Communication and Collaboration with Product, Engineering, Business peers and other Stakeholders
Proven track record of success in several shipped products as measured by Design Team Goals
Typically 5+ years in the industry

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionNew York, NY | Full Time


CKM Analytix is looking for a UI/UX Designer to join our product team. The UI/UX Designer will translate complex business ideas, needs, and goals into user-friendly UI solutions for our operational data analytics products. The UI/UX Designer will report directly to the Senior Product Manager.

Develop wireframes in Balsamiq to convey early ideas for products and client deliverables
Evolve wireframes into precise, high-fidelity mockups using Figma
Collaborate with engineers to incorporate prototypes into production, staying in close touch throughout the development process to ensure smooth, high-quality implementation of designs and address edge cases that arise
Further develop, maintain, and socialize CKM’s design system and style guides
Ensure our products adhere to accessibility standards and that our microcopy is intuitive, friendly, and tone-consistent
Work with Data Scientists to make complex visualizations more user-friendly

A great grasp of layout, hierarchy, typography, and color
Proficiency in Figma or other similar mockup solutions; comfort across Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, Premiere) is a plus

Our team is diverse and intellectually curious, made up of people that you’ll genuinely enjoy spending time with

We are a meritocracy and consistently promote from within
We move fast and are not afraid of evolving our tools, technology and thinking

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job Description
8+ years of design experience
An available online portfolio
In-depth understanding of industry design tools (Ex. Adobe Creative Cloud, Sketch, InVision)

Amazon’s Custom Advertising organization is looking for a talented and passionate Sr. UX Designer to create first-class customer experiences both on and offline within the team dedicated to creating advertising solutions for Financial Services and Telecommunication brands.

From inception through launch, you will be a design owner, responsible for delivering ambitious concepts, and using data to iterate and improve, translating needs and constraints into simple, intuitive, customer-focused solutions. You will define and be equally strong at concept and execution, articulating end-to-end experiences, and turn that vision into high-quality design deliverables such as user interface designs for voice and screen, interaction models, design specs, prototypes, and interactive advertising campaigns. You balance your passion for inspired, compelling, elegant and intuitive designs with a highly analytical nature, precise execution, and a drive to design, build and deliver.

As part of this team, you will work under the guidance of a Creative Director and collaborate closely with other creatives (including art directors, copywriters, and fellow designers), design technologists, and program managers. Additionally, you will be responsible for communicating with both internal partners (including Sales, product, and engineering teams) and external advertisers to deliver innovative results through all stages from concept development to final execution.

Responsibilities

Be customer obsessed. Think strategically.

Dive deep on the target audience (considering a brand's target audience as well as Amazon shopper behavior) to find meaningful insights to inform creative strategy and approach to solutions
Understand human behavior. Focus the work on solving real customer problems by putting yourself in the customer’s shoes; if you wouldn’t read/watch/use/share your solution, they won’t either

Insist on the highest standards of creative.

Collaborate across multiple teams to drive executions of all types (video, digital, voice integration, AR, VR, etc.)
Work with program managers to ensure timelines, resources, and budget allocations meet project scope
Deliver multi-channel brand solutions of the highest standard that balance advertiser goals (KPIs) with customer goals (frictionless commerce)
Ensure flawless execution, from exquisite design, to on-time, error-free delivery

Take ownership of the business.

Maintain a high-level view across the business. Understand the complexities, dependencies and opportunities beyond our immediate team
Understand the Amazon Advertising platform and how to sell it, work within the existing framework as well as push new functionalities and adapting with the business as it evolves over time
Create ideas and executions that can become scalable executions (and revenue streams) in the future
From concept to execution, know the tools, steps, and policies of the solutions you deploy
Solve problems when you can, only escalate when you can't

Take ownership of client and agency relationships.

Work with client services to build strategic business partnerships with your clients, inspiring and exciting them about our creative work and our delivery on their brand promise
Ensure your clients and agency partners know you and value your input and tenure on their business
Use your understanding to create a clear vision for creative solutions and ensure this vision is clearly communicated and understood with both clients, planning, and the account team
Articulate and defend strategic thinking and creative direction to internal and external stakeholders.
Deliver high standards of client satisfaction, measuring through feedback, open communication, surveys, response to campaigns and continuously adapting and adjusting approaches to benefit client need

Earn trust. Be a thought leader.

Be a creative ambassador. Help build a culture of creative thinking and innovation with internal teams, client and agency partners.
Ensure clear communication upwards and downwards within the team and set expectations you will meet by managing your time and projects, being mindful of those you are collaborating with as much as deadlines
Educate, inspire and motivate colleagues across the organization to help them understand, protect, and sell the strongest creative ideas to clients
Review market developments and industry trends and identify potential opportunities for Amazon Advertising
Experience in product design, UX design, user research, interaction design, and/or advertising
Has a deep understanding of Financial Services and Telecommunication brands
Data-driven and obsessed with measurable impact of a campaign
Strong portfolio demonstrating UX thinking and process, visual design skills, and interactive/digital advertising experiences that solve for a customer/business problem
Excellent presentation skills and interactive storytelling ability
Strong organization and collaboration skills
Exceptional at your craft and a critical project owner
A fascination with innovation and technology
Self-starter. Ability to manage ambiguity, work autonomously, and multi-task

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us
job_descriptions.8a7de5ad2fe552ba:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionThe Organization
JUST Capital a nonprofit organization that is the leading platform for measuring and improving corporate performance in the stakeholder economy. Our mission is to build an economy that works for all Americans by helping companies improve how they serve all their stakeholders – workers, customers, communities, the environment, and shareholders. We believe that business and markets can and must be a greater force for good and that by shifting the resources of the $19 trillion private sector, we can address systemic issues at scale, including income inequality and lack of opportunity. Guided by the priorities of the public, our research, rankings, indexes, and data-driven tools help measure and improve corporate performance in the stakeholder economy. Our flagship product is America’s Most JUST Companies, which is an annual ranking of companies in the Russell 1000 Index. The top 100 companies – or the JUST 100 – are published annually through our partnership with Forbes.
JUST Capital is supported by some of the country's premier foundations, including the Ford Foundation and The Robert Wood Johnson Foundation, and has forged partnerships with an array of elite research institutions, including MIT, Stanford, and The Harris Poll. The organization is chaired by hedge fund manager and philanthropist Paul Tudor Jones and is led by a high-profile board.
UX Designer
We are looking for a UX Designer to join our growing, multidisciplinary team focusing on website, data visualizations and marketing collateral. You will form and drive the vision and building blocks of the JUST Capital user experience. You will work closely with the research, product, and marketing teams to drive key aspects of product definition, design, execution, and test.
Essential Job Functions/Responsibilities:
Supporting the team in exploring, refining, and delivering production-ready designs for products, the ongoing evolution of our website, as well as program-related microsites.
Crafting deliverables that create clarity throughout the product development and design process: developing frameworks, user flows, mockups, prototypes, final visuals, and html views.
Preparing artifacts for user research, and participating in user research sessions.
Documenting and maintaining user interface design specification and templates.
Requirements (must be able to demonstrate with past experience)
4-year college degree or equivalent work experience.
3+ years of strong graphic design experience.
Solid visual design foundation.
An outstanding eye for detail and consistency, combined with a deep understanding of branding, typography, color, usability, grid systems and responsive frameworks.
Proficient in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, Zeplin, Invision.
Excellent working knowledge of Keynote, PowerPoint and Google Slides.
The ability to both work autonomously and as part of a team.
Able to effectively communicate and coordinate with other disciplines to ensure the visual design is communicating the desired message.
Skills that will give you an advantage over other candidates:
Track record of designing intuitive, engaging interactive data visualizations (a portfolio you can share is a plus!)
Experience with HTML, CSS and/or JavaScript
Extremely strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proven track record of solving challenging problems in both academia and industry
JUST Capital is a small organization staff-wise and operates with a nimble, entrepreneurial mindset. As such, in addition to the above responsibilities, candidates should have professional work approaches, be self-starters, and possess well-developed organizational skills honed to allow them to be effective and resourceful in a fast-paced workplace. Further, adaptability, good colleagueship, working with cross-functional teams to deliver projects on tight deadlines, and internal community building are important attributes of the JUST Capital culture.
Benefits & Work Environment
The compensation and benefits package at JUST Capital has been thoughtfully designed to ensure we model what we measure when it comes to just business behaviors. Benefits include:
Best-in-class health, vision, and dental care benefits for you and your family including membership in One Medical Group for on-demand primary care and access to Health Advocate, the nation’s leading healthcare advocacy & assistance company.
Respect for work-life balance, including a flexible work from home policy.
20 personal time off days, 5 sick days, as well as 15 holidays a year – and we encourage you to take them!
Other paid time off when the office generally closes the last week of the year.
Fully paid parental leave of up to 12 weeks.
401(k) retirement plan, with employer matching of 100% up to 4% of salary.
Subsidized gym memberships, Citi Bike membership, and pre-tax commuter benefits.
To Apply
To be considered for this position, submit your resume and cover letter addressing why you are interested in working for a nonprofit like JUST Capital and specific skills you would bring to this role. NOTE: Applications without a cover letter will NOT be considered.
JUST Capital is an Equal Opportunity Employer –
people with disabilities are encouraged to apply

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionGainful is hiring a Lead Designer!

Company Overview:

Gainful is changing the way people shop for nutrition products to support their active lifestyle and help them achieve their fitness goals. Launched in 2017, Gainful is backed by some of the world's best venture investors (including Y Combinator, Dorm Room Fund, BrandProject, Courtside VC, AF Ventures, and Round13 Capital). Gainful combines personalization with the highest quality ingredients to make sports nutrition accessible for every body. Our first 3 products are Personalized Protein Powder, Hydration, and Pre-Workout.

Job Description:

We are looking for a multi-talented designer to join as Gainful's Lead Designer. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with a portfolio that spans digital UI/UX (web and mobile), typography, graphic design, photography, videography, animation, print media, social media, packaging design, and copywriting. In short, nothing visual will leave our office without first crossing your desk. (We know you may have different strengths in each of these, and Brand Design is definitely the most important). We want someone we can trust to push the creative vision for the brand forward and will have the autonomy to do so!


As Lead Designer, you will be responsible for high-level brand decisions and art direction, as well as getting your hands dirty at the pixel level every day. You will work closely with our CEO, CTO, Brand Director, Director of Operations, and Head of Growth to produce assets across all our channels. Your creative will help realize cross-functional strategies and meet business objectives, the position is highly collaborative, and requires strong people-skills. Your entire body of work will be everything that consumers see across every channel, including digital product, emails, digital and physical ads, social media, packaging, and print.

Finally, you will also play a role in sourcing, evaluating, and managing any creative partners (photographers, videographers, stylists, agencies, freelancers etc). You will also be expected to build and lead a multi-disciplinary team at scale. Eventually, we will have multiple full-time roles available for each of the functions that you will initially own (i.e. UI/UX designer, social media manager, copywriter).

Gainful recently raised a round of funding, and we've set aggressive goals for 2020.

Responsibilities include

In partnership with growth, tech and brand, Understanding the needs of our Gainful Customers and planning and running user tests and other design research to inform design choices.
Combine UX thinking with design execution, to produce usable, intuitive, and beautiful user interfacesHelp build out design processes, tools, and cultureAds: Format creative for Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, SMS, affiliate banners, and Google Display adsWeb: Produce full-fidelity desktop and mobile web designs for our development team to implementPrint: Design direct mail pieces, inserts, stickers, marketing collateral, and postcardsEmail: Develop, design, and maintain brand standards for visual communicationSocial Media: Develop content for our social channels; concept, shoot, develop, and edit all your own projects. Once a good foundation is established, spearhead the hiring of Gainful's first Social Media Manager.Physical Product: Create mockups as well as final dielines for new product packagingPhotography: Coordinate and direct studio/outdoor photo shoots for image assets, image editing, video editing.Content: Work with Brand Director and our Head of Growth to develop and execute an SEO-friendly visual aesthetic for all content marketingAd hoc: Presentation design and company swag

Required:

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionEducator, User Experience Designer

BrainStation is a global leader in digital skills training and development, offering a 12-week Diploma program in User Experience Design. BrainStation is currently seeking a UX professional to lead the delivery of our program through online and in-person teaching. BrainStation Educators are given the unique opportunity to teach, research, and further develop their skills, while teaching in a dynamic, project-based setting.

Responsibilities

Teach our 12-week User Experience Design Diploma program
Facilitate in-class activities, group discussions, demos, design challenges, and mentor the next wave of UX talent
Co-create BrainStation's full-time User Experience Design Program that will positively impact the lives and careers of hundreds of individuals across our campuses
Actively work on writing and researching new content to teach the most up to teach the most up to date design skills to our students
Apply BrainStation's "Agile Education" methodologies to the program to continuously improve the educational experience for students
Constantly improve your own skills and apply these skills in collaboration with other BrainStation Educators in order to build the digital platform and tools needed to effectively deliver educational material
Define the education experience of the future

Successful candidates will have

3+ years experience as a User Experience Designer and a Bachelor's degree/Diploma relevant to the subject matter OR 8+ years work experience in the vocation
Experience building and leading technical teams
Expertise working with industry standard tools used to design and prototype software solutions, including Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign and InVision.
A deep understanding of design thinking and the frameworks used by organizations to design highly usable software solutions
Experience teaching, mentoring, managing projects and/or leading teams.
An empathetic, inclusive, enthusiastic personality, and is someone who enjoys helping others and facilitating learning
A proven ability to work under pressure and meeting deadlines
A strong work ethic with the utmost integrity and desire to excel and succeed
A sincere passion for education and creating positive learning experiences for others

About BrainStation

BrainStation is the global leader in digital skills training and development, with courses, workshops, events, and corporate training offered online and in state-of-the-art campuses in New York, London, Toronto, and Vancouver. Founded in 2012, BrainStation has worked with over 400 instructors from the most innovative companies, developing cutting-edge, real-world digital training for more than 100,000 professionals and some of the largest corporations in the world. By 2025, BrainStation will have innovation hubs around the world and will be empowering young minds, powerful politicians, fortune 500 CEOs, and the newest wave of disruptive innovators, on campuses and online.

Bonus: Have you been to a campus or joined an online learning opportunity? We are actively seeking individuals that believe in lifelong learning and that have taken part in our On Campus or Online offerings.

NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest.

BrainStation is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Job detailsSalary$130,000 - $180,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionOverview:

Do you want to build an award winning product? Do you want to be recognized as a leader in UX and consumer finance? Then you will really like the idea of working to launch our new business that is an important new initiative of a larger, very profitable, rapidly growing enterprise. Strategic Financial Solutions is a middle-market financial services company that is diversifying through our new Interactive Products group. You will have the opportunity to influence, launch and grow an exciting new brand in the digital financial services space. Join our new Interactive Products leadership team and help us build a business that will positively impact the financial life journey of millions of Americans.
We believe that financial stability is a vital part of family well-being. We want to positively affect American families’ financial journey by providing useful advice along with digital tools and financial utilities. We also want to strengthen our country’s social fabric by helping more families achieve financial wellness and stability. We need a great team to help execute our vision.
Strategic Financial Solutions is hiring a Senior UX Designer to join our team and help develop new interactive financial technology (FinTech) content and products to help people achieve financial stability.
This person will lead a customer-centered design approach in developing the most innovative and usable digital experiences across all digital platforms. In this role, you will handle delivering user experiences that are measurable and drive higher conversion and satisfaction across our emerging platforms. You will work closely with product managers, engineers, and our key business partners to solve complex business challenges and customer interactions. You will provide direction and work with the overall team to evolve our user experiences and visual design across multiple devices and platforms. This is an exciting opportunity to bring cutting edge UX practices to a high growth property, and to build and lead a world-class user experience function.
Salary range: ~130-180K annually, dependent upon experience/impressions.
Responsibilities:
Define the overall UX strategy and vision for Strategic’s Interactive Products across all platforms and aligned with our broader business strategy
Build and lead a world class UX and Visual design function that solves exciting and challenging UX design problems for a passionate user base of millions
Advocate for integrated, consistent UI throughout all our product experiences
Develop a cohesive set of design principles and patterns that can be re-utilized across of our touch points
Work closely with Product Management to effectively collaborate in the exploration of new, innovative product ideas while refining existing features
Define UX processes that achieve both quality and rapid time to market; partner with other departments to optimize and improve efficiencies across teams
Design and lead user testing and usability research, effectively managing internal and external resources to deliver insights and actionable results
Work closely with sales and marketing to design innovative sales opportunities for advertisers
Qualifications:
5-7+ years experience designing large scale digital products across multiple platforms with specific prior experience with both web and mobile applications
Demonstrable track record of creating crafting elegant, user centric experiences that drive significant customer loyalty
Enough technical and business knowledge to engage with cross-functional teams to create useful products that well designed and able to drive revenue
Leadership of world-class user experience across platforms for a consumer product
Proficient in the development of design systems using Sketch, Figma or equivalents
Proficient in use of prototyping tools such as Principal, Framer or equivalent
Conversational understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript, better still experienced in usage of these foundational technologies
Use of user A/B testing to optimize user journeys to desired outcomes
Strong UX instincts and ability to create proposed solutions for business problems
Strong examples of successful user experience design in a consumer web setting across desktop and mobile web and native apps, with proven ability to use motion and animations to help create a polished appearance and to achieve desired UX outcomes
Sharp design sense and a logical approach to challenging UX problems
About Strategic:
Strategic Financial Solutions is a leading consumer finance company that specializes in helping people that have too much credit card debt. We were recently named the 21st Best Company to Work for in New York by Best Companies to Work For and have been certified as a Great Place to Work 4 times. Additional honors include being named, two times, as one of the 50 fastest growing companies in New York City and to the prestigious Inc. 500 list as one of the 500 fastest growing companies in the United States.
Strategic is committed to hiring, training, cultivating, promoting, and celebrating an environment where we have a welcoming and fulfilling place for all people to call home. job_descriptions.350a37f529852122:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionWe are looking for a Senior User Experience Designer to help create outstanding digital products for our clients. For this position, we have a need for someone with a strong background in user research. We build custom software for private-sector clients. Typically these software products a) generate revenue; b) touch our clients’ customers; and c) exist in a competitive space, i.e., our clients’ customers have a range of products to choose from, so our work really needs to stand out. Oftentimes we research, design, and build brand new products, but some clients also engage us to rethink and redesign existing applications.

Our clients expect us to be comfortable balancing design with business and technology perspectives, to understand how the design decisions impact these two dimensions in order to build a successful product, and to collaborate effectively.
This role will be based in either the Greater Boston Area, the Dallas-Forth Worth Metroplex, or the NYC Metropolitan Area.

We are 3PILLAR GLOBAL
We build breakthrough software products that power digital businesses. We are an innovative product development partner whose solutions drive rapid revenue, market share, and customer growth for industry leaders in Software and SaaS, Media and Publishing, Information Services, and Retail.

Our key differentiator is our Product Mindset. Our development teams focus on building for outcomes and all of our team members around the globe are trained on the Product Mindset’s core values – Minimize Time to Value, Solve For Need, and Excel at Change. Our teams apply this mindset to build digital products that are customer-facing and revenue-generating. Our business-minded approach to agile development ensures that we align to client goals from the earliest conceptual stages through market launch and beyond.
Responsibilities:
Writing the user research plan so everyone understands what activities you’ll perform and what you are looking to find out;
Handling the recruiting, from writing the screener to evaluating the respondents to booking the sessions. If our client will be lining up the participants, you know how to guide them through this;
Ensuring that your studies have the right number and right mix of participants in terms of roles and experience;
Leading the research sessions, most of which will be live via video conference. You’re an expert at asking open, even-toned questions to get unbiased answers;
Distilling the findings, identifying patterns, priorities, and pain points quickly and concisely;
Communicating the findings clearly and persuasively to colleagues (usually Product and Engineering) and clients;
Using the research toolstack you’ll ensure that your plans and findings are transparent, findable and transportable in an easy to follow digital footprint;
Raising the profile and profitability of user research by helping train other designers in user research, and being an evangelist for putting the user in front of all decisions and decision makers.

Qualifications:
6+ years of experience working on complex digital products, who has the following UX skills and abilities:
Ability to gain a deep understanding of user needs and goals, communicate with cross functional product teams, and apply principles of design thinking and agile to create engaging user experiences ;
Experienced in recognizing the challenges of putting together a research initiative. You are able to handle the situations that arise when recruitment becomes challenging. You can find ways to get the research done in the face of adversity.
Proven ability to turn participant questions around and draw out a usable answer. You know when to deflect, thrust and parry feedback and comments. You have a number of methods in your toolbox that you can deploy based on the problem you are setting out to solve.
Ability to understand that no research is usable by a broader team until someone makes sense of it and you are happy to be that person. You have a keen eye for finding the needles in the haystack and seeing how those pieces fit together. You enjoy the process of pulling the curtain back and explaining what is going on behind the scenes to the rest of your team.
Highly skilled at leading the design process in a collaborative manner with cross-functional teams, gathering many ideas, and building upon each other’s ideas in an iterative way to come up with the best solutions, ensuring its all grounded in the research you’ve shared.
Ability to craft your data into many different forms of communication and shareability. You love crafting interactive behaviors that engage and delight users, and stay up to date on the latest techniques.
Familiarity with these tools (or comparable ones):
Sketch
Marvel
Abstract
Lookback (recording & sharing research videos)
UserInterviews.com (screener, scheduling)
Trello (feature prioritization/card sorting)
Framer or other prototyping apps (bonus)

3Pillar Benefits, What We Offer:
Employer funded medical plan for employees and their dependents.
Employer funded dental plan for employees and their dependents.
401K retirement savings plan with 100% match of the first 3% of employee contributions and 50% of the next 2%.
Company paid disability and life insurance and the option to purchase additional coverage for yourself and family.
Unlimited PTO Policy.
11 company-paid Holidays.
Business casual atmosphere.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionHave you ever rented an apartment? Wish the process could be better? Enter Funnel. We may not be able to lower the rent, but we can make the process of renting an apartment as easy as buying socks on Amazon. How do we do it? We create cloud-based marketing and leasing software that delivers the ultimate rental experience for everyone involved in the process.
Funnel is in the process of transforming the real estate industry through cutting-edge technology built, sold and supported by the most passionate people you’ll ever meet. We’re looking for a product designer who gets jazzed about turning complicated and monotonous tasks into delightful and simple workflows.
This is a fully remote role though if you are in the Tampa, Florida area, you’d have the option to come into our local office.

Basic Qualifications
3+ years experience as a UX designer, interaction designer or similar role.
A design portfolio with a range of artifacts creating user-centered design solutions highlighting strong problem solving, interaction and visual design skills.
Experience with running and synthesizing UX research
Demonstrated ability to drive the design review cycle, close on design requirements and achieve consensus.
Experience shipping responsive web and native app experiences.
We use Figma and hopefully you do too.
What you will do

Partner with product managers, engineers, and other product designers to oversee the user experience of a product from conception to launch.
Create user flows, wireframes, site maps, customer journey maps, and other tools to guide the product development process.
Translate wireframes and experiences into highly-polished visual designs with attention to interaction design whilst following style and brand guidelines.
Discuss your designs with a cross-disciplinary product team and have an understanding of how your proposed solutions are built, and what their technical limitations are.
Give and solicit feedback from other designers in order to raise our bar for quality.
Bonus Points:
Experience working in real estate
Proficiency in HTML, CSS and JavaScript
Excellent communication, presentation and persuasion skills; demonstrated success in building buy-in for an innovative, bold, strategic vision.
Strong bias for action; ability to juggle multiple priorities and effectively deliver in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Willingness to roll up the sleeves and do what is necessary to meet team goals.
job_descriptions.61adbabeefaed82c:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionWe are the Institute for Integrative Nutrition (IIN) and we pioneered the Health Coaching profession! As a rapidly growing wellness platform IIN focuses on “what feeds you” in life; mind, body and career. What started as a small classroom of passionate students in a live setting in 1992, IIN is now world-renowned for its online Health Coach Training Program and other leading-edge programs on the most current and important topics in health and wellness. With a monthly audience of 2 million+ wellness seekers, over 110,000 graduates in over 175 countries worldwide, we are the undisputed leader in the field of Integrative Nutrition education, information and health coaching tools. IIN Health coaches, first learn to coach themselves then, mentor and guide clients towards nutritional and lifestyle changes to help them reach their personal health goals. We are headquartered in New York City and offer students access to a rich diversity of leading instructors committed to improving global wellness through education and prevention. Our mission is to play a crucial role in improving health and happiness, and through that process, create a ripple effect that transforms the world!
Why work for us?
You are someone who wants to be part of a rapidly growing, mission-driven company and you want to make the world a healthier and happier place! You want the culture of a start-up paired with the resources, stability and foundation of an established company with almost 30 years at the top of its field. You want to work for a company that walks the walk, with great perks and an amazing team of awesome, collaborative, and passionate colleagues!
Position Summary
As a User Experience Designer at IIN, you will be responsible for designing compelling, efficient, and innovative digital experiences, mainly contributing to our learning products and marketing sites. The ideal candidate should have experience with all parts of the Design Thinking process. Specifically, you will focus on leveraging research and data to make design decisions, creating wireframes, low and high-fidelity mockups, and interactive prototypes for stakeholder approvals and developer handoffs, as well as usability testing designs.
Responsibilities:
Understand target market and user segments and how to identify users from both
Engage with users in interviews, observations, focus groups and other data collection activities to understand their needs
Lead UI/UX aspects of user experience research and associated interface design, wireframing, and documentation for engaging, interactive, and innovative capabilities,
Generate wireframes, low and high-fidelity mockups, interactive prototypes, and behavioral specifications.
Test prototypes and products to determine challenges that users experience during the interaction
Follow design guidelines for implementation, visual language, color story, themes, CSS styles based on IIN standards
Serve as a design lead for small interdisciplinary agile teams focused on producing user-informed functional prototypes that could be tested in target markets, and
Collaborate with both internal and external colleagues and consultants to ensure on-time completion of project goals.
Required:
BS Required, preferably in UX related fields of HCI, Product Design, Computer Science or Graphic Design
Experience in Product Design tools like Figma, Axure RP or Adobe XD.
Knowledge of basic HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Invision.
At least 4 years of experience working as a UX Designer, applying learning science and design principles to the development of technology enhanced learning solutions.
Experience engaging with target market and user segments to understand their needs and aligning solutions with those needs
Ability to work collaboratively and effectively in agile teams
Ability to work collaboratively and effectively with cross-divisional stakeholder groups; can present and adapt ideas to different audiences.
Strong oral and written communication skills
Can prioritize, think critically, and see the big picture
Must be up to date on latest UX trends and best practices
Excellent time-management skills with ability to meet deadlines
Can self-manage and prioritize across multiple projects/deadlines
Excellent interpersonal skills; can give and receive constructive feedback
Flexible and able to adapt with a positive attitude
Good to Have:
Experience in the Health and Wellness industry
Experience with CMS’s such as Drupal, Strapi, Wordpress
Integrative Nutrition is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic or status protected by law.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionPrincipal Product Designer - Observability
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, our customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!
Do you think design has the power to make the world better? Are you excited by the challenge of helping people analyze and draw mission-critical insights from big data?
If so, we here at Splunk would love to hear from you!
We're looking for a Principal Product Designer to lead our Digital Experience Monitoring + Synthetics program within the Observability design team. Observability users frequently need to jump from one data source, (like APM data) to another (like logs), in order to effectively debug a performance issue. Your job is to ensure that the experience is simple, intuitive, and consistent throughout. As a product designer within our team, you’ll be designing the individual product user interfaces, as well as working closely with other designers on the team to ensure a holistic experience of navigating seamlessly within the Observability suite.
What you’ll do:
Design new experiences for Splunk’s unified Observability Suite
Craft user workflow diagrams, prototypes, wireframes and high fidelity designs
Understand technical, complex use cases and propose elegant concepts and design solutions
Collaborate and align with the Observability design team
Work with cross-functional teams throughout product development (including user research, product management, and engineering)
Work closely with engineering to ensure that design specifications are implemented
Test design concepts with customers and conduct usability studies, interview sessions
Partner with product managers, to solicit user input, and use it to craft product development efforts
Who you are and what makes you qualified:
8+ years of product experience in UX/UI Design
Experience in enabling highly technical users quickly and intuitively to analyze, and get insights from, data produced by a wide variety of services and devices
Understanding of design systems, and experience leveraging, and contributing to, design systems
Excellent visual design skills and a high level understanding of visual solutions for all screen sizes
Master crafting prototypes to communicate complex design concepts to users and project partners
Expert in using industry-standard design and prototyping tools (Figma, Adobe CC)
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Experience collaborating with other designers and departments - you’re comfortable taking and incorporating feedback from other team members
Not afraid of project or product ambiguity and willing to learn new skills
Masters degree in HCI or related Design program, or in lieu of degree
Bonus Points If You Have
An understanding of cloud infrastructure and experience with related platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform)
Experience designing for data-rich products, incorporating data visualizations
Experience working in SaaS or enterprise software

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionYour Opportunity
New Relic is the industry’s largest and most comprehensive SaaS-based observability platform built to create more perfect software. We are passionate about providing solutions and tools that help development and operations teams monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize the performance of their applications and infrastructure. And we have a ton of fun doing extraordinary work!
The Growth Marketing Team is seeking a talented UX Designer/Researcher to join our high-impact web and analytics team. In this role, you will be a key contributor on our Marketing team, responsible for designing, executing, and iterating on a UX approach that focuses on growing demand generation to drive acquisition, onboarding, monetization, organic growth, and retention across New Relic’s public web properties.
The ideal candidate has experience both researching and designing UX from ideation through post-launch analysis and continuous improvement practices, and is comfortable collaborating with business strategists, product owners, design, and development teams. The successful candidate knows how to balance being the voice of the customer when it comes to digital experience, and can also ensure designs scale appropriately from both a technical and strong Design System perspective.
What You’ll Do…
Use consultative tactics to understand the needs of multiple end user personas as they move through multifaceted stages of the user journey, with the end goal of driving conversion and retention via a user-centric approach.
Build efficient and reusable front-end systems and abstractions, as well as be familiar with existing UI frameworks.
Partner with design, research, language, and product management to build cohesive end-to-end experiences that seamlessly tie from website to product.
Actively participate in sprint planning meetings to ensure we are thinking through all requirements that are coming through the pipeline, and ensuring that these requirements fit in with a holistic and customer-driven strategy.
Identify and communicate front-end best practices.
Common tasks and systems used include: visual prototyping and wireframing, interface design, storyboarding, visual design theory, accessibility audits, and web prototyping with HTML5 and CSS.
Are comfortable in a full-stack environment, and have experience and understanding of building systematic user interfaces and data driven products.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in UX/digital design, user interface design, or quantitative/analytical field.
5+ years proven experience in UX/UI, digital marketing, web design; in-house or agency side
3+ years working closely with developer teams.
Well versed in CSS, HTML, and other common web technologies.
Experience creating custom digital experiences at the user or segment level.
Strong understanding of content management systems and designing web experiences for scale.
Experience solving cross-browser compatibility issues, and performance considerations.
Strong commitment to creating highly usable and reusable toolsets for our all of our business partners.
Experience optimizing digital interfaces for greater engagement, conversion and brand affinity, aided by A/B testing methods and technology like Optimizely, Adobe Analytics, etc.
Ability to think on your feet and make difficult calls when it comes to prioritization, decision-making, etc.
Excellent communication capabilities – written, verbal and visual/spatial.
Preferred Qualifications
Enterprise CMS experience, preferably Drupal and Wordpress.
Experience designing in the tech/SaaS industry.
Experience leading Design Thinking workshops and projects.
Understanding of other integrated marketing channels including: email marketing, social media marketing, content marketing, SEO, and SEM/paid advertising.
Demonstrable skills in strategic planning and execution.
Remote candidates will be considered.

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
About Us
New Relic (NYSE: NEWR) is a cloud-based platform that gives developers, engineers, operations, and management a clear view of what’s happening in today’s complex software environments. So they can find and fix problems faster, and deliver delightful experiences for their customers. That's why the world’s best engineering teams rely on New Relic to visualize, analyze, and troubleshoot their software. It’s the simplest, most powerful cloud-based observability platform, built to create more perfect software. All from one place.
Founded in 2008, we’re a global company passionate about building a culture where all employees feel a deep sense of belonging, where every ‘Relic’ can bring their whole self to work and feel supported and empowered to thrive. We’re consistently recognized as a distinguished employer and are committed to building world-class products and an award-winning culture. For more information, visit newrelic.com.

New Relic takes seriously our stewardship of the data of our thousands of customers worldwide. In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification.
We will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records based on individual circumstances and in accordance with applicable law including, but not limited to, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. https://sfgov.org/olse/sites/default/files/Document/FCO%20Poster%20Set%20All%20Languages%2010%2001%2018.pdf
