job_descriptions.a5dfcaae0da18e8d:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJob Description
Reuters is seeking a Lead UI/UX Designer to oversee a design team and set the design and experience direction of our flagship consumer platform, reuters.com. The role will lead the challenge of turning complex problems and constraints into elegant solutions that meet our users’ needs.
We are looking for a design-minded, research and detail obsessed individual to help create consistency across all our digital products. In this role, you will work closely with a cross-functional and global team throughout the produce development cycle; from concept development to execution to launch, all while advocating the voice of our users.
About the Role
As an Lead UI/UX Designer at Reuters, you will:
Work with the product team to create detailed user flows, product maps, and wireframes to clearly communicate current and future customer journeys
Prototyping interaction models and new ideas to facilitate good product decisions and usability testing
Present designs informed by research and business objectives at design forums and iterate based on feedback from the wider team
Creating clear specs for the engineering team and discussing trade-offs of different approaches
Collaborating with a cross-functional team to ideate, troubleshoot or iterate experiences
Document and track learnings gathered through testing and research and apply insights to future projects
Run efficient and unbiased user interviews to better understand user needs
Support other teams such as our B2B platform, Reuters Connect, with ad-hoc needs for design and/or presentations
About the You
To be our Lead UI/UX Designer, you will likely:
Bachelor’s degree or a minimum of 7+ years of hands-on experience creating digital experiences
Solid understanding of the UX process and design principles
Proficient in Sketch and Abstract
Ability to prototype in InVision, Marvel or similar
Demonstrated knowledge of HTML and CSS, and a general understanding of front-end development as well as established and emerging web technologies
Self-motivated, resourceful, hardworking with a positive attitude
Experience working in an agile environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Global mindset, thick skin, and a sense of humor.
Team player
Desired Skills:
Significant experience in a relevant role, ideally within the news, media or technology industries
General knowledge of, and genuine interest in the news and media industry
Ability to create functional prototypes in HTML, Javascript, CSS
Experience working on e-commerce platforms
What’s in it For You
At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:
Global Career: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
Learning & Development: we have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our employees
Benefits: we offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits
Perks: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories
About Reuters
Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers.
Reuters: The Real World in Real Time
Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.
We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.
Accessibility
As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.
We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.
More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionDigital Product UI/UX Designer
Summary
Are you a UI/UX product designer who enjoys working in a small team and using the latest technologies and frameworks to design creative and responsive platforms and mobile apps?
Do you share our passion for enabling positive change within healthcare and helping patients with chronic conditions?
If so, you could be a perfect fit for our team of like-minded professionals who share a common mission and passion for helping others and a desire to build a great company.
Cecelia health is a high-growth, venture-backed health tech services company based in New York City. The company partners with pharmaceutical & device companies, payers and ACOs to deliver personalized, technology-based coaching to improve treatment adherence and health outcomes for people living with diabetes and other chronic conditions. The company is a high-energy, results-oriented workplace that believes our success, as well as the success of our customers and patients, relies primarily on a fantastic team with the passion, drive and skills to change the face of chronic condition management.
Cecelia Health seeks to hire a Digital Product UI/UX Designer. You will work from home and eventually be based in the company’s midtown location in New York City. This position requires strong visual and interaction design skills.
Responsibilities
Deliver world-class UI/UX products and functional applications that enable patients, healthcare providers, health plans, pharmaceutical and device companies to better manage chronic condition disease states.
Design holistic interfaces, web and mobile apps that are simple, elegant, and beautiful.
Perform all functions of the product design lifecycle, including research, concepts, wireframes, prototypes, pixel-perfect UI, documentation, and testing.
Learn from customers and users, and test your ideas before building.
Partner with product managers, business analysts and engineers to oversee the user experience of a product from conception until launch and beyond.
Work closely across different departments: Product, Marketing, Customer Success, Engineering to rapidly ideate and produce multiple UX/UI concepts, clickable prototypes, A/B tests, validating web or mobile app interfaces, or any related design tasks.
Requirements
BA/BS degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, computer science, visual arts or a related field or equivalent practical experience).
5+ years of professional end-to-end web and mobile design experience.
Have cross-platform design experiences (Web, iOS, Android, emails, print).
An outstanding UX/UI/visual portfolio, showcasing thoughtfully designed experiences, interaction, and visual design, with elements of depth and clarity.
A mastery of design tools such as Sketch, Figma, XD, Axure, InVision, etc.
Deliver pixel perfect live design solutions for a broad range of products, taking projects through the entire design process, from low fidelity and wireframes to high fidelity mockups and clickable prototypes.
You leverage a user-centered approach when making design decisions, and you understand how to back those decisions with user research.
Deep knowledge in cross-browser, cross-device compatibility and standards.
Have contributed as a design advocate, and delivered high quality, complete end-to-end designs, and specifications for products alongside product managers and engineers.
Proficiency with HTML5, CSS and JavaScript.
Experience with developer handoff and post-implementation design validation.
Attention to detail, focus on quality, and the ability to thrive in fast paced environment.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionDesign at VMware
We are a dedicated team that moves fast, upholds design quality, values consistency and simplicity, and focuses on customers and their needs. We work together and value "we" over "me". We believe in inclusion both within our team and in the way we build products and make that clear in the way we hire, design, and execute. We value growth and encourage, not just respect, our differences. We're the organization to "get it done" together. We're not afraid to make new mistakes, learn from them, and grow together as a team and an organization. We love what we do and build products that are used by hundreds of thousands of productive individuals and organizations around the world.
Opportunity
We are looking for a very senior UX designer to join our global team to help us define and design an integrated and customized cloud management experience for our multi-cloud and hybrid cloud customers and partners. This role will act as a design architect across all of the vRealize suite of products, including vROperations, vRAutomation, vRLogInsights, vRAI, CloudHealth, Secure State, Skyline and others. In this technical design leadership role, you will partner with our Sr Staff Designer and drive initiatives across Cloud Management at VMware. You will mentor and guide less-experienced designers and teams and collaborate with cross-functional product teams across the globe to create experience-led, end-to-end stories. As part of a highly collaborative group of creative problem solvers with a passion for innovation, you will build intuitive, beautiful, and meaningful cloud management solutions using Figma and the Clarity design system. You must be comfortable engaging with executives, peers, customers, and engineering and PM partners at all levels, in both small and large group settings.
What you’ll do:
Become a subject matter expert with the ability to understand the latest architecture, technology, solution, and market trends as well as competitive offerings related to cloud management.
Closely collaborate with product management and engineering partners to identify and articulate product vision and goals.
Drive user research initiatives to talk directly with customers and users to understand their needs, goals, and motivations.
Conceptualize and define an end-to-end design strategy that supports customer needs and business goals. Ideate detailed stories and user flows illustrating the solution.
Closely collaborate with a geographically diverse design team to co-design while ensuring consistency across the suite of products and services.
Advocate user needs throughout the development lifecycle in an agile, iterative environment to ensure problem-solution fit.
Verify and improve on designs through reviews, validation and formal usability testing with end users.
About you:
You can define end-to-end user workflows in a concise and compelling narrative
You have strong interaction design skills and a command of user centered design processes
You prefer to work as team player in a high achievement-oriented environment
You are agile, adaptable, and capable of delivering new products and features
You enjoy designing enterprise software, and have an aptitude for designing large-scale web-based applications
You have a master’s degree in design, HCI or related field from reputable design institutes or equivalent experience
Your online portfolio demonstrates:
That you can tell simple user stories illustrating solutions
That you have excellent oral and written communication, presentation, and analytical skills
That you have extensive experience in working with prototyping tools such as Figma, Sketch, and Adobe Creative Suite
You have a strong aesthetic sense

Subcategory: User Experience

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionThe Sr UX Designer works as a product designer creating user-centric experiences. Provides ongoing insights, provocations and thought leadership on the end -to-end customer journey and the back-office processes and workflows.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Translate user needs and business requirements into elegant solutions, from low fidelity to high fidelity, that improve the commercial and consumer Valley member experience.
Bring concepts to life using visualizations, storyboards, task flows, wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, and interactive prototypes.
Communicate design decisions and solutions using clear and persuasive stories that you share with a wide range of audiences, including business partners and stakeholders.
Establish and govern design standards for customer-facing and internal-facing tools, communicating how design choices scale and fit within larger established systems and patterns, as well as, best practices for using these interface and interaction patterns.
Create and govern the design toolkit that reflects the latest design standards.
Collaborate with researchers, designers, product managers and developers on research activities, strategy sessions, ideation, design, and testing of new concepts.
Create communication tools, such as journey maps, service blueprints - whatever tool is right for the task at hand.
Required Skills:
Experience working on agile teams with other designers, product managers and developers.
Proficiency with current design and collaboration tools (Sketch, Invision, Zeplin etc).
Experience partnering with UX researchers to discover user needs and evaluate concepts.
Proven ability to build consensus and work effectively within multi-disciplinary and cross-departmental teams.
Ability to clearly communicate your design decisions with the team and craft elegant presentation and storytelling capabilities.
Required Experience:
B.S. or B.A degree in HCI, Experience Design or a related field with a minimum of 6 years' experience in a UX design role creating user-centric experiences or a Masters' Degree and a minimum of 4 years' experience in a UX design role. Previous experience working on an Agile team.
Knowledge of the Salesforce Lightning platform preferred.
Experience designing for use on the Salesforce lightning platform preferred.

Job detailsSalary$82,400 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionTo get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Customer Success Group
Job Details
Job Description
Salesforce Experience Design is a group of passionate designers who build transformational products and experiences by turning human insights into business impact at Salesforce scale.

Playing an integral part in the Customer Success Group, we partner alongside Service, Sales, Marketing, IT, and Human Capital Management Lines of Business across all industry verticals to help customers unleash the full power of Salesforce through a design-centric approach delivering useful, usable and desirable experiences.


Our work environment appeals to self-motivated, flexible team players that have great interpersonal skills and lots of curiosity. We believe in peer relationships rather than hierarchies; in teams rather than lone thinkers. Salesforce is all about an open collaborative approach and we think it is the key enabler for us to deliver innovative, ground-breaking work.


As part of Salesforce Customer Success Group (CSG), our designers follow a consultant mindset including understanding our customers’ business, their objectives and challenges in achieving them. We work with different Salesforce colleagues across various engagements to enable a cross functional team to ensure successful customer transformation. Successfully engaging with our customers requires both a willingness to travel when required and an understanding the value of working on site.


We are looking for a passionate and pragmatic User Experience (UX) Designer who is eager to join a fun, collaborative and innovative team. His/Her role is to understand the business and end-user’s needs in order to translate those needs into intuitive, transformational experiences. The User Experience Designer is a team player and assists with various Experience Design activities throughout a project lifecycle and collaborates extremely well with User Interface Designers.


Key Accountabilities

Success will be measured by your contribution and collaboration within the Experience Design group as well as within customer-facing engagement — working with teams and customers to create successful outcomes and ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction. Specifically, your areas of focus will be: actively participating in the Salesforce culture, ensuring your skills and role requirements are continuously met, and assisting with Experience Design activities throughout a project’s lifecycle.
Define and create UX concepts based on an understanding of the business requirements and end-user needs through up-front, end-user research
Prepare and facilitate of a variety of Experience Design activities for client-facing workshops, audits, and customer/stakeholder interviews
Create a clear strategy from insight to action to effectively produce a variety of outputs such as personas, journey-maps, user flows, information architecture, prototypes, and wireframes as it pertains to business requirements and end-user needs and validate through user testing, when appropriate
Communicate research findings, conceptual ideas, detailed design, and design rationale effectively both verbally and visually
Create prototypes that demonstrate experience concepts
Follow and identify key industry and technology trends
Build and maintain strong working relationships with colleagues, clients, and key stakeholders
Respond positively and calmly to shifting priorities, demands, and timeline
Participate as a contributor and at times a leader with an interdisciplinary team that includes other designers, business analysts, technical and functional architects, and software developers
Collaborate effectively with remote team members
Represent Salesforce’s vision and values by ensuring all Salesforce certifications and coursework is met, as it pertains to the Experience Design group requirements

Basic Requirements
5-8 years in-depth knowledge and experience with a Bachelor degree in a design-related discipline
Extensive knowledge and experience with driving and applying user-centered design processes while working collaboratively with customers, along side cross-functional teams including visual design, user research, and engineering
Experience using industry-standard software, tools and methodologies (Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Axure, InVision, Marvel, Proto.io, etc.)
Knowledge of web-based technologies and their impact on the feasibility of design solutions
Creative problem-solver with the ability to work with a blank slate and inspire others
Experience pivoting and navigating dynamic and changing situations
Strong communication skills - written, verbal, and presentation
Proactive, self-sufficient and professional, with strong organizational and time management skills
Passionate and enthusiastic about delivering design and user experience excellence
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written
Willingness to travel up to 50% of the time
For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $82,400 . You may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/
Accommodations - If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
Posting Statement
At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. At Guardian Direct, we are working to define the future of insurtech by democratizing insurance for everyone.  Ready to join a team of bold and passionate builders to do your best work yet?

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionSnaps is the leader in connecting global brands and consumers in AI-powered automated conversations. Our award-winning technology helps executives across customer experience, marketing, e-commerce and product teams create, automate and optimize experiences that their customers will love in channels like Facebook Messenger, Webchat, SMS, Google Business Messages, and more. The world’s top brands, including Michael Kors, Tiffany & Co., Live Nation, Calvin Klein, Uber, Lane Bryant and more leverage Snaps’ products to acquire new customers and increase lifetime value through marketing and customer experience automation.
The future is conversational. Snaps is your partner. Check us out!
A Conversational Designer at Snaps leverages their creativity, analytical and technical acumen to produce engaging and impactful conversational experiences. You will become an expert with our authoring, NLP, and analytics platform while helping evolve our process and product to delight users and drive business results for our customers. This is a hybrid position that will require basic experience with JavaScript and SQL, or a strong willingness to learn new skills in a “low code” environment. You’ll be part of our Customer Success and Implementation team, responsible for scoping, designing, launching, and optimizing our conversational experiences.
You will:
Assess use cases for automation - including the context, topics, and intents that define the conversation interaction, along with the associated utterances, entities, conditional logic, and conversational flow control patterns.
Understand and inform the technical integrations that support new conversational experiences.
Design consumer-facing conversational experiences that are contextual, optimized, and personalized.
Maintain “ownership” of in-market experiences and optimization process to drive increasing value for users and clients.
Translate customer needs and use cases into conversational UX that delivers on stated business objectives.
Develop conversational flow diagrams and all other creative prototyping assets.
Analyze user and interaction data to inform conversational designs and optimizations.
Partner with Sales, Customer Success and Engineering to guide the process of designing, deploying and maintaining the conversational experience.
Operate with a 'customer first' mindset and design customer-centric experiences to solve inbound inquiries via multiple channels.
Inform the Snaps product roadmap and support new product features through requirements gathering, testing and validation.
Stay up to date regarding current conversational design principles, technology capabilities, emerging trends, and competitive landscape.
You're a great fit if you:
Are familiar with conversational automation and messaging channels.
Possess strong analytical, problem-solving and technical skills.
Have experience with business process automation and rules-based logic to guide users
Display excellent written and verbal communication skills and love explaining new concepts to people.
Think strategically and prioritize action accordingly.
Can manage/organize information and processes to identify trends and extract key conclusions.
Are passionate and knowledgeable of customer experience best practices.
Show excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively.
Demonstrate the technical acumen for technical scoping, data analysis, APIs.
Have experience in a highly analytical and creative problem-solving role. (Business/Financial Analyst, UX Designer, CSM, Product Manager, Web Developer, etc)

You’ve worked in the bot space or with Natural Language Processing.

Job detailsSalary$79,000 - $119,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionYour Job
Indeed is seeking a Business Recruiter to support our Americas Corporate Functions team that includes Human Resources, Finance, Administration, Marketing, Corporate Development, and Legal. The ideal Recruiter will have a proven track record of sourcing and recruiting high-level candidates in these areas across multiple locations or regions.
Responsibilities:
Identify, source, and engage candidates through creative and innovative sourcing approaches
Provide market research to support candidate and geographic profiling to guide recruiting in various locations
Review, pre-screen and interview candidates to determine the appropriateness of skills, experience, and knowledge in relation to position requirements
Serve as the primary point of contact for candidates throughout the full recruiting cycle (i.e. communicate status, answer questions and coordinate all follow-up efforts)
Work to understand the skills and experience required for new roles and define the hiring process with hiring managers
Consult with hiring managers to make data-based decisions on processes and approaches to develop an effective recruiting strategy, identify potential roadblocks and manage hiring manager expectations
Ensure consistent communication regarding recruiting efforts by providing status updates to all stakeholders through meetings, email updates, and reports
Monitor the effectiveness of all recruiting efforts, with specific attention paid to the continued flow of candidates through the recruiting pipeline
Act as an informal mentor for less experienced recruiters within the team
Proactively share knowledge with peers to learn and share best practices and gain a better understanding of role and function
Participate in or contribute to active projects
Who You Are
Requirements:
4+ years of successful, full-cycle recruitment experience
Demonstrated performance of achieving hiring targets
Ability to provide excellent support to candidates throughout the recruitment process to ensure a world-class candidate experience
Ability to build strong, consultative relationships with hiring managers and push back when necessary
Exposure to full lifecycle recruiting, including screening,
Demonstrate a strong work ethic, integrity and personal accountability
Ability to work with limited supervision, demonstrate an ability to prioritize, and work with a sense of urgency and a high level of quality
Experience working with applicant tracking systems (ATS)
Handle confidential information discreetly
Ability to adapt in a fast-paced, continually evolving environment using proven time management skills and working with a strong sense of urgency and maintaining a professional demeanor in stressful situations
Strong interpersonal and organizational skills
Understanding of GDPR and other local compliance rules and regulations
Who we are
Our Human Resources team champions our culture while working tirelessly to attract and retain the best people. With HR teams in every major Indeed office globally, we value a consistent and empowering experience for all of our Indeed employees and those we hope to hire.
Our Mission
As the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.

(*comScore Total Visits, March 2020)
Salary Range Disclaimer
The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, long term incentives, an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.
Salary Range Transparency
NYC Metro Area 79,000 - 119,000 USD per year
Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement
Indeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neuro-diversity, disability, age, or veteran status, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.

Indeed is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the employment application process. To request an accommodation, please contact Talent Attraction Help at 1-855-567-7767, or by email at TAhelp@indeed.com at least one week in advance of your interview.

job_descriptions.adab66644f14c769: Job detailsSalary$67,000 - $75,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeQualificationsRecruiting: 4 years (Required)Microsoft Office: 4 years (Required)Bachelor's (Preferred)Full Job DescriptionCTS Job Description: Corporate RecruiterOVERVIEWThis new role acts as the main recruiter in a rapidly growing technology services company focused on serving the education sector. The company is expected to add 12-20 employees annually the next 3 years and this dedicated recruiter will play a key role in finding, screening, and landing candidates for growth positions.Our ideal candidate has 4-6 years of progressive recruiting experience, can relate well to people at all levels, earn their trust, and become a strong tactical recruiter for both technical and administrative positions. The ideal candidate will have experience building partnerships with various departments including service delivery, operations, projects, and finance/administration. This person values alignment between supervisors and employees, executes hiring initiatives timely, effectively manages the full tactical cycle of the interviewing and on-boarding process, and uses the HR and Payroll system as well as electronic tracking and screening tools.The role is a key position and is expected to grow in both scale and responsibility as the company continues to grow.The Corporate Recruiter will report to the Director of People.ResponsibilitiesThe Corporate Recruiter is responsible for the full cycle of posting positions, screening candidates, tracking and selecting appropriate candidates for interviews, partnering with the hiring manager and the Director of People on negotiating salaries, initiating background checks, on-boarding, and maintaining data within the HR system. The Corporate Recruiter is responsible for carrying out HR hiring responsibilities in alignment with the HR policies of the organization.Provide daily support and implementation of various HR initiatives, to ensure HR is delivering services that meet the needs of CTS people and business:Implementation of recruitment strategies.Find and Recruit top talent that matches the CTS culture.Under the guidance of Director of People, define the Employer Value Proposition.Attract top talent and help create an attractive proposition for both employees and prospects in accordance with CTS HR guidelines.Provide support to the Director of People on compensation and benefits.Assist with Human Resources projects and initiatives as needed.During the first 6-9 months, the Corporate Recruiter will be expected to focus on the following objectives:Recruit and hire 12 candidates for new growth positions.Hire 6-8 temporary interns for support during the summer project season.Hire 2-4 technical contractors for projects during the summer project season.Handle payroll for the hourly and contracted workers.Establish connections with local colleges and organizations to develop a candidate pipeline (Per Scholas, Colleges and Universities).Support the Director of People on HR initiatives and projects.Develop a strong sense of our company vision, mission, and culture.Build relationships with the management teammates.Handle the full-cycle of on-boarding and off-boarding.Maintain the CTS career and teammates corporate webpages.After the first 6 months, the Corporate Recruiter will be expected to focus on the following objectives:Continue to hire positions In-line with the growth needs of the Company, Including full-time employees, contractors, Interns, and part time employees.Promote the CTS brand and culture at various recruiting functions.Enhance sourcing strategies through a variety of channels including the use of social media platforms, employee referral program, networking and unique opportunities/events, building a pipeline of diversified talent.Proactively identify and engage “ready now” and “ready later” talent for pipelining and develop a robust network through ongoing relationships with diverse candidate communities.EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS WE SEEK4-6 years of recruiting experience at a technology services company.(S)PHR certification preferred.Demonstrated track record of reliability, taking initiative, teamwork, strong standard for seeking quality candidates in a growth environment.Ability to stay organized, focused, and able to deliver results, while working in a dynamic environment.Knowledge of diverse hiring platforms and candidate sources. We are not intending to use outside recruiters to fill positions. This position is to be the CTS recruiter.Awareness and compliance with state and Federal HR guidelines and laws.Job Type: Full-timePay: $67,000.00 - $75,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceDisability insuranceHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offParental leaveVision insuranceSchedule:Day shiftSupplemental Pay:Bonus payEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Recruiting: 4 years (Required)Microsoft Office: 4 years (Required)Work Location:One locationThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousPeople-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projectsAdaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in directionAchievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might failAutonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little directionThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedAggressive -- competitive and growth-orientedPeople-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focusedCompany's website:www.charterts.comBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredSocial distancing guidelines in placeSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place
job_descriptions.e27fa630c5b252b0: Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeNumber of hires for this role2QualificationsExperience:healthcare, 1 year (Preferred)healthcare recruiting, 1 year (Preferred)recruiting, 1 year (Preferred)sales, 1 year (Preferred)staffing, 1 year (Preferred)Full Job DescriptionNow Hiring Healthcare Recruiter!Healthcare Staffing Agency is currently seeking a recruiter with outstanding people skills for our office located in Bronx, NY.The Recruiter is responsible for all aspects of the recruitment, interviewing, selection and pre-employment processing of all new employees. Ensures all candidates for employment meet the minimum qualifications needed for the continuation of a qualified and skilled workforce.Requirements: - Source candidates- Supervise pre-employment testing procedures for new applicants, and assists in determining which tests to administer.- Interview the applicants as needed, and inform them of job duties and specifications, benefits overview and pertinent policies.- Evaluate work experience and education against requirements for the job vacancy.- Refer qualified applicants to departments for interview and final approval. Ensure references are checked, pre-employment physical and Background checks are completed prior to applicant’s employment.- Follow up with Dept. Heads regarding new hire start dates and orientation schedules.- Verify licenses and certifications required by NYS Regulatory Agencies. Ensures that all Nursing Home regulations are followed relating to new hires.- Establish and maintain relationships with schools and agencies as outreach activities for recruitment.- Utilizes the internet and other websites, as a form of recruitment.- Oversee the posting of vacancies and follows up on internal transfers and referrals.- Performs other duties as requested.Knowledge and Skills: - Excellent communication skills both oral and written.- Excellent organizational skills with intense focus on detail, accuracy, and follow through.- An infectious energy and enthusiasm.- High sense of urgency, ability to multi-task and wear many hats daily.- Familiar with social media and other forms of outreach.- Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.- HRIS and Applicant Tracking Experience preferred.Compensation and Benefits: - Salary: Commensurate with experience- Competitive compensation- Sick days- Voluntary Medical Insurances – choose the option right for you!- Aflac Insurance options to choose from: Disability, Dental, Accident, Life, Cancer, Hospital.- Commuter Benefits – earn pre-tax dollars!- Direct deposit available.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:healthcare: 1 year (Preferred)healthcare recruiting: 1 year (Preferred)recruiting: 1 year (Preferred)sales: 1 year (Preferred)staffing: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:Multiple locationsWork Remotely:No

job_descriptions.ad8d65e52ddc4748: Job detailsSalary$30,000 - $60,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeNumber of hires for this role3Full Job DescriptionCan You Manage Hiring For This Revolutionary Photography Education Company?You've finally found it...The perfect job to skyrocket your career in hiring.If that's what you've been looking for, then this job could literally change your life!But only if you keep reading.iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind.To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a Hiring Specialist.7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography School As A Hiring Specialist1. Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In HiringIf you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple.But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes...Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world.If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us.2. Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream JobsOne of the things you love the most about hiring is the people.Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding.We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us.Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs.3. Take Our Company To The Next LevelWe've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far.But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level.Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company.That means your work will be critical to the future of our company.4. Stay In Control Of Your ScheduleEvery job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm.That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run.Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule.5. Stability You Can Count OnMost startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be.Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales.You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money.6. Perks That Make A DifferenceTo get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions.Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us.We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats.Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come.7. Join A Company You Truly Believe InMany people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world.But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world.Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes (take a look! https://www.facebook.com/iPhonePS/reviews/) from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography.Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in.What Will You Do As A Hiring Specialist?We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow.Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates.Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company.Here’s What We Expect From YouWe can trust your decisions in the hiring processYou can carry out professional job interviews independentlyYou have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per dayYou can “sell” our company to job applicantsYou have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor)This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location.Please note that our hiring process includes a paid trial period if you advance to the next stage.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $30,000.00 - $60,000.00 per yearBenefits:Flexible schedulePaid time offSchedule:Monday to FridayWork Location:Fully RemoteCompany's website:https://iphonephotographyschool.com/Company's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/iPhonePS/Work Remotely:Yes

job_descriptions.897227cbaaf91506:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionWho are we?
We are The Motley Fool, a purpose-driven financial services firm with nearly 30 years of experience focused on making the world smarter, happier, and richer. But what does that even mean?! It means we’re helping Fools (always with a capital “F”) demystify the world of finance, beat the stock market, and achieve personal wealth and happiness through our products and services.
What does this team do?
Our global brand is growing rapidly, and the Recruiting team is eager to keep up with the company’s fast-paced hiring needs. We’re looking for a Recruiter to join our collaborative team and help us hire the next generation of talented, passionate, and game-changing Fools! So if you are a creative problem solver who can learn quickly, tackle new challenges head on, and adapt to changing environments, we just might be perfect for each other.
What would you do in this role?
As a Foolish Recruiter, you will be part-advisor, part-advocate, and part-innovator. You will develop strong relationships with all candidates and hiring managers as you guide them through the interview process and advise them on the best next steps. You will understand the ins and outs of what a team needs to drive successful results, and you will effectively assess if an applicant is the best fit for a role. And when a truly incredible candidate (or candidates if you’re really, really lucky!) finds their way to the world of Foolishness, you will be their biggest supporter, advocating for their diversity of thought and skills. As you brainstorm strategies behind the Recruiting team’s day-to-day activities, you will innovate and test ways to further develop our team. And with your fellow People Fools, you will help foster positive changes at The Motley Fool as we make the world happier, smarter, and richer.
But what does this role actually do?
Finding, attracting, interviewing, and closing top talent while promoting the company culture and purpose in a positive and effective manner
Leading and facilitating inclusive interview processes that champion our candidates and offer clear and consistent experiences for all stakeholders
Creating and implementing a hiring plan that highlights the quality of candidates and streamlines an experience for applicants and hiring teams
Developing a strong understanding of a hiring team’s strategies and goals to identify top talent and successfully hire for the needs of the overall business
Championing diversity in all of its forms, and ensuring each touchpoint in our recruiting process creates a positive, inclusive, and level playing field for our candidates
Communicating openly and honestly with internal customers (your fellow Fools) to make impactful and smart hiring decisions
Utilizing the Applicant Tracking System (ATS) to communicate with candidates, track the workflow of the interview process, and compile information for data analysis
Collaborating with our team to schedule interviews, arrange travel if needed, and provide a Foolish experience for all candidates
Researching the competitive landscape and market trends to remain ahead of the curve with hiring best practices and recruiting technology innovations
Providing support to the entire Recruiting team for an array of special projects that advance the mission of our recruiting team, including facilitating the onboarding process of new employees and planning recruiting events throughout the year
What do you need to apply?
2+ years’ experience in an in-house recruiting role (preferably with a high-growth, dynamic organization)
Impeccable organizational skills and borderline-maniacal attention to detail
Excellent (almost perfect, if it's not too much to ask?) verbal & written communication skills
Emotional intelligence and discretion
Understanding of, or interest in, sourcing passive candidates
Understanding of Foolishness and the Fool ethos
Strong work ethic (you take pride in anything that earns your stamp of approval)
Flexibility to take ownership of wide-ranging responsibilities
Ability to flourish in a rapidly evolving environment and shift gears at a moment's notice
Desire to be part of a team and the capacity to operate autonomously
It’s even better if you have…
Familiarity with the Fool’s products and services
Experience using Jobvite
The Motley Fool is firmly committed to diversity, inclusion, and equity. We are a motley group of overachievers that have built a culture of trust founded on Foolishness, fun, and a commitment to making the world smarter, happier and richer. However you identify or whatever winding road has led you to us, please don't hesitate to apply if the description above leaves you thinking, "Hey! I could do that!"
The Motley Fool has been twice named Glassdoor’s #1 Best Small Business to work for in the U.S., named to Inc.’s Best Workplaces of 2020, named one of BuiltIn’s Best Places to Work in Colorado, and we’re a perennial favorite on Washingtonian’s list of Best Places to Work year after year. Below you’ll see a few of our perks, but check out this site for the complete list:
No “vacation policy” (not to be confused with a “No vacation” policy)
Paid maternity, paternity, and pet-ernity leave
$1,000 to invest when you start
Super low premiums for medical, dental and vision coverage
Comprehensive compensation package, including company equity
job_descriptions.54fc6ad4e8d6913a:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout Gap Inc.
Our brands bridge the gaps we see in the world. Old Navy democratizes style to ensure everyone has access to quality fashion at every price point. Athleta unleashes the potential of every woman, regardless of body size, age or ethnicity. Banana Republic believes in sustainable luxury for all. And Gap inspires the world to bring individuality to modern, responsibly made essentials.
This simple idea—that we all deserve to belong, and on our own terms—is core to who we are as a company and how we make decisions. Our team is made up of thousands of people across the globe who take risks, think big, and do good for our customers, communities, and the planet. Ready to learn fast, create with audacity and lead boldly? Join our team.
About the role
As a recruiter, you’re responsible for full lifecycle recruiting and understand the importance of each step. Networking comes naturally to you and you thrive off of making connections that may not naturally happen. You identify, develop, and execute effective sourcing strategies to build teams and organizations. You’re a champion of both the business and talent and are responsible for finding talent that no one else can through the relationships you build and the creative and innovative sourcing techniques you employ.
What you'll do
Manage full lifecycle recruiting including: offer process and letter generation, reference checks, salary recommendations, and offer acceptance/turn downs.
Negotiate offers by partnering with hiring manager, senior management, benefits, relocation, immigration and compensation departments and HR Generalists.
Own and define staffing strategy and deliver a diverse candidate slate to hiring managers and recruiters when required.
Effectively manage and build relationships and consult on industry trends with both internal and external business partners.
Ensure the recruiting needs of the functional team are met while maintaining recruiter and candidate satisfaction through monthly and/or quarterly reviews with the business.
Partner with functional area’s HR Generalists to support HR initiatives and vision.
Manage relationships with hiring managers and candidates to ensure a positive candidate experience.
Educate and train business partners and hiring managers on hiring.
Collaborate across teams to support improvements and share best practices.
Participate in annual strategic staffing initiatives including compensation guidelines, workflow, and process improvement.
Partner with global mobility and immigration partners.
Partner with talent branding to ensure advertising strategies align with hiring needs.
Travel to meet top talent as necessary.
Who you are
Bachelor’s degree preferred and/or 3+ years of full lifecycle recruiting experience.
You have experience creating and executing written and visual communications related to talent branding on various social platforms.
You’re tech savvy and have a thorough understanding of applicant tracking systems and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.).
You’re great at multitasking, can flex and work within multiple functions and/or channels as needed.
You’re a problem solver with a focus on continuous improvement. You’re always learning and can effectively articulate opportunities and new strategies to business partners.
Being organized motivates you. You can effectively prioritize and manage multiple tasks in an environment with competing demands.
You can maintain professionalism and focus in an ambiguous environment and handle confidential information with discretion and maturity.
Knowledge of EEO, ADA, and employment laws.
Benefits at Gap Inc.
Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Old Navy, Gap, Banana Republic and Athleta, and 30% off at Outlet for all employees.
One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*
Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*
Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.*
Employee stock purchase plan.*
Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*
See more of the benefits we offer.
For eligible employees
Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. This year, we’ve been named as one of the Best Places to Work by the Humans Rights Campaign for the fourteenth consecutive year and have been included in the 2019 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index for the second year in a row.

job_descriptions.01b8363361131d59:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionRecruiter, Retail
Date: Mar 10, 2021
Brand: Luxottica (LoA Corporate)
Location:
New York, NY, US, 10018
Requisition ID: 339082
Position:Full-Time
Total Rewards: Benefits/Incentive Information

Luxottica is a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of fashion, luxury and sports eyewear. Our wholesale network covers more than 150 countries and our retail presence consists of over 9,100 retail stores across the globe.
In North America, our wholesale business is the home to global brands like Ray-Ban, Oakley, and many of the top fashion house brands. Our leading retail brands include; LensCrafters, Sunglass Hut, Pearle Vision, Target Optical and Sears Optical. We are also home to EyeMed, the fastest growing vision care company in the United States.
Supporting over 4,500 retail stores in North America, a career in our retail headquarters allows us to stay in touch with the end customer and use their ever-changing behaviors and preferences to shape our offerings of the best eyewear and services.


GENERAL FUNCTION
The Recruiter provides a consultative recruitment approach; drives consistent communication with hiring teams, provides market analysis, executes creative sourcing techniques, candidate assessment, and other talent related activities.


The Recruiter manages the full-lifecycle recruitment process and strategies for entry & junior level positions in Corporate Shared Services functions and/or a Luxottica North America Retail Brands, partnering closely with both internal clients and the external candidate population.


MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Builds and maintains proactive partnerships with internal and external client groups in order to understand the business needs, staffing need, and offer.
Develops and executes recruitment strategies to proactively search for a diverse pool of candidates using various recruiting methods to include cold-calling, networking/relationship building, social networking sites, and searches.
Participates in weekly strategy meetings with hiring managers, providing a consultative approach on talent.
Acts as Subject Matter Expert (SME) on hiring techniques and legal issues regarding hiring practices.
Develops and maintains a network and pipeline of talent.
Presents to Hiring Managers, and works as liaison between candidates, Hiring Managers and HR business partners providing guidance through the interview, offer, and hiring process.
Gathers competitive intelligence, industry trends, and labor market conditions to create search strategies.
Implements and enforces consistency with recruiting policies and procedures.
Successfully manages and tracks assigned postings, prioritizes and closes searches against established benchmarks and metrics.
Partners with Talent Management to identify and manage internal key talent to increase internal mobility company-wide.
Generates reports and data, new proposals and general corporate information.
May lead special projects as assigned.
Liaise with external Recruitment Agencies / vendors where required

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s Degree
3+ years’ relevant recruitment industry experience
Volume, entry or junior level recruitment experience (hourly or white collar hiring)
Recruitment Agency & In-house recruitment experience
Knowledge and experience in recruitment concepts, practice and procedures
Experience with automated applicant tracking tools, MS Word, Excel and Outlook
Experience recruiting in a Technical/Retail/Information Technology and/or Marketing fields
Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and both oral and written communication skills
Strong ability to follow process, comply with regulations
High energy, and has relationship building skills with ability to take initiative, prioritize, influence, negotiate and partner cross functionally
Ability to report and understand data
Ability to source candidates through a variety of networks and tools
Self-confident, self-motivated, with sense of personal accountability
Results driven with the ability to influence others
Ability to deliver a consistent, high-level customer service experience
Ability to manage confidential information effectively, while maintaining adherence to company policies and procedures


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Experience in Retail, Healthcare or related service oriented industries
Upon request and consistent with applicable laws, Luxottica will provide reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities who need assistance in the application and hiring process. To request a reasonable accommodation, please call the Luxottica Ethics Compliance Hotline at 1-888-887-3348 or e-mail HRCompliance@luxotticaretail.com (be sure to provide your name and contact information for either option so that we may follow up in a timely manner).
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, national origin, social origin, social condition, being perceived as a victim of domestic violence, sexual aggression or stalking, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, citizenship, ancestry, veteran or military status, marital status, pregnancy (including unlawful discrimination on the basis of a legally protected pregnancy or maternity leave), genetic information or any other characteristics protected by law. Native Americans receive preference in accordance with Tribal Law.

Nearest Major Market: Manhattan

Nearest Secondary Market: New York City

Job Segment: Social Media, Retail, Marketing
job_descriptions.ac53a46f976e339d:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionWhat This Position Is All About:
The Corporate Recruiter is an innovative, strategic, and passionate Talent Acquisition Partner who reports into the Senior Manager, Talent Acquisition at Saks OFF 5TH. This person is responsible for managing the recruitment efforts across North America for all roles within the Corporate Finance, IT, and Logistics teams at Saks OFF 5TH. The Corporate Recruiter will be expected to develop new sourcing/recruiting strategies to build a diverse pipeline of talent for both current and future openings within the organization.

Who Are You:
Passionate about people and the evolving retail industry
A respected Talent Acquisition Partner who collaborates well with both Hiring Managers and candidates, and implements creative sourcing strategies to build a diverse talent pipeline
An excellent communicator with strong networking capabilities and experience with various interview techniques
A resourceful, proactive, self-starter who operates with a sense of urgency and can navigate with limited direction
Highly organized with the ability to maintain a complex calendar and ensure data integrity within our Applicant Tracking system
Flexible and adaptable to change

You Also Have:
Undergraduate degree and/or college diploma
Minimum 5 years of experience as a Corporate Recruiter
Strong Microsoft Office skills, including Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Experience with an Applicant Tracking system
Experience with high volume corporate recruitment, leading searches across multiple functions and all levels within an organization (entry-level to leadership)
Proven results influencing and collaborating in a matrix organization, partnering with all levels of the organization including senior leadership

As The Corporate Recruiter, you will:
Manage full-cycle recruitment: This includes, but is not limited to research, sourcing, pre-screening, interviewing, qualifying, referencing, offer negotiation and placement management for roles across all levels within the organization (entry-level to senior leadership).
Build strong internal relationships: Collaborate with HR Business Partners and Hiring Managers to develop, recommend, and implement recruitment strategies and programs. Build and present reporting analytics and talent maps for challenging searches.
Develop external relationships: Build and maintain candidate pipelines for critical roles and present findings to key business leaders and HR Business Partners. Attend networking events and learning seminars, and act as a brand ambassador representing Saks OFF 5TH.
Maintain top results and strive for excellence: Always meet or exceed recruiting metrics set out for the Talent Acquisition team. Ensure the consistent hiring of exceptional, diverse talent.
Identify opportunities: Participate as an active member of the Talent Acquisition team, assisting with the development and execution of the Talent Acquisition strategic plans and goals.
Your Life and Career at Saks OFF 5TH:
Be part of an empowered, innovative team; work with an adventurous spirit and a customer-centric mindset; play a critical role in making decisions that will position us to win
Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities across different functions within our corporate offices, retail stores, photo studios, and distribution centers
A culture that promotes a flexible work environment
Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, dental and vision)
An amazing employee discount and other exciting perks

Thank you for your interest with Saks OFF 5TH. We look forward to reviewing your application.
Saks OFF 5TH provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Saks OFF 5TH complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
Saks OFF 5TH welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.
job_descriptions.f90ee5aa5c4e1ad4:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionVroom is an innovative end-to-end ecommerce company that is revolutionizing the car buying experience. Our scalable, data-driven technology brings all phases of the vehicle buying and selling process to consumers wherever they are and offers an extensive selection of vehicles, transparent pricing, competitive financing, and contact-free, at-home pick-up and delivery. We have experienced tremendous growth and have become a disruptive force in the automotive industry. Vroom is an exciting, dynamic workplace, and there's no better time to join the team than right now.
Vroom is seeking a Technical Recruiter to join our growing team!
The team has undergone some exciting changes this year. With our business growing rapidly, we need to hire Engineering, Product, and Data teams across all three of Vroom’s nationwide offices. This role owns the entire recruiting cycle in partnership with another local recruiter, and will manage requisitions across job levels and job functions. It is up to us to attract, source, and recruit the best talent. This Recruiter will define the support needs of their hiring managers, facilitate hiring discussions, seek consensus and then complete assignments with full-cycle recruiting responsibility. This individual will work to creatively provide a diverse slate of candidates for all vacancies and opportunistic hiring without dependencies on outside search agents. The right Recruiter will be adept at collaborating proactively with hiring managers, interviewers, and the HR team.
Qualities we’re looking for:
Enthusiasm for an e-commerce company that is disrupting an industry
Passion to create a white-glove candidate experience, even if it’s done remotely
Organization which will make supporting multiple hiring managers and roles a breeze
Responsibilities
Provide guidance to hiring managers related to recruiting process
Source, screen, and present qualified candidates to hiring managers
Solicit feedback on candidates to refine recruiting strategy as applicable
Assess and evaluate candidates over the phone, video, and in-person
Master candidate communication that is frequent and timely throughout recruitment process, share manager feedback and appropriately disposition all candidates
Educate candidates on the culture, growth potential, compensation. and benefits of working for Vroom, selling both the company and the opportunity
Partner and establish rapport with appropriate stakeholders for candidate development and offer presentation
Appropriately discuss and negotiate compensation with hiring managers and candidates to ensure closure of offersComplete project work as needed
Qualifications
5-7 years experience with full project life cycle recruiting in a fast-paced, corporate environment or agency/recruiting firm
Appreciation and ability to advocate for diversity hiring and the inclusivity of gender, race, background, and diversity of thought
Ability to adjust, re-prioritize, and thrive in a dynamic environment
Drive to continuously raise the talent bar within an organization
Strong ability to assess talent, negotiate compensation, and build rapport with all types of candidates
Demonstrated capability to build and foster strong relationships with hiring managers at all levels
Benefits
This full-time role offers competitive compensation; health, dental, and vision insurance; a 401k plan; fully company-paid short term disability, long term disability, and life insurance; access to a healthcare concierge service with virtual visits; and 15 annualized days of paid vacation.
But our biggest benefit is being part of a low-ego, high performing team that's transforming the used car market into a modern, online and data-driven industry. We are looking for people who want to be a part of a contemporary startup culture. What gets us out of bed is working with talented people on a mission that matters.
Commitment to Diversity and Equal Employment Opportunity
Vroom is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to creating a work environment where all employees can find their drive. To do that, we champion a workplace where each and every person is treated with dignity and respect and is valued for their unique perspective and contributions. Our values of SPEED: Service, Progress, Employees, Engagement, and Development are only possible in an environment where every individual has the ability to bring their whole selves to work and contribute fully.
Vroom’s policy is to maintain a working environment that encourages mutual respect, promotes harmonious and congenial relationships between employees, and is free from all forms of discrimination and harassment of any employee (or applicant for employment or service provider) by anyone, including supervisors, co-workers, vendors, or clients. Harassment and discrimination in any manner or form is expressly prohibited. There is no tolerance for discrimination or unequal treatment of any kind on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual and reproductive health decisions, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status or civil partnership/union status, familial status, military or veteran status, predisposition or carrier status, domestic violence victim status, alienage or citizenship status, unemployment status, sexual violence or stalking victim status, caregiver status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
This practice applies to all terms, conditions and privileges of employment including, but not limited to, recruitment, selection, promotion, demotion, transfer, layoff, rehire, termination of employment, development and training, compensation, benefits and retirement.
job_descriptions.c5d4e9129fc70f2f:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionCompany Description
Publicis Sapient is a digital transformation partner helping established organizations get to their future, digitally-enabled state, both in the way they work and the way they serve their customers. We help unlock value through a start-up mindset and modern methods, fusing strategy, consulting and customer experience with agile engineering and problem-solving creativity. United by our core values and our purpose of helping people thrive in the brave pursuit of next, our 20,000+ people in 53 offices around the world combine experience across technology, data sciences, consulting and customer obsession to accelerate our clients’ businesses through designing the products and services their customers truly value.

Job Description
The Early Career North America Recruiter will be a part of a team responsible for driving the full lifecycle of campus recruiting and will assist on other parts of the Early Career Program across the year. The recruiter will be assigned a geographical region of targeted schools but will be expected to help out in other geographies as needed.
Responsibilities
Attending Career Fairs and other events
Engagement with Student Clubs and Organizations
Execution of assessment process and offer management
Managing all data accurately and in a timely manner in the Applicant Tracking Systems
Assisting with other parts of the Early Career Program as needed
Key measures of success for this role:
Hiring targets
The hiring of top talent
Diversity goals
Offer rate
Acceptance rate
Conversion rate
Start rate
Retention rates

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree
A background in recruiting
Strong follow-through and customer service orientation
Must be able to review and analyze data; must be computer proficient
Must be able to communicate effectively via telephone, video, and in-person
Must be able to travel to campuses during the academic year, with high travel spikes during the Fall career fair season and be able to work evenings and weekends on an as-needed basis
Additional Information
A Tip from the Hiring Manager:
A successful candidate is detail oriented, loves to solve problems and is eager to develop a Lean-Agile mindset.
As part of our dedication to an inclusive and diverse workforce, Publicis Sapient is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at hiring@publicissapient.com or you may call us at +1-617-621-0200.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeContractFull Job DescriptionWho we are: Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 375 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.
Job Description Summary: PayPal’s Talent Acquisition team is seeking 2 contract recruiters to assist with hiring in the following orgs: Business Affairs organization (HR, Legal, Corp Affairs, Corp Development, Strategy) Risk, Compliance, Finance organizations These are contract roles through the end of 2021 with potential opportunity for conversion as PayPal continues to grow.

Responsibilities:
Build strong relationships with talent acquisition recruiters to ensure we are clearly identifying the client needs

Aggressively build a pipeline of top talent by sourcing through multiple and creative channels
Represent PayPal’s mission, vision, and values with integrity and professionalism

Experience with non-tech recruiting preferred
Workday experience is ideal

Self-driven and highly motivated, with a true sense of ownership from start to finish

We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionIt's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing !
Job Summary
Bread is a technology company that aims to transform the way the world shops online and makes essential purchases affordable. We build tools, technologies and APIs that allow e-commerce merchants to integrate installment loan financing and other alternative payment products anywhere in their customers’ shopping journey. The Recruiter creates strong business partnerships with internal clients and leads the full life cycle recruitment process for entry level to C-level openings. The Recruiter develops multiple sourcing channels, including candidate pipelines, to attract the best active and passive candidates, while leveraging technology to ensure an effective and efficient process. Responsible for building and maintaining excellent relationships with both hiring managers and candidates (both internal and external), the Recruiter is instrumental in creating strategy around and executing recruiting strategies.


The Recruiter will be focused on recruiting for highly technical roles
Job Description
Essential Job Functions
Full lifecycle recruitment - Source, screen, and interview applicants with excellent candidate assessment skills. Instrumental in sourcing, screening, interviewing, selecting, and hiring the best available candidate resources using proven recruiting methods and processes in a call center environment for non-exempt roles. Perform full lifecycle recruitment activities such as recruiting, screening, interviewing, and offer negotiation/extension. Conducts sourcing of passive candidates and responsible for targeted sourcing and assessing talent, based on past successes and future business objectives. Utilizes knowledge of tools such as Google Suite, Slack, Zoom, Greenhouse, Workday to execute daily work.
Relationship Management- Establish relationships with hiring managers to assess their job openings and work with them to find the right talent by providing coaching and guidance on internal candidates as well as external. Builds and maintains relationships with hiring managers to maintain awareness of future staffing needs and requirements. Consults and aids in the decision making of hiring best fit candidates with various positions. Demonstrates professional verbal and written communication skills when working with internal or external partners. Presents information in an articulate, professional, and digestible manner.
Business Knowledge - Consistently meet or exceed service level agreements providing the highest possible level of service to the business. Understand Bread’s business and how individual areas contribute to the overall success of the company.
Market Research- Maintains through on-going knowledge of market conditions and competition. Responsible for research and analysis of recruiting market trends, understanding implications and recommending solutions
Project Management - Coordinates various recruitment projects by taking initiative to identify and lead projects that supports the recruiting team in being a more strategic partner. Plan and coordinate recruiting events and represent Bread at job fairs, tradeshows, networking events and community events
Reports to: Lead Recruiter or above

90% Normal office environment
10% job fair environment
Optional work from home
Direct Reports: None
