Associate’s Degree or equivalent work experience in Psychology, Business, Marketing, HR
Three or more years experience in full cycle recruitment
Preferred Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources
Five or more years in Human Resources, Recruiting, Supervisory experience
Previous experience recruiting for highly technical roles
Previous expereince recruiting for a startup tech company
Education:
Associate's Degree (Required), Bachelor’s Degree
Certifications:
Work Experience
Three or more years

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeInternshipFull Job DescriptionAbout us
We are AMS. AMS is a global total workforce solutions firm founded in 1996. We enable organizations to thrive in an age of constant change by building, reshaping, and optimizing workforces. We do this through talent acquisition and contingent workforce management, internal mobility and skills development, and talent and technology advisory services.
Our solutions are delivered by our 4500+ experts who live our passionate, bold, and authentic values. The ultimate aim is to help clients around the world, including 100+ blue-chip companies, create workforces that are fluid, resilient, diverse, and differentiated. We call this true workforce dexterity—and we’re here to help you achieve it.
The role
AMS is currently looking for a talented individual to work as a Campus Recruiter supporting our Tier 1 Investment Banking client in New York, New York.
Our client has earned a worldwide reputation for the excellence of its advice and execution in financial markets. With over 1300 offices in 42 countries, the firm is truly global—and a market leader in the U.S., Europe and Asia as well as in emerging markets. Solving complex challenges and fueling economic growth across continents is our business.
The mission of the Campus Recruiting team is to provide a best-in-class experience to students that showcase our client’s people, culture and impact. If you are looking for a fast-paced, energetic environment, where variety and multi-tasking occurs daily, this is where you want to be.
We are looking for a creative, innovative thinker with strong communication skills who will be able to strengthen our client’s brand on campus and be a culture carrier for the firm.
As a Campus Recruiter, you'll recruit qualified campus graduates to fill entry-level and intern positions within our New York, NY office. You'll lead recruiting activities and develop and maintain relationships with campus placement offices and faculty. The campus recruiter will also be expected to manage and execute the internship program.
Key accountabilities
Design & implement divisional recruiting strategy to attract a strong and diverse pipeline of campus talent that aligns to business goals
Establish relationships with senior business leaders and HR partners to deliver recruiting initiatives, programs, and share/leverage best practices
Building and maintaining hiring manager relationships. Responsible for client satisfaction within own business area
Build external partnerships with diversity, student & industry specific organizations as well as on campus contacts
Understand industry and geographical competitive landscape in order to influence & shape future recruiting strategies
Partner with divisional recruiting teams to define and execute recruiting initiatives
Identify, develop & execute diversity recruiting initiatives
Manage & execute full life cycle recruitment process. This includes candidate selection, first & final round interviews, offer decision & communication process.
Lead & execute an intern program that provides a meaningful experience. This includes performance management, professional development, divisional specific & networking sessions, manager & mentor engagement
Drive candidate engagement through all stages of the recruiting process to ensure a positive candidate experience is delivered
Flexibility to potentially travel during peak seasons
Track & analyze key performance metrics to influence data driven decisions and to share results/trends with stakeholders
Partner with Divisional Management to develop & maintain an annual budget based on hiring targets, divisional recruiting initiatives, and divisional guidance
Skills & experience
To have the opportunity to develop your career in this role, you will need to have:
Bachelor’s degree required
Minimum of 2-5 years of demonstrated, relevant experience
Previous experience in Human Resources or Campus Recruiting preferred; work in a professional services environment or in higher education/career services is applicable
Client focused individual with outstanding judgment & creative problem-solving skills
Thrives in a fast-paced ambiguous environment and has the ability to manage changing priorities while meeting deadlines
Demonstrates strong project management with exceptional organizational skills & attention to detail
Other
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionKaia is a mission focused medical technology company:
Kaia Health was founded in 2016 with the mission of bringing affordable and accessible relief to millions of chronic disease patients. Using innovative technology, we develop digital mind-body therapies that provide better affordable care.

Our first product is a clinically-proven therapy for relieving back pain. Our mobile app gives users access to multimodal pain therapy, the gold standard of therapies in pain medicine. Kaia’s AI powered algorithm provides users with real-time feedback on their exercise execution using their phone. In the near future, we will release digital therapies for COPD, Osteoarthritis, and Parkinson’s disease.

Today we are one of the market leaders in digital therapeutics globally, with 400,000 users. We have raised a total of $50 million from investors like Optum Ventures, Balderton Capital and other top tier healthtech investors. We are building an exceptional team based in Munich and New York to succeed in our mission to bring affordable and accessible relief to millions.
The role encompasses:
Proactively source, recruit, engage, and maintain a strong candidate pipeline for all open positions for assigned departments
Manage recruiting logistics, such as securing interviewers, scheduling candidates and onboarding to deliver on a great candidate experience
Perform in depth interviews for potential hires. This will include analyzing skill set, cultural fit and compensation expectations
Sourcing: Identify and target passive candidates that could meet the current and future hiring needs
Developing a best practices environment for conducting research and finding new sourcing methods to create innovative search strategies
Leverage social media, multiple network sources, online tools, industry relationships, and community involvement to identify top talent
Promote Kaia's brand through creative applications online and offline
Your profile:
Have bachelor’s Degree and 2+ years of full cycle recruitment experience (ideally within a startup environment)

Job detailsSalary$54,140 - $70,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job Description
General Description
Through its partnership with the City of New York, CUNY’s Building Performance Laboratory is hiring qualified energy management professionals to serve as on-site consultants and fill critical staffing capacity needs at the Department of Citywide Administrative Services’ (“DCAS”) Division of Energy Management (“DEM”). For background, DEM serves as the hub for energy management for City government operations. DEM develops the City’s annual Heat, Light, and Power Budget; manages the City’s electricity, natural gas, and steam accounts; helps agency partners identify and pursue energy-saving opportunities; does energy efficiency and clean power generation projects across the City’s portfolio; and implements operations and maintenance best practices. Specifically, DEM is tasked with leading the City’s efforts to reduce emissions from City government operations 40 percent by 2025, 50 percent by 2030, and 80 percent by 2050 from baseline.


For this specific role, on behalf of DEM, CUNY BPL seeks an Analyst/Associate Analyst to serve within DEM’s Strategic Planning Unit. The Analyst/Associate Analyst will offer program management and strategic communications support to the Talent and Organizational Development (“TOD”) Team. They will work closely with DEM’s Human Resources Business Partner and other program managers within the TOD Team. The person in this role will help increase organizational effectiveness, support workforce planning, and establish personnel programs and resources.

Other Duties
The person’s responsibilities are likely to include the following:


Under the domain of program management:
Overall program management support | Contribute to the effective, efficient management of programs falling under the TOD Team (“TOD programs”) and partner with existing program managers to support day-to-day operations. For personnel-related programs, provide support for recruitment and onboarding activities.
Ongoing program development | Partner with existing program managers to identify and implement recommended policy changes and process improvements. Develop program resources and tools to support continuous improvement.
Budget management and performance tracking support | Support invoice management and budget tracking for TOD programs. In addition, contribute to timely, accurate reporting of performance metrics for TOD programs, including collecting and analyzing data.
Special project support | Serve as a project manager for distinct talent, organizational, and workforce development special projects.


Under the domain of strategic communications:

Communications materials development | Develop and revise division-wide materials to communicate updates, successes, and challenges to varied audiences, ranging from internal stakeholders to the public.
Deliverable production | Support development of high-quality deliverables for internal and external communications (print and online communications).

Qualifications
The ideal candidate will bring the following education, skills, and experience to this position:

A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field.
At least two years of responsible full-time work experience, preferably within a people operations, learning and development, or strategic planning context.
Excellent written, verbal, and graphic communication skills, with ability to produce polished, well-structured deliverables.
Strong personal commitment to efficiency and motivation to develop and apply new expertise.
Strong problem-solving skills and a track record of taking initiative to solve identified needs, with appropriate and timely stakeholder consultation along the way.
Energy efficiency background or knowledge is a plus.
City government background or knowledge is a plus.

job_descriptions.5c9783b53e957dea:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionRole Overview
Misen is seeking a full time Talent Acquisition Recruiter to drive talent acquisition and lead the hiring process. This role will be responsible for developing efficient recruitment methods and working closely with various department managers to ensure appropriate job descriptions and hiring plans are implemented successfully.

To be eligible for this role you will have to have worked as an in house recruiter.

This role does not need to be based in our Greenpoint Headquarters and we are accepting remote applicants.


What You'll Do:

Develop, facilitate, and implement all phases of the recruitment process.
Collaborate with department managers to identify and draft detailed and accurate job descriptions and hiring criteria.
Identify and implement efficient and effective recruiting methods and strategies based on the available role, industry standards, and the needs of the organization.
Execute job descriptions and postings, interview questions and interview process for each job role via our ATS and on external job boards.
Screen applications and conduct initial interviews for potential candidates.
Assist with the interview process, attending and conducting interviews with managers, directors, and other stakeholders.
Collaborate with the hiring manager and/or other human resource staff during the offer process, identifying and recommending salary ranges, incentives, start dates, and other pertinent details.
Work within recruitment prospecting tools to generate and record leads.
Proactively research and reach out to potential candidates using various recruiting tools.


Who You Are:

5+ years working as an in house talent recruiter.
Experience hiring across full range of company job functions from Supply Chain, Creative, Marketing, Finance and Product Design.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills with good negotiation tactics.
Ability to create and implement sourcing strategies for recruitment for a variety of roles.
Proactive and independent with the ability to take initiative.
Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
Familiarity with laws, regulations, and best practices applicable to hiring and recruitment.
Proficient with or the ability to quickly learn applicant-track.


You'll love working at Misen because:

We are a team of smart, interesting, diverse, funny, and loving people
We offer competitive compensation, generous health benefits (health, vision, dental), a fun and relaxed office environment
We take the responsibility to make sure you are excited, happy and find fulfillment in your work very seriously
We have no limit on vacation, work from home or sick days because we understand the value of relaxation, spending time with friends and family, and seeing the world
We love dogs and currently our "CEO" (Chief Eating Officer), Fluffnut, rules the roost...but we welcome others to join the team.


About Misen
Our name comes from 'mise en place' — a culinary term that means "to put in place." Chefs use the term to describe the process of setting up their stations before service. Misen is an ode to mise en place; better cooking through proper preparation with quality tools.

Our mission at Misen (www.misen.co) is to inspire and enable great cooking. For us, well-made kitchen tools are essential to that; whether it's getting a perfect golden sear with a quality pan or beautifully slicing vegetables with a sharp knife, quality tools create better meals - and just make cooking more fun. By selling directly to consumers online and cutting out retail middlemen, we're able to offer thoughtfully designed and premium-quality kitchen tools at honest prices.

We launched in 2015, with our Chef's Knife raising over $1M in Kickstarter pledges. Since then, we've been slowly expanding our offerings for the kitchen—including stainless steel cookware and nonstick pans—and have even bigger plans for the future. Now, we're looking for a few incredible humans to help us build the next phase of our growth.

Would you enjoy working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, start-up like environment? If you answered yes to any of these then read further.

Our hiring teams have been hard at work finding the best and brightest people from around the world to develop a new, fully-electric delivery system – Amazon Scout – designed to get packages to customers using autonomous delivery devices. These devices were created by Amazon, are the size of a small cooler, and roll along sidewalks at a walking pace. Our technologists developed Amazon Scout at their research and development lab in Seattle, ensuring the devices can safely and efficiently navigate around pets, pedestrians and anything else in their path. The hiring team shares a passion for innovation using advanced technologies, a love of solving complex challenges, and a desire to impact customers in a meaningful way.

As a Technical Recruiter for the Scout Software team you will be dedicated to enhancing this team’s ability to profile, attract, and convert highly-talented prospects into active candidates for non-fungible SDE roles, including low-level firmware/embedded, systems, and applications that run on the robot. You should be able to conduct deep talent analysis, and develop recruiting strategies that include sourcing, candidate engagement/advisement and closing candidates with niche skillsets, as well as leading syncs and owning reporting delivery for the Software leadership team.

The role can be based in Seattle, Austin or Nashville.

Boldly coloring outside the lines of luxury, W turns the traditional notion of the extravagant hotel on its head. Our irreverent attitude and taste for excess redefine revelry for the modern jet set. Our guests have a lust for a life less ordinary that drives them to demand more, experience it all, and hit repeat.

We share our guests’ passions, providing insider access to what’s new and what’s next. Moderation is not in our vocabulary and we know that lust for life demands more, not less. W guests soak it in and live each day with a mantra: Detox.Retox.Repeat. If you’re ready to create the energetic W scene that is magnetic to everyday disruptors around the world, then we invite you to explore a career with W Hotels.

JOB SUMMARY
Promote awareness of brand image internally and externally. Use sales techniques that maximize revenue while maintaining existing guest loyalty to Marriott. Recognize opportunities to up-sell the customer and sell enhancements to create a better Marriott experience or event. Encourage guests or callers to purchase or schedule preview package sales/tours. Explain details and requirements related to attending a sales presentation to potential owners. Verify that individuals meet eligibility requirements for preview package sales/tours prior to scheduling a tour for a Marriott vacation club property. Determine and give complimentaries to guests as gifts for their patronage (e.g., rewards points, show tickets). Answer guest questions about property facilities/services. Receive, record, and relay messages accurately, completely, and legibly.
Follow all company policies and procedures; ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards; anticipate and address guests’ service needs; thank guests with genuine appreciation. Speak with others using clear and professional language; prepare and review written documents accurately and completely; answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others; support team to reach common goals; listen and respond appropriately to the concerns of other employees. Comply with quality assurance expectations and standards. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance; stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.
MIRJ
Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.

Job detailsSalary$45,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionThe Random House Marketing team is known for creative, engaging and effective campaigns that drive awareness, conversation and sales. Random House is committed to offering a diverse list of smart, timely, commercially appealing books that educate, entertain, and inspire readers to lead more informed and meaningful lives. From Tara Westover and Isabel Wilkerson to Elizabeth Strout and George Saunders, we are the home of Pulitzer Prize winners, literary and commercial superstars, and emerging voices. We seek out the writers with authentic voices, influential experts, and provocative thought leaders to share their ideas in book form.
Position Summary
The Marketing team at Random House is seeking a Marketing Assistant, reporting to the team’s two marketing directors. The position provides an opportunity to immerse yourself in a hands-on department that plans campaigns for fiction and nonfiction books and works collaboratively across departments. We deal directly with authors and agents, coordinate internally with our editorial, sales, and publicity colleagues, and work creatively to present our books directly to consumers. This position requires excellent communication and organizational skills, and the ability to prioritize and work independently in a fast-paced integrated marketing department.
The Marketing Assistant will be part of the campaign planning stages, brainstorm creative promotions, prepare meeting documents, assist with book mailings, research new promotional opportunities, and track consumer reviews. In addition to providing administrative support, the assistant will regularly liaise with media buyers, copywriters, designers, publicists, and other marketers, in order to facilitate the timely execution of marketing campaigns.
Responsibilities ad Duties:
Assist Random House title marketers with specific title campaigns, including digital & social media, author platform building, consumer research, and messaging
Cross collaborate all in house departments: publicity, editorial, sales, production, design, analytics
Coordinate category specific promotions, sweepstakes, creative briefs, consumer events, and internal meetings
Contribute content through brainstorming and ideation to e-newsletters, websites and social media campaigns
Assemble reports to track consumer feedback and refine messaging
Brainstorm and research advertising outlets for connecting with readers
An attractive quality in our newest team member would be a critical thinker with expressed interest in research.
With this in mind, to be successful in this role we feel that you’ll need to have:
Evidenced ability to stimulate interest around a product, idea, or campaign
Proficiency as well as strong interest in using social media platforms as a marketing tool
Knowledge or passion for discovering new trends in digital and social media
Creative problem solving and decision making
Great organization, collaborative, and communication skills, especially as you liaise with various teams and prioritize your work
Ability to prioritize multiple projects in fast paced environment
Highly proficient in Microsoft Word
Design experience a plus
Salary for this position is $45,000. Full-time employees are eligible for our comprehensive benefits program. Please apply using our online application process, and please include your resume and cover letter.
Penguin Random House is the leading adult and children’s publishing house in North America, the United Kingdom and many other regions around the world. In publishing the best books in every genre and subject for all ages, we are committed to quality, excellence in execution, and innovation throughout the entire publishing process: editorial, design, marketing, publicity, sales, production, and distribution. Our vibrant and diverse international community of nearly 250 publishing brands and imprints include Ballantine Bantam Dell, Berkley, Clarkson Potter, Crown, DK, Doubleday, Dutton, Grosset & Dunlap, Little Golden Books, Knopf, Modern Library, Pantheon, Penguin Books, Penguin Press, Penguin Random House Audio, Penguin Young Readers, Portfolio, Puffin, Putnam, Random House, Random House Children’s Books, Riverhead, Ten Speed Press, Viking, and Vintage, among others. More information can be found at http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/.
Penguin Random House values the array of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

City: New York

ViacomCBS (NASDAQ: VIAC; VIACA) is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic consumer brands, its portfolio includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, CBS All Access, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. The company delivers the largest share of the U.S. television audience and boasts one of the industry's most important and extensive libraries of TV and film titles. In addition to offering innovative streaming services and digital video products, ViacomCBS provides powerful capabilities in production, distribution and advertising solutions for partners on five continents.

MTV Entertainment Group (MTV, Comedy Central, Paramount Network, Smithsonian Channel, Pop TV, CMT, VH1, TV Land, Logo and their respective content studios – as well as MTV Documentary Films) Communications team is looking for a coordinator who will dual report to two NY based Vice Presidents.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeInternshipFull Job DescriptionIn the Active Cosmetics Division, we make a difference to the lives of millions of consumers by improving the health and beauty of their skin, through every stage of life. Our brands (CeraVe, SkinCeuticals, La Roche Posay, Vichy and Dermablend) lead the way in skin care innovation, offering safe and effective products and services that deliver their promises. We invest heavily in research and development, and co-create our products with health professionals, scientists and the 90,000 dermatologists we serve around the world. We also design connected beauty experiences, harnessing intelligent technologies to empower people to take control of their skin health.

Our mission is to make a positive impact on people's lives. We are driven by human values of trust, respect and authenticity. Our teams work in a dynamic, supportive environment and work on meaningful projects that are changing the future of medical beauty. If you want to lead in innovation, technology and research, and you care about collaborating with passionate colleagues, serving communities and acting for the planet, please join us!
Marketing Intern – La Roche-Posay
Driven, productive, eager to learn/improve, self-motivated, team and detail-oriented are qualities necessary for success in this role. Provide assistance to the marketing team across all product lines with an emphasis on sun care.
12 Month Internship Program: L’Oreal USA has a unique program for recent graduates! It is a full time paid internship for up to 12 months where you are a fully contributing member of our Accounting Shared Services team here at L’Oreal working across different divisions. You will receive the experience and training needed to set you up for future success in the company.

Bachelor’s degree – must have graduated within the past 12 months
Proficient in Microsoft Office – Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook
Ability to handle fast-paced environment and to multi-task
Proactive, Ability to self-manage projects, High level of organization, ability to overcome obstacles
Creative thinking – ability to ideate new animations, promotions
Sensitivity to health and beauty
Sense of aesthetics, attention to details and quality
Brand métier – ability to discern brand appropriate activities/investments
Basic business acumen, desire to better understand customer and sales dynamics
Analytical proficiency and willingness to learn – how to analyze impact/effectiveness of investments, ROI
Articulate, strong interpersonal skills, team oriented and personable
Willingness & ability to own, follow up on and complete any administrative tasks
Marketing Duties:
Support Marketing team in developing strategy and material to support new and existing products
Support the head of Product Development in managing the development of new products for the US market
Work with cross-functional teams to manage Retailer’s Grid and coordinate kits ’events/sales memo
Work closely with Creative Agency to develop material for in-store marketing activities and for sales teams
Pull and analyze brands and market sell-out data from IRI/RSI panels
Support marketing Team in preparing material for internal strategic meetings (Competitors products and ads, Sell-out analysis, Product comps…)
Assist with organization of congresses and sales meetings
Assist with administrative team needs (DPM, Coupons…)
Ad-hoc marketing projects
Travel
Ability to travel to congresses, sales meetings, and press events

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJob Summary:
The Walt Disney Company’s Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) is a new, global business segment for The Walt Disney Company with the mission of providing consumers around the world access to the content they want most, on the latest platforms, at a time of rapidly evolving consumer habits. Combining the Company’s direct-to-consumer streaming services – ESPN+, the Disney+ streaming service and its ownership stake in Hulu – alongside Disney’s international media businesses, DMED aligns cutting-edge technology with world-class content and beloved brands to expand the Company’s global footprint and deliver highly personalized entertainment experiences to diverse consumers around the world.

Reporting into the VP, Sales Communications, the Director, Brand Marketing role will be responsible for leading Disney Advertising Sales’ one to many communication strategies through brand development, content marketing and communications. The Disney Platform is a combined set of data, technology and creative capabilities that empowers advertisers to buy once and deliver everywhere, addressing the market's needs for an automated and fully addressable future. This role will focus on delivering effective storytelling to both internal and external customers to elevate the Disney Advertising Sales Brand and its robust multi-media, multi-platform strategy.

Responsibilities:
Lead the DAS Brand positioning and go-to-market strategy for how the DAS portfolio shows up in the marketplace by:
Creating best in class material that elevates the Disney Platform’s strengths in content, creativity, technology and innovation.
Working with cross functional teams to develop positioning around Disney’s unified approach, allowing marketers to buy once, deliver everywhere, have common measurement and harness automation, addressability, and convergence.
Delivering differentiated message around Disney’s leadership in Streaming TV.
Developing compelling stories that speak to market differentiators and key attributes in performance marketing, self-serve, multi-cultural, etc.
Develop consistent and unified brand identity
Drive innovative and strategic-thinking, going after the whitespace and challenging the status quo, for progressive solutions and executions
Manage client communications that are deployed externally, identifying the most salient points, effective communication levers and client database.
Provide Sales with white glove service and ongoing communications tied to developments in performance, solutions, revenue priorities, insights, etc. in consultation with cross-functional teams and keeping them abreast of external activity.
Supervise a team, providing strategic business oversight and career development
Candidates must be adept at working in a fast-paced environment and successfully juggle multiple assignments at once with tight deadlines. Candidates should demonstrate resourcefulness, problem-solving abilities, and have the ability to work independently and with others at all levels and cross the full organization.
This role requires diversity of thought, leaning into Disney’s strengths in both culture and innovation. Given the rapid changes to the media environment, this role will be critical to evolving and growing with the landscape, understanding our full suite of solutions.

Basic Qualifications:
10+ years of experience in related fields (sales support, marketing, advertising, communications)
Expertise in brand marketing and brand positioning work
Ability to create comprehensive brand narratives, in an organized and thoughtful way with an ability to translate insights into persuasive stories
Understanding of cross-platform capabilities, including multi-media and addressable
Excellent strategic and creative thinker
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Superior Keynote and /or PowerPoint skills
Prior management experience
Required Education
College degree in Marketing, Communications or related field (or other college degree with relevant work experience)

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionMORE ABOUT THIS JOB:

Please note division and function examples are representative of opportunities common for this skill-set. The list is not exhaustive, and availability of open roles is determined based on business need. Specific roles will be confirmed through the interview process.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:

Whether it is developing product roadmaps or creating compelling content, colleagues that focus on product management and marketing drive the development, launch, and continuous promotion of our products and offerings. Through their work, they act as consultative partners to our businesses, evaluate products and develop strategic communication plans targeted to audiences.

Product management and marketing teams across the firm operate with creative and strategic thinking, and excellent writing and project management skills.

Divisions and Job Functions

Product Management Teams build trusted relationships with our design, engineering, marketing, and other teams to craft and launch beautiful, easy-to-use features that solve customer problems related to personal finance

Brand and Content Strategy Teams develop and implement global marketing campaigns and strategic initiatives that drive sales, client retention, and/or brand, inclusive of media and internal communications

Goldman Sachs Asset Management (GSAM) Product Teams are responsible for managing client interactions across the investment businesses. These responsibilities include identifying and researching prospective investors, analyzing the role of investments in a client’s portfolio, and working with clients and the investment teams to develop unique solutions. Analysts support the team’s client interactions through the development and production of marketing materials, analysis and review of client portfolios, collection and analysis of relevant market data, as well as participation in strategic initiatives.

Ayco, A Goldman Sachs Company partners with Fortune 1000 companies to design and implement tailored financial planning programs for their workforce—leveraging the 50-year heritage of Ayco and the comprehensive resources of Goldman Sachs to meet the evolving needs of their employees. Ayco believes companies best serve their stakeholders and the greater economy when their employees’ financial lives are clear, understood and in their control. Ayco advisors and technical specialists help clients achieve their personal financial goals through education and guided implementation across seven key financial disciplines, including employee benefit planning. Hiring teams include:
Counseling provides proactive financial counseling, full-service implementation, including tax preparation and investments, to address complexities of executives, entrepreneurs and high net worth individuals. Analysts have extensive client interaction and prepare various reports for clients in the areas of cash flow planning, income tax projections, investment allocation, investment performance,
Coaching delivers management and navigation of personal finances, life events and company benefits through a digital platform with one-on-one guidance from a coach. Analysts will provide comprehensive personal financial planning to clients via a telephone environment.
Family Office provides sophisticated solutions to streamline the intricate financial lives of ultra-high net worth families, through comprehensive coordination, advanced risk management, investment services and legacy preservation strategies.
Wealth Strategies Group specializes in the design and implementation of wealth protection and wealth transfer strategies for high net-worth clients.
Private Wealth Management provides investment-advisory, education, portfolio-management and trade-execution strategies. Analysts serve as key liaison between clients, investment and operations teams.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree (2017 – December 2020)
0-3 years of prior work experience in a relevant field
Proficient to advanced skills with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)
Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Strong ability to manage multiple projects with competing deadlines
Team player with positive attitude and strong work ethic
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Strong quantitative and analytical skills; investment acumen required for some roles
Candidates must demonstrate an ability to effectively communicate and present results highlighting the broader commercial and strategic impact
Candidates should be comfortable developing relationships throughout the firm and building networks within the division as well as with other divisions
Demonstrated ability to think creatively, strategically, and operationally with a commercial mindset
Ability to understand, dissect and analyze data to drive decisions and/or make recommendations
Strong problem-solving and project management skills
Strong communicator who can effectively gain alignment up, down and across teams
Strong project-management skills
Expertise in project plan management, strong understanding of key performance metrics and drivers
Exposure to the launch and management of products
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS:

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionCompany Description
As an Etsy employee, you can do the work you love, be yourself, and make an impact in the lives of millions. Our commitments to diversity and inclusion, team culture and the spaces where we work all reflect our mission to keep commerce human.

Job Description
We are seeking an experienced email and push marketer to help expand the reach and personalization of our CRM channels, working closely with our Merchandising, Brand, Strategic Marketing, and Marketing Technology teams to innovate email and push marketing through automation and segmentation.
Etsy’s CRM team, part of the Growth Marketing team within the Etsy Marketing Organization, leads the strategy, data integration, production, deployment, and reporting of marketing campaigns that help more than 40 million buyers worldwide find and purchase the perfect item on Etsy and leaves them wanting to come back again and again, and provides over 3 million sellers with the guidance and support they need to continue to grow their business on Etsy.
This is a full-time, position located (eventually) in Brooklyn, NY, reporting to the Senior Marketing Marketing Manager, CRM. We offer flexible workplace policies that can accommodate work from home candidates who are comfortable traveling to an office location 2-3 times per week.
About the Role
We’re looking for someone who has shown success in driving channel engagement and buyer frequency through email and push marketing and is excited by the prospect of improving channel marketing through user segmentation, automation, content optimization, and product improvements. An ideal candidate is someone who can think strategically about messaging cadence, targeting, and user experience and execute our CRM strategy with agility and with a strong desire to work for a fast-paced company that does things differently.
Lead strategic calendar planning in partnership with other Marketing teams such as Strategic Marketing, Brand, Design, and Product Marketing
Lead day-to-day project management of the email and push production process and use HTML to build and deploy campaigns in partnership with the Editorial, Copy, Brand, and Design teams.
Work with our Database Marketing team to target key buyer cohorts with personalized messaging and content at scale
Execute longitudinal and multi-variant testing across multiple audiences and launch experiments to optimize the channel performance with a focus on meeting or exceed CRM goals, including buyer retention and seller growth.
Implement continuous optimization of marketing platform features/tools
Continuously improve processes and efficiency to ensure the team remains agile and responsive to the business.
Deliver and maintain analytics reporting that measures the performance of each campaign and own email campaign insights on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.
Proactively share daily and weekly updates on your work and your progress towards goals
Contribute to ongoing CRM initiatives including continual optimization of channel strategy, platform, and related processes
This role requires occasionally working outside of normal business hours such as weekends, late nights, or early mornings depending on campaign launch times

Qualifications
2+ years direct marketing experience with proven success in executing highly targeted email and push marketing programs in a fast-paced environment.
Organized, efficient, and inventive leader with advanced problem solving skills, outstanding attention to detail, effective communication skills, and excellent time management abilities.
Agile and quick to adapt to the evolving business needs and objectives but also acutely aware of long term goals.
Accountability to deliver high quality work and are proactive to share new ideas with peers and leadership
Highly collaborative and operate with integrity, confidence, and compassion.
Passionate about supporting small businesses and deeply care about the Etsy buyer and seller experience.
Understand CAN-SPAM/CASL/GDPR requirements and inbox deliverability standards.
Understand the basics of data segmentation and data attribution: Some SQL knowledge preferred.
Have worked with a third party email service provider: Braze preferred
Have intermediate HTML skills
Additional Information
What's Next
If you're interested in joining the team at Etsy, please send a cover letter and resume telling us why you'd be right for the position. As you’ve hopefully seen already, Etsy is a place that values individuality and variety. We don’t want you to be like everyone else — we want you to be like you! So write to us and tell us what you’re all about.
Our Promise
At Etsy, we believe that a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace makes us a more relevant, more competitive, and more resilient company. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. Etsy is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. While Etsy supports visa sponsorship, sponsorship opportunities may be limited to certain roles and skillsets.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timePart-timeFull Job DescriptionGlobal Merchant Services (GMS) Marketing is dedicated to bringing buyers and sellers together and transforming how American Express is welcomed. GMS Marketing is responsible for partnering with GMS markets to drive profitable growth, accelerate Merchant acceptance and enhance the value of Amex acceptance to Merchants and Card Members at scale. We focus on enhancing our relationships with millions of Merchants of all shapes and sizes, and our geographic purview includes many commerce hubs across the globe including the U.S, Canada, Latin America, the Caribbean, Europe and the Asia-Pacific region.
This exciting opportunity is on the Custom Consulting team within the GMS Marketing organization focusing on Amex Offers, marketing partnerships and insights. This team drives tremendous value to the broader Merchant Services organization by effectively engaging the merchant base and delivering impactful digital marketing partnerships.
Job Responsibilities:
This marketing analyst role will partner directly with our Marketing Consultants to support merchant partnerships, with a particular focus on Travel Insights and Amex Offers for prioritized merchant partners. This candidate will be responsible for driving multiple projects, including marketing execution, results tracking and analysis, and budget/invoice management.
The primary merchant clients for the team are Airline, Lodging, Car Rental and OTA brands, including Delta, Hilton, Marriott, Avis, Enterprise and Expedia, among others.
Key areas of focus:
Ensuring the flawless business operations of selling, setting up and delivering Amex Offers marketing engagements with merchant clients
Helping drive strategic initiatives and special projects for leadership including setting sales targets, analyzing the portfolio for risk, and crafting product roadmap for enhancements to Amex Offers channels
Project management launch of new feature capabilities, including partnering with Marketing Consultants and other internal stakeholders to build pipeline and provide campaign execution support
Supporting analytics requests for business insights projects, merchant proposals and business performance reviews
Minimum Qualifications
BA/BS preferred with 2+ years of professional work experience
Strong Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills, as well as comfort with, and interest in, analytics and problem solving
Attention to detail and ability to multi-task in a fast, high-energy environment
Experience working in program management and end-to-end project management
Experience with results tracking and analysis, invoicing and/or budget management
Positive and professional attitude; willingness to pitch in and go above and beyond

Additional Details:
Location: 200 Vesey St, New York, NY 10281
Ongoing Workplace Flexibility: Position will currently be work-from-home due to COVID-19. American Express is committed to the well-being of its colleagues and to creating a safe work environment; colleagues will continue to work remotely until a return to the office can be safely accomplished.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionThe New York Times is a creative environment where people with different backgrounds and skill sets come together to develop the products that deliver our journalism to millions of people around the world. As an Administrative Assistant, you will play a crucial role in the success of our executives and in building a culture for the team. You will support executives in the teams that build our website and mobile apps, assisting with day-to-day tasks that help keep the department running smoothly.
It is critical that you have a “roll up the sleeves and get it done” attitude to ensure our teams run efficiently and successfully. The ideal candidate is a multitasker, extremely well organized, hands-on, proactive, and excited to be a part of an important brand.
In this role, you’ll partner closely with department leaders, and will serve as the main point of contact for operations & staff support, fulfilling a vital function in assisting our cross functional teams.
Our team highly values its culture, and you will play a key role in creating a positive work environment. Throughout the course of your duties, you will be privy to highly confidential information and must display the utmost discretion and professionalism.
There will be multiple daily tasks that will be part of this person's responsibilities.
Some responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Managing calendars, scheduling meetings, handling visitors and booking conference rooms
Manage travel bookings of airfare / hotels / transportation
Preparing monthly expense reports & managing purchases within the department
Assisting with miscellaneous office management tasks
Coordinating for events like department All Hands & large group meetings
Attending weekly meetings, managing agendas, note taking & facilitating meeting deliverables
Assisting with presentations & documents for leadership teams
Communicating & coordinating regularly with leadership teams
Providing a wide range of operational support and assisting with special projects as they arise
Maintaining department organizational charts, distribution lists, team lists & seating charts
Implementing communication strategies across the department
Planning events, including lunches and social gatherings/activities, to cultivate an inclusive and friendly culture within the department
Building and managing relationships with various departments throughout the organization, as well as other administrative assistants
Back-up support to other Administrative/Executive Assistants as needed
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
Experience managing multiple complex calendars and scheduling appointments
Ability to handle multiple time-sensitive tasks simultaneously
Experience dealing with confidential information with discretion and professionalism
Strong interpersonal skills - able to effectively interact with all levels of management and staff in a highly professional manner
Ability to identify and tackle problems and make suggestions for improvements
Knowledge of G-Suite [Gmail, Google Slides/Sheets/Documents/Drive/Forms]
Ability to learn new systems and software
Some experience with Workday is preferred
No task too big or small attitude
Collaborative and eager to learn

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAssociate Social Media Marketing, HBO Max LatAm
Location Miami, Florida | New York, New York
Business: Turner
Position Type: Full Time
Job ID 181854BR
Company Overview

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.
HBO Max is the future of entertainment and storytelling.
WarnerMedia’s new streaming entertainment offering, HBO Max is the culmination of some of the most innovative new technology and greatest creative talent in the industry. Anchored by the entire HBO service, arguably the greatest brand in television, HBO Max also features fan favorites from the WarnerMedia library including Warner Bros., New Line, DC, CNN, TNT, TBS, truTV, Turner Classic Movies, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Crunchyroll, Rooster Teeth, Looney Tunes, and more. HBO Max will also be home to key third-party library acquisitions, such as Friends, South Park and Doctor Who, and more than 50 exclusive Originals in its first year, from the likes of groundbreaking creative talent such as J.J. Abrams, Ridley Scott, Jordan Peele, Steven Soderbergh, Michael Mann, Mindy Kaling, Reese Witherspoon, Anna Kendrick, Greg Berlanti, Melissa McCarthy, Robert Zemeckis, Ellen DeGeneres, and other visionaries.

The Job
The Social Media Associate is a critical member of the social team and will support the implementation of campaigns to create and sustain an engaged and loyal fan base across multiple social platforms including Facebook/Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, Spotify, Snapchat, YouTube, etc. This role is highly collaborative and will work across the organization with multiple stakeholders to implement strategies for growth and success.

The Daily
Assist in developing optimization strategies for each page/channel on each platform based off KPIs and performance metrics established by the Sr. Manager.
Assist in finding ways to use social media and content to deepen our relationship with our audiences, to drive subscriptions, grow our digital/social channel footprint, and leverage all organic marketing efforts to reach users in meaningful and engaging ways.
Help in developing and strategizing plans for new audience programs within social media.
Monitor and respond to social media conversations on managed platforms; use listening tools to pick up relevant pop culture conversations or trends that can help HBO MAX stay relevant.
Flag and escalate any crisis related complaints to the Manager through active social listening and monitoring.
Coordinate and manage the content calendar to be used on social media platforms.
Publish content on social media channels, leveraging social media management (SMM) systems and marketing automation tools/software.
Ensure publications are released in a timely manner regardless of the day of the week; must commit portions of weekend, weeknights and occasionally holidays to post on social platforms as needed.
Work closely with the international marketing teams to flag and traffic KA’s and trailers to the in-house creative teams for quick turnover of adaptations.
Work with internal departments to ensure effective execution of social media marketing tactics.
Collaborate with the Manager to propose engaging social content to promote digital priorities (memes, Instagram stories, Instagram games)
Partner with team members to develop weekly, monthly and quarterly social strategies and calendars.
Manage ongoing campaigns to ensure that content is planned, placed and updated appropriately.
Track and shepherd content approvals with internal and external stakeholders.
Produce ad hoc campaign reports for priority releases and promotions
Stay abreast of new social platforms and best practices.

The Essentials
BS degree, with a concentration in Social Media, Public Relations, Journalism, Business preferred or equivalent work experience.
2+ years’ experience in entertainment, social media, and/or marketing.
Strong reporting skills and experience with web analytic tools required.
Experience using social, project management and reporting tools like Sprinklr, Hootsuite, Asana, etc.
Ability to work collaboratively across the organization with employees at all levels.
Highly organized and able to manage multiple projects at once.
Knowledge and strong interest in pop culture, social platforms and influencer talent.
Fluency in Spanish and English is a must; Portuguese is a plus.

The Perks
Paid time off every year to volunteer
Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
2019 Best Company for Working Mothers
2019 Best Company for Dads
An in-house learning and development team to help shape and grow your career
Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

Position Title: Social Media Specialist
Reports To: Director of Branding
Job Summary: Do you tweet, share, and post to social media in your sleep? Do you know what it takes to grow an online community? We're looking for a social media manager to manage our social media accounts by implementing strategies and tactics that grow our followers, engage and retain them, and help convert them into leads, customers, and active fans and promoters of our company. You should have command of best practices and trends in social media marketing, enjoy being creative, and understand how to both build and convert a digital audience.
Responsibilities include:

Build and manage the company’s social media profiles and presence, including Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTock, and additional channels that may be deemed relevant.
Create shareable content appropriate for specific networks to spread both our brand and our content.
Monitor and engage in relevant social discussions about our company, competitors, and/or industry, both from existing leads and customers as well as from brand new audiences.
Collaborate with other team members to help distribute content that educates and entertains our audience and supports marketing goals.
Drive consistent, relevant traffic and leads from our social network presence.
Explore new ways to engage and identify new social networks to reach our target buyers.
Track, measure and analyze all initiatives to report on social media ROI.


Job Requirements:


BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience.
Active and well-rounded personal presence in social media, with a command of each network and their best practices.
Excellent communicator and creative thinker, with an ability to use both data and intuition to inform decisions.
Proficiency in using social media software to monitor social media conversations. You will be our ear to the ground to route the appropriate marketer, sales rep, and/or support rep to social conversations.
Bonus experience and skills include Adobe Creative Suite, demand generation, inbound marketing, and blogging.

This includes branding and messaging, website development and maintenance, production of newsletters, press releases, annual reports, marketing literature, and other print publications and directories. Experience writing grants, proposals and or marketing briefs.Position Summary: · Reporting to the President and CEO and serving as an integral member of the executive leadership team, The Director of Communications and Marketing will be responsible for Damian Family Care Centers, Inc.’s communications and marketing strategy and will contribute to the organizational strategic planning process. The Director of Communications and Marketing will develop a communications plan directly managing communications activities that promote, enhance and protect the organization’s brand reputation and will be responsible for the development, integration and implementation of a service marketing strategy and a broad range of public relations activities relative to the strategic direction and positioning of the organization and its leadership.Essential Functions: · Be an ambassador for the organization to advance the organization’s position with relevant constituents.· Drive broader awareness and philanthropic support for the organization.· Expand and diversify the organization’s funder base and philanthropic giving and develop and implement a strategic development plan.· Have primary responsibility for identifying new business opportunities through market research.Key Responsibility Areas1. Communications Strategy, Vision and Leadership· Develop and implement an integrated strategic communications plan to advance Damian Family Care Center’s brand identity, broaden awareness of its programs and priorities, and increase the visibility of its programs across key stakeholder audiences· Create marketing/public relations/development strategy that will allow Damian Family Care Centers leadership to cultivate and enhance meaningful relationships with targeted, high-level external audiences, including the media, key influencers and donors.· Identify challenges and emerging issues faced by the organization. Work with the CEO and leadership team and staff to recognize internal and external communications opportunities and solutions, and define and executive appropriate strategies to support them.2. Communications Operations· Oversee development of all Damian Family Care Centers print communications including the annual report, marketing collateral materials and electronic communications including website and new media. job_descriptions.52fecfcf852993ab:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAssistant Manager, Promotion Planning & Scheduling- HBO
Location New York, New York
Business: HBO
Position Type: Full Time
Job ID 182270BR
We're HBO
HBO is one of the most respected and innovative entertainment brands in the world, serving iconic, award-winning programming to 140 million subscribers globally. A subsidiary of WarnerMedia, HBO is the world’s most successful pay TV service with an extensive array of programming that includes some of the most notable titles to be on television, including drama series Succession®, Watchmen®, Westworld®, Big Little Lies®, Game of Thrones®, The Sopranos®, Band of Brothers® and The Wire®, as well as comedy series Barry®, Insecure® and Sex and the City®. HBO is committed to retaining and recruiting skilled and motivated employees, placing a priority on qualified team players who contribute to the diversity of their workforce.

Join Us
We're looking for meticulous, organized, strategic thinker, and Excel wizard to serve as a key contributor in the development of on-channel campaigns for HBO. As Assistant Manager, Promotion Planning and Scheduling, you'll be assisting the Planning and Scheduling Teams both in weekly targeting and tracking, as well as long-term campaign planning. On a daily basis, you'll work in a highly collaborative environment, partnering with stakeholders across the organization as well as your manager, the Manager of Promotion Planning & Scheduling.

This role will be located eventually in New York, New York, but alas, currently we're all working remotely for the time being as is most of the world due to the pandemic.

What You'll Be Doing

Entering and maintaining campaign timelines for all HBO linear campaigns using our in-house application, CUBE
Working with your manager to determine upcoming campaign start dates for HBO and Cinemax each month
Working closely with Marketing Operations to ensure continuity in asset start dates for every linear campaign
Meeting weekly to inform and update the scheduling team and developing weekly reporting for asset tracking of all ongoing campaigns,
Generating and publishing promo planning workbooks for 4 linear channels, including HBO, HBO2, HBO Signature and Cinemax Main
Providing post-campaign analysis in order to inform similar upcoming campaign strategies, including creation of target profiles for select campaigns
Participating in CUBE troubleshooting and exploration of new uses
Maintaining dashboards for Looker and Tableau
Assisting in ad-hoc tracking projects for both internal and collaborative needs
Creating weekly internal MORPH requests for Sunday and Monday breaks screening
Working with the Operations team in maintaining and tracking secondary event assets (including credit crunches and “bugs”)

Who You Are
You have 3+ years’ experience in tracking/long-range planning/analysis in a media environment
Don't worry, you'll be trained in our internal tool, CUBE
You have a strong interest or experience in the entertainment industry
You have experience working with Looker as well as exceptionally strong skills in Excel and Powerpoint.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills as well as meticulous attention to detail
You're able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and are comfortable with the possibility that priorities may shift on short notice.
You're stoked at the thought of looking at schedules, organizing data and analyzing numbers and trends.

We're Part of WarnerMedia
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

job_descriptions.e8c285e1752a70db: Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeNumber of hires for this role1QualificationsBachelor's (Preferred)Marketing: 1 year (Preferred)Full Job DescriptionMohonk Mountain House is a Victorian castle resort nestled in the scenic Hudson Valley only 90 miles north of New York City. This National Historic Landmark has been owned and operated by the Smiley family since its founding in 1869 and with its spectacular natural setting of timeless cliffs and a pristine mountain lake on 1,200 woodland acres, Mohonk Mountain House has welcomed guests for over 152 years. With 265-rooms, an award-winning Spa, 85 miles of hiking trails, and an abundance of seasonal resort recreation and guided activities (hiking, tennis, golf, horseback riding, carriage rides, boating, lake swimming, mountain biking, rock climbing, snowshoeing, ice-skating, cross-country skiing, and more) this timeless resort welcomes guests throughout the year. With awards from Condé Nast Traveler and Travel + Leisure, among others, and media hits that range from The New York Times to Forbes and many more, Mohonk Mountain House offers old world charm with modern amenities and overnight rates that include meals and resort activities.Please visit www.mohonk.com to learn more about Mohonk Mountain House and www.mohonk.com/careers to apply for the position.BASIC FUNCTION AND RESPONSIBILITY:The Director of Marketing identifies, evaluates, and develops marketing opportunities to ensure timely and strategic actions that will meet and exceed budgeted revenues and occupancy. This individual is a key member of the Revenue Strategy Team, working to create and implement an integrated marketing and communications plan that supports each revenue center. The Director of Marketing is a member of the Executive Team and shares strategic input to help guide the future positioning of the resort in the industry. He/she oversees all aspects of marketing across platforms to ensure brand integrity in all efforts, including digital marketing, website, social media, public relations, internal marketing, printed collateral materials, and traditional advertising.ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:Strategic Expertise and Coordination· Oversees planning and scheduling of digital marketing campaigns for Mohonk Mountain House and revenue centers.· Oversees website updates and enhancements to maintain accurate information online across all platforms.· Responsible for the development and oversight of social media and digital marketing efforts.· Analyzes Mohonk Mountain House databases and external databases for marketing intelligence.· Oversees graphic design projects· Promotes high visibility of resort. Develops public relations materials, as needed. Coordinates and hosts media site visits and media events.· Achieves national rankings in consumer travel media.· Oversees annual Strategic Marketing Plan and conducts competitive analysis, as needed.· Develops partnership opportunities to support brand.· Maintains membership in professional organizations. Stays current in Best Practices in resort hospitality marketing.· Actively supports and behaves in accordance with Mohonk Mountain House’s mission and service statements.· Uses good judgment in assessing cost/benefit of marketing opportunities.· Applies strong analytic skills to all aspects of job.· Travels to industry conferences and Marketing Team retreats up to 6% of the year.· Analyze problems and develop and implement action plans to address problems.Creativity, Collaboration and Communication· Attends, prepares and provides summary presentation to the Board of Directors at regularly scheduled meetings (a minimum of 3 times per year).· Develops, writes, and implements integrated marketing plans for each revenue center to meet and exceed goals.· Partners with theme programs, spa, entertainment and events teams to brainstorm for future events that support brand and goals.· Works closely with colleagues throughout the resort to ensure smooth operations regarding marketing.· Collaborates with company Directors as needed, to support overall property and to support sales goals.· Ensures materials conform to Mohonk Mountain House’s standards, policies and procedures; maintains appropriate image and presentation in all efforts. Leads and facilitates development of standards to maintain and enhance the credibility of the Mohonk Mountain House brand.· Effectively interacts with colleagues and external agencies with professionalism and integrity.· Writes well, producing clear, concise, compelling copy.· Thinks creatively.· Communicates clearly and comfortably with groups and the media.Competency and Analysis· Establishes and analyzes key metrics for ROI.· Conducts research to understand guests’ needs and preferences.· Develops, maintains and implements Marketing budgeting and reforecasting. Effectively controls expenses.· Oversees agencies/vendors to achieve excellence in meeting revenue objectives.· Work quickly and independently exhibiting good judgment in situations of ambiguity.· Perform basic mathematical functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.· Speak, read and write the English language and communicate in a clear and congenial manner, with our guests, visitors and employees. Hear verbal instructions, directions and warnings.· Reach with hands and arms, bend, kneel, stoop, twist and flex arms, walk up and down stairs/inclines, sit or stand for up to 5 hours at a time.· Lift up to 20 pounds from ground level to counter level and carry a distance of up to 25 feet with/without assistance. Walk up to 3 miles per day.· See close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.· Identify and differentiate between variations and shades of color.· Learn and successfully demonstrate the Mohonk Mountain House Service Steps with Service Strategies with guests and staff.· Learn and retain knowledge of historical facts and current information about Mohonk Mountain House.· Act calmly and effectively in emergency situations.Administration and Management· Oversees Marketing Department to support all efforts and to achieve implementation of efforts on time and on budget.· Maintains organized and detail-oriented timelines and files for all marketing efforts.· Handles multiple tasks and brings projects to completion in a timely manner.· Effectively supervises staff of five, contributing actively in a positive manner to goals and activities of Marketing department.· Presents a neat well-groomed appearance.· Represents Mohonk Mountain House in a professional manner.· Demonstrate expertise with Windows-based operating systems and software including MS Word, MS Excel, and MS PowerPoint.· Work in office setting subject to continuous interruptions and background noises. Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionWho we are: Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 375 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.
Job Description Summary: Due to the continued growth of the Marketing Operations and Transformation team, we have an exciting opportunity for a talented Marketing Operations Coordinator to join our team. We are looking for additional support to ensure delivery of our day-to-day operational processes and working rhythms in an effective, efficient manner.
Job Description:
Why is this a fantastic opportunity?
You will be part of the Marketing Operations and Transformation (MO&T) team who have been tasked with a large transformation agenda, leveraging on an incredibly successful year for PayPal and our mission to democratize financial services, empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy.
The Payments and Fin Tech Industry is one of the highest growth, most competitive industries right now and PayPal has a very strong position (but also an incredibly impressive set of aggressive competitors). This is an opportunity for someone who loves a challenge, wants to be stretched and embraces opportunities to learn.
Key Responsibilities
Day-to-day management & orchestration required to support the global MO&T workforce of 250+ employees across a mix of both PayPal and agency partner resources. Act as the key point of contact for onboarding new agency resources and setting them up for success
Resource management: Work closely with colleagues across MO&T to effectively administer all of the resources dedicated to our Marketing Operations teams. You will ensure a central repository of resources and budgets are maintained and reported upon, highlighting any gaps or issues based upon your understanding of capacity requirements across the team
Budget Support: Become the source of knowledge to all things related to the MO&T budget. Track and update budget vs actuals throughout the quarter to ensure accuracy of forecasts across the team and apply your knowledge to help optimize the process for how money flows through Marketing at PayPal
Relationship Management: Building and maintaining excellent cross-functional working relationships with colleagues across Marketing, Contingent Workforce Services, Finance, Legal, Compliance & Procurement
Knowledge Management: Help to develop the strategy and support the implementation of an effective knowledge management solution across MO&T. Ensure all relevant information relating to our processes & working practices is consistently refreshed and available to all colleagues on our Marketing Ops SharePoint site
Legal & Procurement support: Working closely with our key agency partners across the globe to ensure all contracts are processed & approved in a timely and compliant manner
Content Creation & coordination for key ceremonies & meetings in the MO&T monthly calendar, including team all-hands, show & tells & office hour sessions
Requisite Experience
2-3 years Marketing Operations experience working with globally distributed teams
Excellent communication skills, both written & spoken and comfortable managing a broad stakeholder group
Experience administering budgets, comfortable working with numbers and ability to drive clarity from complexity
Relationship builder - Ability to proactively cultivate strong business relationships and communicate effectively with team members
Self-motivated and dedicated - Able to work and problem-solve independently
Strong enthusiasm for implementing systems and processes
Adaptable - You are comfortable and thrive in an ever-changing environment
Types of Role you might have done previously
Marketing / Sales Operations manager
Marketing executive / assistant
Marketing finance business partner
We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.
PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.
