Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionPOSITION SUMMARY:
Summer Friday, a creative content and marketing agency, is looking for a Marketing Associate who will serve as an assistant to our Client Strategy team, reporting to the Director of Client Strategy. Working across multiple clients, the Marketing Associate will manage day-to-day tasks with emphasis on project management, quality assurance and research.
ABOUT YOU:
You recognize how research and strategy influence creative. You understand the importance of deadlines and organization, while anticipating client and team needs. You have a positive, can-do attitude and proactively offer solutions in a fast moving environment. And let’s not forget your best trait of all… your entrepreneurial spirit and appetite for learning.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide quality assurance on all agency output including creative, campaign plans, reports, and analysis.
Manage workflow processes to ensure we remain nimble & efficient while delivering flawless execution.
Assist in reviewing and facilitating the completion of projects internally by collaborating closely with the creative and production teams.
Update client status documents and stay on top of upcoming tasks.
Create and edit Excel spreadsheets and PowerPoint presentations.
Organize account files and documents electronically.
Assist in billing worksheet reviews.
Provide support to Client Strategy and other teams as needed.
Maintain general knowledge of industry/client business beyond the assignment at hand.
Research industry trends or client-specific requests and provide thought leadership content to internal teams and clients as appropriate.
Be a Trusted Advisor to our clients, providing exceptional service, expert advice and input as well as information and necessary explanations in a timely and high-quality manner.
Be a great team member.
Embody Summer Friday core values of teamwork, equality, open & honest collaboration, unwavering trust, commitment to quality & innovation, and a passion for social responsibility.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree
1-2 years of experience in agency environment preferred
Experience in Digital, Social, Content, and Strategy preferred
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Good listener with willingness to take notes
Proficient in MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Top-notch organizational skills, with the ability to multitask in order to meet deadlines
Strong initiative and personal drive
Calm demeanor, positive outlook, ability to collaborate with and inspire team members and clients
An entrepreneurial attitude to take on tasks that support our clients’ success and the vision of Summer Friday. No job is too big or too small for you.
COMPANY:
At Summer Friday, we live at the intersection of Big Ideas and Nimble Execution. We develop enduring creative experiences that are rooted in strategy. It’s that ability to pair big-picture, award-winning thinking with a roll-up-our-sleeves mentality that allows Summer Friday to thrive as a content studio, digital conversion driver, omnichannel optimizer, and execution powerhouse for major fortune 500 brands.
OUR CULTURE:
Two words define the Summer Friday state of mind: Fun and Fearless. We trust our people and processes, and that trust empowers us to be bold—to seek out projects that challenge us to grow and to constantly examine how our work impacts society. We balance that fearless spirit with a playfulness that shapes everything we do, from the way we share ideas to the way we collaborate and create. For us, it’s not about “work hard, play hard”, it’s about loving what you do and bringing that authentic passion to the team every day.
OUR STANCE:
Managing a creative marketing firm has always required an unwavering commitment to talent acquisition and advancement. We stand by the word of Martin Luther King Jr. when it comes to judging people by the content of their character and not the color of their skin. We take this further in recognizing all walks of life beyond skin, religion, and sex. Through this collective understanding and appreciation, we have learned that diversity is exactly what allows us to be successful, fun, smart, efficient, creative, innovative, and every day inspired. By continuing to place this emphasis, we believe that we are fighting racism and inequality from within. Charging ahead, we are committed to adapting policies as we learn and progress as a company and a country.

Job detailsSalary$140,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionTo get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category

Job Details
Program Director, Advisory Board Marketing & Events
Salesforce plays bigger & higher within C-Suites thanks to the Salesforce Global Advisory Board trusted expertise and network. The Program Director coordinates all aspects of event, marketing and PR strategy & execution for the advisory board to build its profile and support Salesforce leadership and business.


Responsibilities

Plan and lead execution of global CEO-level advisory board events including quarterly board meetings, executive dinners and co-ordinate programs at Dreamforce, World Tours and regional/local Salesforce events
Co-ordinate advisor and customer CEO connectivity around global executive forums like WEF/Davos, Business Roundtable, B Team, Business Council
Develop PR strategy for the advisory board in collaboration with local PR leadership through press releases, social & media appearances, interviews, panels and other speaking engagements – work with Salesforce PR and communications team to execute and lead preparation, support and follow up with advisors
Work with Office of the CEO to maintain and enrich CEO profiles and determine targeted connections with advisors, research and map connectivity to Salesforce target customer set
Support advisory board thought leadership program contributing to strategy, content plan, deliverable preparation and drive activation across channels and formats liaising with marketing, PR and content teams
Help manage advisory board communications and curate collaboration channels to build community among global board and network of CEOs around advisory board and with Salesforce leadership and customer teams
Manage analytics and reporting on performance against targets for all workstreams and drive leadership updates and internal communications strategy

Desired Skills And Experience

Minimum 6+ years of demonstrated ability in an executive marketing role (software industry experience preferred), with at least 3 years of event development/programming focus
Proven track record driving marketing, PR and events for CEO-level audiences and supporting internal C-level leadership
Global business perspective with the ability to execute events on the ground across North America and Europe
Ability to work on multiple projects at once, set priorities, work independently, problem-solve, and improvise in a real-time environment
Ability to collaborate and develop positive business relationships with all cross-functional peers, partners, and senior leaders
A strategic approach to managing programs for scale and developing process
Experience developing performance measurement strategies on marketing and event effectiveness
Ability to deliver against key performance indicators and goals and seek consistent improvement and innovation
Comfortable learning and using new software tools
Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $140,000. You may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timePart-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout The Brand: MTV is the leading global youth media brand in 180 countries, reaching 450 million households in nearly 30 different languages across every platform. MTV is the world's premier youth entertainment brand, the cultural home of the millennial generation and a pioneer in creating innovative programming for young people. MTV reflects pop culture with award-winning content built around compelling storytelling, music discovery and activism across TV, the internet and other platforms. A unit of ViacomCBS Inc. (NASDAQ: VIAB, VIA), MTV operations span cable and mobile networks, live events, theatrical films and MTV Studios. Overview and Responsibilities:

MTV Entertainment Group (MTV, Comedy Central, Paramount Network, Pop TV, VH1, Smithsonian, TV Land, CMT, Logo) is seeking a coordinator to support the Executive Vice President, Communications. The role is responsible for maintaining department head’s schedule/phones, preparing travel arrangements, filing expense reports and additional administrative tasks for head of the department in a fun, fast-paced office environment. The position will help manage and provide/share content for the team’s social media accounts and press websites. He/she will also work closely with the team’s show publicists to assist in the development and implementation of communications campaigns for programming, tentpoles and internal communications.


Responsibilities

Support the EVP, Communications – manage schedules, maintain contacts, book all travel and modify/format documents including letters, presentations (PowerPoint) and spreadsheets (Excel)
Monitor and compile press clippings and reports for campaigns across the MTV Entertainment Group portfolio
Assist in preparing all necessary presentations, meeting agendas, research and itineraries
Update and maintain media lists and press contact information
Ensure vendor invoices and department finances are paid in a timely matter and work with finance team to maintain overall budgets
Help comprise and distribute press releases, programming notes and media alerts
Manage subscriptions, order department office supplies and additional administrative responsibilities
Maintain the press websites for all brands including content, layout and copy
Assist with dept. social media accounts
Help as needed at events such as press junkets and press screenings
Able to multi-task and pivot at a moment’s notice
Must be very organized with great attention to detail
Basic Qualifications:
1+ years related experience in Public Relations or Marketing required
Bachelor’s Degree
Proficiency with Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Must have good oral and written communication skills

Job detailsSalary$45,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionSocial Media Assistant, Random House
We are seeking a creative and analytical Social Media Assistant to join the Random House Publishing Group social media team! The Social Media Assistant will create highly shareable and engaging social media content for several imprints, including Random House Books, Ballantine Bantam Dell, and Crown Publishing. The ideal candidate will perform well under tight deadlines, seek innovative design content solutions, manage multiple projects in a well-organized and detail-oriented fashion, and have a keen interest in social media and design trends found on social media. This is an exciting opportunity to play a key role in steering highly esteemed literary, commercial and nonfiction brands into exciting new directions in an open exchange of ideas with marketing, publicity and editorial teams.
The Role:
Use Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest and LinkedIn to represent the RH and Crown brands, individual books, and authors.
Curate and create compelling content related to our authors and books.
Manage editorial social media calendar for the department.
Collaborate with other teams such as marketing and publicity to work on content strategy, including creation of title-specific social media campaigns.
Manage social media accounts’ design (e.g. Facebook timeline cover, profile pictures)
Quantify success on follower growth and content engagement across various platforms.
Use social platform metrics and social listening systems to create reports and perform analysis for ad-hoc projects.
Perform research on current benchmark trends and audience preferences.
Stay up-to-date with current technologies and trends in social media
The Essentials:
One-two years’ experience supporting a brand’s social media feeds.
Highly proficient in content creation for Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram platforms
Design and photography experience and artistic skills a plus
Understanding of key social measurement metrics.
Proficiency in layout and design
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong organizational and collaboration skills
Excellent attention to detail
Knowledge of MS Office, In Design Suite
Proven ability to create and revise designs in a demanding fast-paced environment
Salary for this position is $45,000. Please apply using our online application process, and please include your résumé and cover letter with salary requirements. Full-time employees are eligible for our comprehensive benefits program.
Penguin Random House is the leading adult and children’s publishing house in North America, the United Kingdom and many other regions around the world. In publishing the best books in every genre and subject for all ages, we are committed to quality, excellence in execution, and innovation throughout the entire publishing process: editorial, design, marketing, publicity, sales, production, and distribution. Our vibrant and diverse international community of nearly 250 publishing brands and imprints include Ballantine Bantam Dell, Berkley, Clarkson Potter, Crown, DK, Doubleday, Dutton, Grosset & Dunlap, Little Golden Books, Knopf, Modern Library, Pantheon, Penguin Books, Penguin Press, Penguin Random House Audio, Penguin Young Readers, Portfolio, Puffin, Putnam, Random House, Random House Children’s Books, Riverhead, Ten Speed Press, Viking, and Vintage, among others. Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAssociate Brand Marketing Manager - King Features
We are looking for an engaged, creative and conscientious marketing professional to join our small, yet dynamic team at King Features. This is full-time role within the brand marketing team starting April 2021. The team is working remotely for the time being, but when it is deemed safe for us to return, we will go back to enjoying our views of Manhattan from the 41st floor of the Hearst Tower near Central Park.
King Features has a portfolio of 60+ classic characters, made accessible to fans through various forms of entertainment from comic strips to TV series to video games. This role will assist the Brand Marketing Director in all activities that protect and perpetuate King Features’ extensive library of brands, particular those with consumer product programs attached such as Popeye , Olive Oyl, Cuphead , Flash Gordon , The Phantom , Moomin, Pucca and more. The Associate Brand Marketing Manager will become a resident go-to expert on our KFS properties’, embodying the brand perspective and voice of each unique IP while serving as a reviewer and approver of new creative assets and branded content across platforms globally and play a key part in the development of branding guidelines, sales tools, marketing materials, promotions and tradeshow exhibits.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Compile all departmental brand activities (design, licensing, digital marketing, social media, syndication and entertainment) into concise brand and sales decks that are updated monthly; create bespoke pitch decks as needed
Aid Director in the planning and execution of integrated marketing and PR plans
Assist Director with management of the overarching franchise calendar to ensure alignment across lines of business and international markets
Work closely with Marketing Director and outside agencies to develop the necessary creative and marketing tools needed to support KFS brands and business
Generate work for hire agreements for all new creative and marketing partners in coordination with Legal
Support Marketing Director in the preparation and execution of KFS tradeshow exhibits
Develop and maintain Digital Press Kits for our brands to support PR requests and make key art, brand messaging and guidelines accessible to internal teams
Create and coordinate delivery of quarterly newsletter with brand highlights to licensees, international agents and partners
Problem solve internal and external business issues (with supervisor support, as needed) and follow through to resolution
Track departmental costs against budget; Gather, code and submit all invoices to AP ensuring on-time vendor payments; Setup new vendors
Manage outside parties’ permissions requests to use our brands in their content, promotions and advertising; execute agreements with Legal and facilitate payment
Conduct consumer and competitive research projects as needed, providing strategic recommendations that support brand development
Collaborate with international agents to address global needs and market feedback; support global information needs.
Communicate details around upcoming product launches and marketing campaigns to social media team regularly to ensure promotional support for global partners via our brand platforms/channels
Monitor branding on company and property websites and social networks; coordinate updates with social media team
Provide general administrative support for the marketing/licensing team, including but not limited to, maintenance of logs, business contact lists, travel arrangements, meeting scheduling, and other general office duties
QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS:
Looking for an enthusiastic go-getter who seeks to join a small but very active team;

must be willing to wear many hats in order to learn and grow within the role over time
College degree required with 2-3 years of relevant work experience
Exceptional project management and organizational skills
Appreciation for the importance of process, efficient workflow and effective communication
Detail-oriented team player with highly productive work ethic and a proactive attitude
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Creative thinker who is quick on their feet and enjoys being up to date on world cultures as well as market and industry trends
Familiarity with brand marketing, licensing, public relations and creative services
 Previous experience with character brand building and licensing is ideal
High proficiency in programs that facilitate organization including Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Outlook, Google Docs, Dropbox, and Teams; Mac experience preferred
Intermediate experience with creative development programs such as Adobe Creative Suite, Adobe Premier, WordPress, etc. is a plus
Studio, production company, creative or entertainment marketing experience is helpful

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeTemporaryFull Job DescriptionAt Warner Music Group we’re all about our people. Our global company is made up of knowledgeable, passionate, and creative individuals. Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion fosters a culture where you can truly belong, contribute, and grow. We believe in each individual’s value and encourage applications from people of any age, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, and any other characteristic or identity.
It is the mission of every member of the WMG team around the world to create a nurturing environment for artists, songwriters, and the people behind the music – at every stage of their career. We strive to set WMG apart by embracing innovation – an integral part of our company's DNA.
Consider a career at WMG and be a part of one of the most influential forces in culture today.
A little bit about our team:
We have an exciting mission at Songkick, in this role you'll help execute the company's live stream events strategy. Reporting to the Community & Partnerships Director, day-to-day, you’ll coordinate marketing campaigns which help achieve our vision. This is a new project for the business and this role plays a key part in ensuring its success. This isn't just incremental; you'll deliver virtual events campaigns and industry-changing opportunities, working closely with our diverse, hardworking, music-loving team.
Why this could be your next big break:
This role is key to ensuring the smooth running of marketing campaigns at Songkick. You’ll work closely with our product team to prioritize marketing needs for artist and label partners, and collaborate as part of cross-functional teams to deliver marketing campaigns. We are a data driven team, and you'll bring the same mentality to our live events: ensuring we have impactful reporting for Songkick's and our partners' success. Are you passionate about helping shape the digital future of live music? Do you care about more fans seeing incredible live shows? Would you enjoy building a more exciting environment for artists? Come and talk to us, we've already started.
Here you’ll get to:
The Live Events Marketing Coordinator will handle and execute the daily logistics of marketing campaigns working with the Songkick team
The Coordinator will collaborate with artist managers, labels and production companies ensuring quality and consistency across delivery of campaigns
This role will have responsibility for creating, documenting and maintaining marketing processes and handling assets across a variety of channels
Build sales reports and marketing updates; utilize sales and performance information to deliver comprehensive marketing analysis
The Live Events Marketing Coordinator role will work with a variety of partners across Songkick & Warner Music including Sales, Marketing, Tech, Product, Finance and Artist Services as well as external partner companies.
Work with the Community and Partnerships Director to ensure that Songkick achieves its marketing objectives and delivers against business plans / targets for live stream events
Drive successful experiences for Songkick and our partners with an emphasis on marketing perfection
About you:
We are looking for someone with exceptional marketing skills
1 year plus experience in coordinating marketing campaigns working in music companies or brands
Exceptional inﬂuencing skills, you can communicate cross-functionally to inﬂuence outcomes
Willing to get into the details on the day-to-day aspects of coordinating campaigns and driving user growth
It would be music to our ears if you also had:
College Degree preferred
Experience working in email HTML or with Sendgrid
Experience using Excel / Google Sheets
Basic knowledge of SQL / BigQuery
Excellent copywriting skills
Solid understanding of the live music industry, particularly marketing events
Proven experience working on digital, social and inﬂuencer campaigns
Time at a startup or fast-growing business, where change is constant and company culture is a genuine priority
About us:
With a legacy extending back over 200 years, Warner Music Group (WMG) today brings together artists, songwriters and entrepreneurs that are moving entertainment culture across the globe. Operating in more than 70 countries through a network of affiliates and licensees, WMG’s Recorded Music division includes renowned labels such as Asylum, Atlantic, Big Beat, Canvasback, Elektra, Erato, First Night, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Reprise, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Spinnin’, Warner Records, Warner Classics and Warner Music Nashville. WMG’s music publishing arm, Warner Chappell Music, has a catalog of more than 1.4 million musical compositions spanning every musical genre, from the standards of the Great American Songbook to the biggest hits of the 21st century.
Warner Music Group is also home to WEA (Warner-Elektra-Atlantic), the pioneering distribution and marketing network, and ADA (Alternative Distribution Alliance), the independent artist and label services company, as well as consumer brands such as Songkick the live music app, EMP the merchandise e-tailer, and UPROXX the youth culture destination.
Love this job and want to apply?
Click the “Apply” link at the top of the page, or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile, but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.
Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. We’re taking our time to review all resumes, and to find the best people for WMG.
Thanks for your interest in working for WMG. We love it here, and think you will, too.
WMG is committed to inclusion and diversity in all aspects of our business. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and will evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law (genetic characteristics or cancer), physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout eOne
Entertainment One Ltd. (eOne) specialises in the development, acquisition, production, financing, distribution and sales of entertainment content. As part of global play and entertainment company Hasbro (NASDAQ: HAS), eOne's expertise spans across film, television and music production and sales; family programming, merchandising and licensing; digital content; and live entertainment. Through its extensive reach and scale, and a deep dedication to high-quality entertainment, eOne unlocks the power and value of creativity.
eOne’s Family Brands division is an exciting, fast growing team within the global Hasbro family that has expertise in the development, production, distribution and brand management of kid’s entertainment. Key properties in the brand portfolio include international pre-school TV phenomenon Peppa Pig; superhero hit PJ Masks; newly launched pre-school series Ricky Zoom; fashion brands My Little Pony and Jem; as well as action adventure brands Transformers: Rescue Bots and Power Rangers.
Position Summary:
Two exciting opportunities have arisen in our Entertainment Brand Marketing team to join as Marketing Coordinators! One will support the preschool team where you'd get to work on Peppa Pig and My Little Pony; the other within the action adventure team working on Transformers and Power Rangers.
Both roles require you to proactively support the development, planning and successful activation of integrated local brand marketing campaigns for allocated entertainment brands. This instrumental role will focus on activities including day-to-day coordination of marketing activities, approvals, and providing general support, ensuring they are completed and delivered as required and to a high standard.
Key Responsibilities
Provide logistical, administrative, and creative support to the relevant entertainment brand marketing team, assisting in the implementation and execution of local marketing plans, including PR, digital, social and other related marketing initiatives
Be the point of contact for day-to-day marketing inquiries and approvals
Coordinate the planning, briefing and delivery of marketing materials
Maintaining and updating franchise brand marketing calendars, sharing these with relevant teams in a timely manner
Ownership of aspects of marketing campaigns and projects as directed
Support in the approval of relevant third-party marketing materials as directed and ensure that all materials adhere to the brand templates and standards as set out by the Global Franchise Brand Management Teams.
Provide support on the management of marketing competitions and disseminate prizing as required.
Co-ordinate team meetings to discuss activations, market developments and campaign results as required
Assist in the preparation of presentation decks.
Assist with the budget process by raising PO’s, invoice processing, and tracking, as directed by the team.
Participate in creative brainstorming sessions.
Undertake general administrative tasks as required.
Key Competencies
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
Previous experience within a lively marketing team essential, preferably within the Entertainment industry
Experience with social media and family-focused consumer media
A strong understanding of marketing opportunities for family brands
First class organizational - able to balance several priorities and meet tight deadlines
Ability to stay ‘cool’ when the pressure is on
Strong communication skills
Resourceful and pro-active - someone who can work independently
A great teammate
Good presentation building skills
Administrative skills and knowledge of computer packages, Word, Excel, PowerPoint & Outlook essential. Adobe Photoshop experience ideal but not essential
Passion (for our brands)
We thank everyone for their interest but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job detailsSalary$183,000 - $257,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionYour Job
The Sales Strategy Director works closely with stakeholders across functions and regions to lead and execute strategic initiatives that boost revenue, drive operational scale and improve efficiency for continuous exponential growth. He/She will be a strategic partner to the VP of Sales and Sr Director of Client Success. Indeed employees are united by one common mission: they help people get jobs. The company’s success is due to the fact that their employees are laser-focused, collaborative, passionate, data-driven and committed to results.
Who You Are
Responsibilities
Identify, scope and drive critical projects and sales initiatives partnering with cross-functional teams across the organization
Lead/facilitate cross functional teams to get work done, driving recommendations through to implementation
Drive operational excellence through identification and execution of opportunity areas that create efficiency, remove obstacles, or create improved processes and approaches to the business
Lead sophisticated research and analysis (e.g. revenue, customer, market and competitive trends and insights) for senior leadership to support decision-making
Requirements
You are a strategic and operational leader - having demonstrated those skills leading cross functional teams and dealing with senior leaders / executives.
You have the unique mix of strategy/analytical horsepower, problem solving and customer facing skills. You can take data and drive to action - this means being very strong leading teams analyzing data (e.g., spreadsheets, SQL).
You have a client service mentality, willingness to collaborate openly with other functions
7+ years experience in management consulting, sales strategy, strategic planning, sales operations and/or business operations, preferably in the internet space
3+ years experience leading a team
Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing or other relevant / quantitative disciplines from a leading university, MBA a plus
Experience managing, coaching and retaining top talent
Strong leadership and influencing skills
Results and detail oriented, with strong commercial/business acumen
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Indeed provides a variety of benefits that help us focus on our mission of helping people get jobs.
View our bounty of perks: http://indeedhi.re/IndeedBenefits
Who we are
Our Sales force helps transform the hiring process by providing companies an easy and effective way to find the right fit for every hire. We support our Sales team with career development and training from day one.
Our Mission
As the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.
(*comScore Total Visits, March 2020)
Salary Range Disclaimer
The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, long term incentives, an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.
Salary Range Transparency
NYC Metro Area 183,000 - 257,000 USD per year
Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement
Indeed is deeply committed to creating a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neurodiversity, disability, age, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.

job_descriptions.ab32d36acf183091: Job detailsSalary$120,000 - $140,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeNumber of hires for this role1QualificationsBachelor's (Preferred)Full Job DescriptionSUMMARY: The Architectural Sales Manager is responsible for growing the market for theThrislington Cubicles brand, primarily in Metropolitan New York, as well as New England and Eastern Canada. More specifically, the position promotes the growth of Thrislington specifications by consulting and leading sales calls with architects and interior designers, as well as fulfilling those projects through our limited distribution partners. The individual must be able to understand the requirements of the building owner decision-maker and create a solution to meet these needs within Thrislington’s range of products.TYPICAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSBILITES - Primary responsibilities encompass the effective development and enhancement of the Thrislington brand within Metropolitan NewYork, New England and Eastern Canadian architectural communities Collaboration with the Thrislington Team to establish annual goals and targets for the key territories, and report back on the attainment relative to these goals, on a quarterly basis. Proactively develop, track and aggressively grow specifications across market segments, continually building a pipeline of new projects. Build and enhance effective relationships with current and new architectural practices, leading to increased specifications, sales and brand awareness. Lead sales calls, being able to propose effective agendas, ask probing questions, recommend appropriate benefits/solutions and close with mutual agreement as to next steps. Provide professional design resources specific to customer needs with budget consideration, technical solutions and specification resources. Become a value-added resource to the architectural community. Consistently reinforce the value proposition of our offering and its advantages in the market. Ability to understand ADA and building codes and apply product knowledge of the company’s products so that these can be met. Clear understanding of interpreting architectural drawings and design intent by conducting technical presentations with a high degree of knowledge and professional delivery, to address issues, needs, trends, technical attributes, and provide solutions. Coordinate regular field sales activities including prospecting and lead generation.Identify, qualify and close opportunities with existing distribution base. Represent Thrislington at selected Trade Shows and be confident in highlighting the key features of the Company’s products. Participate in monthly Teams meetings with the Thrislington Team and authorized localDistributors to review project bid status and to ensure specifications are being held.Identify projects at risk, particularly those in danger of being switched to a competitor. Participate in bi-weekly Teams meetings in collaboration with the Thrislington Team to review a detailed follow-up of new leads, opportunities and project progression Expectation to visit active installations on a regular basis to conduct site audits, further develop product knowledge and technical training on the Thrislington range. Lead the use of the Company CRM system to track practices, leads and opportunities, to provide full visibility of the potential projects in these territories. Execute a high level of expertise with administration and organizational skills, minimizing administrative time / maximizing sales activities, while efficiently completing all required administration. Utilize Outlook, CRM, LinkedIn, mobile device, and other technology to a high degree to grow efficiencies. Coordinates withThrislington General Manager – International, when administration is becoming excessive and impacting selling time. To put forward ideas in which the Thrislington brand can be best marketed within the territory and to follow this through, in conjunction with the Thrislington Team, to create effective sales literature to promote the brand Seek and undertake developmental training, in line with company expectations.QUALIFICATIONS REQUIREMENTS:  Bachelor's degree (BA) from four-year college or university; and a five to ten years history of demonstrated architectural selling or equivalent combination of education and sales experience. A strong candidate will have a proven track record in the architecture and design industry and will have excellent communication skills. The candidate will have a strong initiative and high sense of urgency, responsiveness, and discipline throughout the sales process. A thorough knowledge of AutoCAD and the ability to prepare drawings of architectural details is also strongly desired, but not required. Travel requirements are 50%, with occasional weekend days and on occasions, 12 hour days Strong analytical skills to review technical and historical data Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications requiredJob Type: Full-timePay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceDisability insuranceHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Work Location:One locationCompany's website:www.bobrick.comWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredTemperature screeningsSocial distancing guidelines in placeSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

job_descriptions.e8fcab2b92e83011:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionOverview:

Does a job that requires hard work but has unlimited earning potential excite you?

Do you have a reputation for setting your mind to something and doing whatever it takes to get there?

Do you like working in an environment where people genuinely like each other and look forward to celebrating company achievements?

Would it make you feel good to help people who are experiencing tough financial times because of high-interest credit card debt?

If the answers to these questions were “YES!” then you may have just found the company and culture you’ve been hoping for.

Strategic is looking for Financial Consultants to join our family of highly motivated, fun-loving, challenge-seeking individuals who care for one another and for our clients. As a Financial Consultant, you will listen and engage with our clients with an empathetic ear and consult them in their quest for financial freedom. So, if you're an optimistic opportunist looking to jumpstart or develop your career as a financial consultant in a fun, rapidly growing environment where you have an opportunity to make a ton of money, we want to hear from you.
Responsibilities:
Receive and work warm leads from interested clients with expected higher lead access on the weekend (no cold calling)
Conduct proactive outreach calls to interested clients
Manage CRM pipeline and schedule to maximize consulting opportunities
Meet daily metrics and monthly targets
Empathize with clients to make sure you understand their financial situation and help identify the option that is appropriately suited for them
Maintain a healthy sales pipeline by gathering customer contact information and scheduling appointments for individuals who exhibit purchase intent or potential
Flexible weekday hours (Monday through Thursday with Friday’s off!!) and one weekend shift (Saturday or Sunday – you choose!)
Qualifications:
A hunger for success, positive attitude and desire to learn and grow
Strong listening skills with a focused empathetic and consultative ear
Ability to work in a fast-paced growing environment
Experience using excel and Salesforce as a CRM is a plus
Sales or customer service experience is a plus
Willing to work evenings
Bachelor or Associate Degree

The Fun Stuff:
Ultra-Competitive pay structure starting with a $55,000.00 plus commissions
Become a Strategic Owner as part of Strategic’ s Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP)
Flexibility to work in the office and remotely
Heavy emphasis on training and development through introductory and ongoing sales training as well as industry/professional training programs
Daily, weekly and monthly team and individual contests and spiffs
Commuter Benefits
Gym benefits
Happy Hours
Daily employee acknowledgement programs such as Cupcake Tuesdays and Wellness Wednesdays
Participation in Strategic Dreams program which makes several employee’s dreams come true each quarter

A Little About Strategic:
Strategic Financial Solutions is a leading consumer finance company that specializes in helping people that have too much credit card debt. We were recently named the 21st Best Company to Work for in New York by Best Companies to Work For and have been certified as a Great Place to Work 4 times. Additional honors include being named, two times, as one of the 50 fastest growing companies in New York City and to the prestigious Inc. 500 list as one of the 500 fastest growing companies in the United States.

Strategic is committed to hiring, training, cultivating, promoting, and celebrating an environment where we have a welcoming and fulfilling place for all people to call home. Diversity of race, thought, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, religion, and disability will empower us to thrive as individuals, as teams, and as a company.

job_descriptions.a49f61e0b15cbbae:
Job detailsSalary$55,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionCompany Description
Are you interested in building a client list filled with winners of the Super Bowl, World Series or Grammys? Would you prefer movie stars, production companies, designers or royalty? What about connecting with soccer players, world champion boxers or motor sports professionals? Or would you like to experience being a passenger in the latest Gulfstream G650? If the answer is yes, then Air Charter Service should be your next career move! We are searching for a passionate Private Jet Broker to tell the story of ACS!
OUR STORY
Air Charter Service was established in 1990 in the basement of our Chairman’s home and today employs over 500 people globally, across 27 offices on six continents. We are not just the largest charter brokerage in the world, but also the largest charter family, holding those same values that started this business at the core of everything we do.
We are a charter provider that goes the extra mile to ensure each and every one of our clients’ experiences service beyond expectation. Whether you are talking to one of our brokers in New York, Mumbai or Beijing, you will find the exemplary service never ends.
Whether our clients are traveling for business or leisure, a private jet is most time-efficient way to get from A to B. Private Jet flights offer an array of advantages, such as quicker check-ins and faster transit times, to allow our clients to get the most out of their trip. Our clients can relax, knowing that there’s no need to stress, and when in the air, they will be surround by luxurious comfort.

Job Description
LIFE AS AN ACS BROKER
Building your list of potential clients by researching internal and external databases, websites and social media
Pro-actively targeting your list through outbound sales calls, emails and visits (both face-to-face and virtual) and converting them from potential clients in to ACS clients
Building relationships with Private Jet Operators to ensure we are able to provide the most suitable aircraft choices for the clients’ requirements
Develop and maintain relationships with clients to ensure repeat business
Ensure you are consistently exceeding both your sales activity and financial targets
Confirming company procedures are being followed in a methodical and chronological way to ensure protection of both ACS and the client
Demonstrate an expert understanding of the aircraft and chartering process
Managing charter bookings from inquiry to completion
Flight watching/overseeing flight departures
Building a wide and effective network of contacts inside and outside the organisation
Make prompt, clear decisions which may involve tough choices or considered risks

Qualifications
THE PERSON
Desire to immerse self into role and commit to the demands of the role
Ability to work independently, but enjoys working with people inside and outside of ACS
Enjoys working to goals and objectives in a competitive environment
Able to take a commercial outlook on all flights ensure a win win for ACS and the client
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Strong numeracy skills
Additional Information
WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU
Starting salary $55K USD with 10% uncapped commission
Medical, Dental, Vision & 401K retirement benefits package
20 days in paid-time off, public holidays + additional paid leave for your birthday, wedding and more.
Structured career development – ACS offers 9 levels of career progression opportunities!
Award-winning in house training and mentoring – approximately 4 weeks based in our London HQ.
A friendly, fun and exciting environment – summer party, holiday party and department nights out!
Air Charter Service Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

job_descriptions.d3cd3e8def4c6106:
Job detailsSalary$45,000 - $60,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionPower Home Remodeling is a company founded on equal parts hard work and positivity. We believe that “dream” and “achieve” are not mutually exclusive. That philosophy has served us well in becoming FORTUNE Magazine’s #1 Workplace for Millennials and one of Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work.
90% of our executives begin their careers in entry-level positions because we recruit, train, and retain talented individuals with a drive to succeed. Power is more than a home remodeling company. Power is a dream realization, technology-innovation, community-advocacy, expectation-shattering, happiness-maximizing company dedicated to improvement, both for our customers, and ourselves.
Entry Level Sales Representative
When you work at a company where the CEO started at entry level less than a decade ago and worked his way to the top, you know we mean it when we say we’re preparing you to succeed in more than just your current position. As a full-time entry-level sales representative you’ll be trained in all of our products and be able to deliver interactive presentations that will teach communication skills, negotiation tactics, and strategic planning. This position is also the perfect entrance into all other aspects of our business.
Primary job responsibilities include:
Development and coordination of marketing strategies
Promotion of Power’s products and services to prospective and existing clients
Delivery of interactive sales presentations on eco-friendly, green products and services
Participation in ongoing training camps on a weekly basis

Qualifications:
Highly developed interpersonal, organizational and communication skills
Ability to speak publicly with confidence and poise
Keen sense of self-motivation, dignity and resolve
Open-minded with a passion for learning a wide-range of skills that will carry through a variety of career paths
Naturally relational and articulate individual who thrives in human interaction
Desire to mentor other colleagues after refining your skill set
BA/BS preferred
Ability to work Mon – Fri: 11 am to 7 pm & two Saturdays per month: 9 am to 3 pm

Salary and Benefits:
Average first year income range: $45,000 - $60,000 (Base Salary plus commission and bonuses)
Monthly opportunities for performance-based non-monetary rewards, such as luxury vacations, high-end electronics, gift cards and tickets to concerts and events
Full medical, dental, life and disability insurance plans that can be tailored to your specific needs and the needs of your family
Paid Parental Leave
Free health screenings
Rewards for participation in wellness programs
Ample paid vacation and holidays
A competitive 401(k) retirement savings program, matched by Power
Access to the latest technology, such as laptops, smart phones and tablets that will help you reach your earnings goals faster and more efficiently
A robust social program filled with events, and activities, including a company trip to a tropical destination for you and a significant other

Power is a people-first company that values the uniqueness of every individual within our walls. We are committed to growing the organization by hiring, training, and promoting all people equally, regardless of race, religion, skin color, national origin, sex, disability, age, sexual identity, veteran status and other protected classes. Through equal access to education and mentorship, we aim to bridge the gap between their current potential and their future excellence, creating an environment of shared knowledge and experiences where everyone is afforded the opportunity to succeed and grow based on the merit of their hard work and results. We foster a safe community in which the mixing of mixing of cultures, beliefs, and backgrounds is encouraged and supported because we believe that what makes each of us different makes the whole stronger. Through championing the success of diverse individuals, both within our walls and outside of them, we aim to show the world that diversity is an asset and inclusion is not a liability. That it makes our businesses, our communities, and our nations exponentially stronger.
job_descriptions.f51495d4539bbb10:
Job detailsSalary$84,000 - $116,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionYour Job
The Sales Strategy Senior Strategist - US Enterprise works closely with stakeholders across functions to help lead and execute strategic initiatives that boost revenue, drive operational scale and improve efficiency for continuous exponential growth. Indeed employees are united by one common mission: we help people get jobs. Indeed’s success is due to the fact that our employees are laser-focused, collaborative, passionate, data-driven and committed to results.
Responsibilities:
Help identify, scope and drive critical projects and sales/customer success initiatives partnering with cross-functional teams across the organization
Lead sophisticated research and analysis (e.g. revenue, customer, market and competitive trends and insights) for senior leadership to support decision-making
Complete analysis and assessment of growth opportunities; refine operating metrics to shift objectives and priorities for the Enterprise business
Lead and facilitate cross-functional teams to get work done, driving recommendations through to implementation
Drive operational excellence through identification and execution of opportunity areas that create efficiency, remove obstacles, or create improved processes and approaches to the business
Who You Are
Experience (3+ years) in management consulting, investment banking, private equity, strategy or an operational or growth role within a technology company
Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing or other relevant / quantitative disciplines from a leading university
Distinctive problem solving and analysis skills, ability to solve complex and diverse business problems (commercial, operational, organizational)
Strong leadership and influencing skills
Results and detail oriented, with strong commercial / business acumen
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Superior Excel and Powerpoint skills
Fluency with SQL and Tableau a plus; able to structure queries, pull data and structure it in a meaningful way for analysis, create reports and influence decision making. Knowledge of Python a plus.
Who we are
Our Sales force helps transform the hiring process by providing companies an easy and effective way to find the right fit for every hire. We support our sales team with career development and award-winning training from day one. Every month, over 250 million people count on Indeed to help them find jobs, publish their resumes, process their job applications, and connect them to qualified candidates for their job openings. Simply put, we empower hiring companies who help people get jobs around the globe.
Our Mission
As the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.
(*comScore Total Visits, March 2020)
Salary Range Disclaimer
The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Job detailsSalary$55,965 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionDo you speak Russian and English? If you do, we’re looking for you! Our Retail Careers come with awesome perks and may include additional starting pay if you are bilingual.

Do you like helping people? Do you have a strong desire to connect people with each other thru technology and entertainment? You may have what it takes to join our team.

As a Retail Sales Consultant, you’ll be the face of AT&T, providing personalized interactions with our customers. You’ll deliver excellent customer service while being courteous and knowledgeable of the full suite of AT&T products and services. Being courteous takes on new meaning in today’s environment – it is more than just service with a smile. It is creating a meaningful connection between each customer and our brand. Your ability to provide an effortless experience will be rewarded as you work to meet key objectives and sales goals.

Every day will provide a new set of opportunities, so you’ll need to be flexible and open to change. Depending on your location, you may assist with curbside delivery, online orders or even prospecting efforts to attain new customers. You’ll also assist with maintaining store inventory, basic sanitizing procedures and the merchandising of products. While prior retail or customer-facing sales experience is a plus, we’ll provide training to bring you up to speed!

Sharing your knowledge with our growing customer base comes with many rewards. Start with the paycheck – base plus commission. Our current full-time Retail Sales Consultants earn an average of $44,792 in total compensation in the first year when successfully meeting or exceeding sales goals. Our top sellers earn an average of $55,965 per year.

You’ll also gain an amazing benefits package, including:
Virtual or in-person employee orientation & ongoing paid trainingExciting career pathsSupportive team environmentEmployer-provided mobile deviceMedical/dental coverage401(k) planTuition reimbursementPaid time off
Not to mention some pretty cool perks, like:
One of our latest devices and a service plan. Using our technology, gain first-hand expertise to share with our customers.Discounts on accessories and additional AT&T products and services. That means you always have access to the coolest gadgets around.A spring and fall fund to spend on a wide range of Team Color apparel. You’ll receive a welcome kit of fun gear to get you started (including two shirts), as well as any required personal protective equipment (PPE).
At AT&T, the safety of our employees and customers remains our top priority. We are committed to following all protective and safe-distancing guidelines required by local & state authorities in response to COVID-19.
AT&T will consider for employment qualified applicants in a manner consistent with the requirements of federal, state and local laws
You may be invited to complete an interview by recording a video, so make sure to watch your email for updates. Apply now!

job_descriptions.174966347dc3a594:
Job detailsSalary$52,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionCompany Description
Are you looking for an opportunity that enables you to travel extensively and fly on some of the largest aircraft in the world? How does flying aid into disaster zones sound? What about a job where you are responsible for arranging flights for rescue animals? Would you thrive off the challenge of being in a race against time to prevent a factory shutdown?
Do you envision your next career move to offer you full autonomy over your own portfolio of customers, where you reap the financial rewards of your hard work with uncapped commission whilst receiving awarding-winning training with a clear nine-stage progression structure from day one? If the answer is yes, then Air Charter Service should be your next career move!
OUR STORY
Air Charter Service was established in 1990 in the basement of our Chairman’s home and today employs over 500 people globally, across 27 offices on six continents. We are not just the largest charter brokerage in the world, but also the largest charter family, holding those same values that started this business at the core of everything we do.
We are a charter provider that goes the extra mile to ensure each and every one of our customers experiences service beyond expectation. Whether you are talking to one of our brokers in New York, Mumbai or Beijing, you will find the exemplary service never ends.
Our Cargo team are pivotal in managing Charters ranging from Elephant to Engines, Relief to Rally cars and anything in between. This wide-ranging variety of Cargo Charters means our Brokers have to be both versatile and dynamic.

Job Description
THE DUTIES
Maintain and develop the list of clients held by the Cargo Assistant Manager
Develop aircraft knowledge including familiarization with aircraft used, range, capacity, crewing etc.
Liaison between client and operator
Keeping the Cargo Assistant Manager informed of any changes
Manage charter bookings
Building relationships with Cargo operators to ensure access to the widest range of aircraft available to provide solutions for our customers
Administer the flight prepping and flight riding SOP; proactively collect reports from other offices, accurately update the spread sheet, upload to the intranet monthly
Cover the telephones when the Cargo department are in meetings, or if no-one is available to answer the telephone (e.g. if everyone is already busy on the phone).
Maintain airport and airline contact information in the database
Collect and file flight files

Qualifications
THE PERSON
Desire to immerse self into role and commit to the demands of the role
Ability to work independently, but enjoys working with people inside and outside of ACS
Enjoys working to goals and objectives in a competitive environment
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Strong numeracy skills
Flight watching/overseeing flight departures
Gain clear agreement and commitment from others by persuading, convincing and negotiating
Working productively in a pressurised environment
Focusing on clients’ needs and satisfaction
Make prompt, clear decisions which may involve tough choices or considered risks
Additional Information
WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU
Starting salary $52K USD
Medical, Dental, Vision & 401K retirement benefits package
20 days in paid-time off, public holidays + additional paid leave for your birthday, wedding and more.
Structured career development – ACS offers 9 levels of career progression opportunities. The next level being Cargo Trainee Broker.
Award-winning in house training and mentoring – approximately 4 weeks based in our London HQ.
A friendly, fun and exciting environment – summer party, holiday party and department nights out!
Air Charter Service Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

job_descriptions.8a51643f20985f86:
Job detailsSalary$26.92 - $34.62 an hourJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionYour Job
Our Sales Operations team ensures that Indeed’s sales teams are supported, successful, and comply with the highest standards of business, law and ethics, while providing Indeed's management with the information and guidance required to succeed around the world. Every month, over 250 million people count on us to help them find jobs, publish their resumes, process their job applications, and connect them to qualified candidates for their job openings. Simply put, we help support the people who help people get jobs.
The Sales Operations Analyst will support our fast-growing sales teams. They will be responsible for learning the ins and outs of each major Indeed business unit, play a critical role in building relationships with the senior leadership team, and drive forward initiatives that will help us accelerate sales revenue and efficiency. The ideal candidate is someone who has a strong desire to identify problems and use data to find actionable solutions. They are self motivated, organized, and can work comfortably in a fast paced and ever changing environment.
Responsibilities:
Become an expert in our CRM, reporting tools, sales teams, and processes
Improve and maintain sales efficiency
Provide day-to-day support for one or many of Indeed’s rapidly growing sales teams
Partner with sales leadership to ensure our sales teams are supported and successful
Utilize Excel, Tableau, Ishbooks and other tools to perform extensive data analysis
Monitor data and system rules to ensure data integrity
Analyze and respond to inquiries from members of our sales team
Diagnose and solve technical problems
Own and optimize opportunity sizing, transition planning, quota projects and other miscellaneous strategic projects for your business units
Who You Are
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree with a focus within Finance, Economics, Mathematics or a related field is preferred
2+ years experience in sales operations, sales strategy, or a related field
Advanced experience with Excel such as vlookups, nested formulas, pivot tables, macros, charts etc.
SQL knowledge is not required but is a plus
Comfortable working with large data sets
Familiarity with CRM systems. Salesforce experience is a plus
Familiarity with Tableau, Google Data Studio, or another business intelligence application
Ability to analyze data and draw actionable insights
Effective communicator who can speak with both technical and non-technical audiences
Energy, enthusiasm and hands-on attitude
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Who we are
Our Finance team ensures that Indeed follows the highest standards of business, law and ethics to help us succeed around the world. Our goal is to provide excellent customer service to internal and external clients while helping our management team make decisions using the most relevant and accurate information available.
Our Mission
As the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.
(*comScore Total Visits, March 2020)
Salary Range Disclaimer
The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, long term incentives, an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.
Salary Range Transparency
NYC Metro Area 26.92 - 34.62 USD per hour

Indeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neuro-diversity, disability, age, or veteran status, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.

You can learn more about Crunch here: www.crunch.com.THE CRUNCH PHILOSOPHY: There are no judgments here -- No too much or not enough. No glares of disapproval. Here we keep open minds. CRUNCH. NO JUDGMENTS.Crunch boasts state-of-the-art facilities and mixes fun and fitness to make for the ideal work environment. job_descriptions.72b96d0230dc4e29: Job detailsSalary$50,000 - $120,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeQualificationsBachelor's (Preferred)Full Job DescriptionAt Northwestern Mutual, we strive to understand our client’s goals and visions to uncover solutions that put them on a path to achieve their financial objectives. We are seasoned professionals that come from varying backgrounds and experiences to build rewarding practices and relationships with our clients. With Northwestern Mutual, you will be supported by our network of specialists, training programs and mentoring opportunities.THE ROLE:Assist clients to achieve and maintain financial security by providing advice and to match solutions with client’s needs and goals.Develop rapport with clients and foster long-term relationships.Be knowledgeable about Northwestern Mutual financial products and global financial market trends.Build and maintain client bases, keep current client financial plans up-to-date and recruit new clients on an ongoing basis.Provide dedicated and focused customer experiences.BY JOINING OUR TEAM, YOU’LL HAVE ACCESS TO:An award-winning training program to help get you started.Mentorship and professional development training throughout your entire career.Leading industry products and solutions built on an integrated technology backbone.Financial support for securities licensing, professional designations and certifications for both your personal and professional business growth.The opportunity to design your roadmap to leadership and specialized roles.A culture that promotes diversity, teamwork, work/life balance, recognition and rewards.Extraordinary income potential. Job detailsSalary$180,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionWant to join a fast-growing pharmacy in the fertility specialty space? Schraft's 2.0 Pharmacy is looking to hire another dynamic, self-starter to its sales team! The Sales Representative will be responsible for identifying fertility business opportunities and drive utilization for Schraft's 2.0 Pharmacy within assigned geography.

HIRING FOR MULTIPLE LOCATIONS ACROSS THE U.S. PLEASE APPLY TO LEARN MORE.

Responsibilities
Identify, qualify, contact, and close fertility accounts in assigned territory.
Source new sales opportunities through clinic visits, outbound calls and emails.
Convert opportunities into active accounts by scheduling meetings with key decision maker(s).
Promote and differentiate Schraft's 2.0 Pharmacy services to meet or exceed quarterly objectives throughout assigned territory.
Integrate a consultative selling approach with fertility clinic and be seen as an extended member of the office.
Use branded marketing materials effectively and frequently to differentiate Schraft's services from other fertility pharmacies.
Possess detailed knowledge of facility processes, products, and company protocols.
Establish & maintain strong relationships with key clinical decision-makers.
Coordinate and implement strategic territory initiatives.
Attend conferences, trade shows and events when appropriate to promote Schraft's.
Provide weekly updates to leadership on activity, results, competitive analysis, market trends.
Remain updated of any new product and regulatory changes
Maintain a high standard of professionalism in verbal and written communications.
Follow established sales operating procedures and best practices.
Implement planned sales strategies based on analytics and customer requests
Meets all performance expectations and regularly exceeds sales goals

Requirements
Bachelor's Degree and 3-5 years of relevant sales, and/or account management experience.
Must be a self-starter with good decision-making abilities who has a high sense of urgency to meet quarterly objectives.
Excellent oral, written, and presentation skills.
Strong grasp of business analytics tools and the ability to analyze territory data, monitor performance & review competitive trends.
Fluent with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and other business analytics tools.
Valid State license and driving record in good standing.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
High integrity & customer-centric
Analytical and quantitative skills
High adaptability in an environment with significant change and ambiguity
Ability to interact effectively with diverse customers via phone and email
Must be able to maintain above average attendance and punctuality
Able to learn detailed knowledge of pharmaceutical products and fertility treatments
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Must be detail oriented and possess high level of accuracy
Aptitude for online research; Ability to search, locate, and identify target clinic leads
Willingness to work collaboratively and ability to demonstrate effective teamwork
Must possess problem solving skills
Ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines
Must be self-starter and results-driven
Sensitivity to confidential documents and information

Compensation package
This role is commission only. You will earn 2% of total revenues generated on clinic, with a minimum target of $9,000,000, which would equate to $180,000 annually (at 2% commission on revenue generated). There is no cap on commission.
Compensation package also includes 60 days of training and a draw on commission of $2,000/month for the first 60 days
BOLD Worldwide will pay for 50%, up to $300 for Health Insurance.

Job detailsSalary$45,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionWe have an exciting opportunity for a Sales Assistant to join the Proprietary and Custom Sales channel at Penguin Random House! This team is responsible for creating exclusive book editions of Penguin Random House titles for Barnes & Noble and Costco as well as the International Sales & Special Markets departments. With more than 250 publishing brands, Penguin Random House has a book for every category, and this team helps accounts stand apart from the competition with customized product creation. The Assistant will play a key role in this mission by providing the team with administrative and sales support.
Specific responsibilities include:
Creating and maintaining project flow documents, customer portals, and customer spec sheets.
Assisting with the preparation for sales meetings by creating and updating PowerPoint presentations, confirming agendas, taking notes, and scheduling meetings.
Researching and gathering backlist title information, securing out of print titles, utilizing in-house systems for project management, managing sample library, and tracking warehouse inventory.
Providing ad hoc proofreading and light editing on products.
Supporting the Kohl’s Cares programs and other custom promotional projects.
Providing general administrative support to the department.
Please apply if you meet the following minimum requirements:
Prior office experience
Excellent organizational skills and strong attention to detail
Ability to effectively prioritize and work on multiple projects at a time
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proven ability to work independently as well as part of a larger team in a busy, deadline-driven environment
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, especially PowerPoint and Excel
Ability to adapt and learn new systems quickly
Previous publishing experience a plus
Knowledge of SAP a plus
Salary for this position is $45,000. Full-time employees are eligible for our comprehensive benefits program. Please apply using our online application process, and please include your resume and cover letter.
Penguin Random House is the leading adult and children’s publishing house in North America, the United Kingdom and many other regions around the world. In publishing the best books in every genre and subject for all ages, we are committed to quality, excellence in execution, and innovation throughout the entire publishing process: editorial, design, marketing, publicity, sales, production, and distribution. Our vibrant and diverse international community of nearly 250 publishing brands and imprints include Ballantine Bantam Dell, Berkley, Clarkson Potter, Crown, DK, Doubleday, Dutton, Grosset & Dunlap, Little Golden Books, Knopf, Modern Library, Pantheon, Penguin Books, Penguin Press, Penguin Random House Audio, Penguin Young Readers, Portfolio, Puffin, Putnam, Random House, Random House Children’s Books, Riverhead, Ten Speed Press, Viking, and Vintage, among others. More information can be found at http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/.
Penguin Random House values the array of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.
