Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job Description
Highly technical and analytical with 12 or more years of ETL and analytics systems development and deployment experience
Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations and virtual teams.
Ability to think understand complex business requirements and render them as prototype systems with quick turnaround time.
Implementation and tuning experience in the Big Data Ecosystem, (such as Hadoop, Spark, Presto, Hive), Database (such as Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, MS SQL Server) and Data Warehouses (such as Redshift, Teradata, Vertica)
Knowledge of foundation infrastructure requirements such as Networking, Storage, and Hardware Optimization with Hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
BS level technical degree required; Computer Science or Mathematics background preferred

Are you a data and analytics specialist and experienced with all the aspect of building Data Lakes including ingestion, transformation and cataloging? Do you have deep expertise in AWS services for managing data at speed and scale? Do you have a unique combination of deep technical knowledge, business acumen and strong interpersonal skills? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a Solutions Architect to work with our customers and help them build cloud-based data lakes and leverage it for data analytics, and machine learning.

This role is a senior role in the Database and Analytics service teams at AWS and provides a unique opportunity to lead innovations and transformational change with large Enterprise customers in their journey to cloud. At AWS, customer obsession is in our DNA. The successful candidate will become a trusted advisor to our customers and will partner with AWS specialist sales, business development, and product teams to craft a go to market strategy, ensure success of our most complex customer engagements, collect, organized and disseminate the internal expertise needed to drive data lakes, analytics, and machine learning workloads.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Be the customer’s trusted advisor. Understand customer requirements and render those as architectural models that will operate at large scale and high performance, and advise customers on how to run these architectural models on AWS
Work alongside customers to build data management platforms using Amazon Elastic Map Reduce (EMR), Amazon Athena, AWS Glue, AWS Lake Formation and other related services.
Extract best-practice knowledge, reference architectures, and patterns from these engagements for sharing with the worldwide AWS solution architect community and engineering teams.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


An advanced degree in computer science, MIS, engineering or related discipline
AWS Certification, e.g. AWS Solutions Architect, Developer, or SysOps Associate/Professional
Track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of business such as large enterprises and start-ups.
Deep understanding of Data transformation/ETL tools and technologies and understanding of related concepts (such as data cataloging and curation, etc.)
Demonstrated industry leadership in the fields of Data Warehousing, Data Science and Data processing.

** For more information on Amazon Web Services, please visit http://aws.amazon.com **

You will partner with cross functional teams to identify opportunities and support the development of data modeling best practice approaches. As Senior Data Modeler, you’ll provide subject matter expertise on data architecture, that includes designing, creating, deploying and managing Splunk’s analytics data architecture that aligns with direction, best practices, and structured data standards.

Major Duties / Job Responsibilities:

Experience leading data discovery sessions with business teams, comprising product owners, data analysts, and cross-team technologists to understand enterprise data requirements of analytics projects.
Experience in illustrating business and data processes using simple entity relationship diagrams.
Ability to comprehend and apply Cloud Data Architecture Standards and integration design patterns.
Create detailed logical models identifying all the entities, attributes and their relationships along with the characteristics associated with each of those.
Segregate data models into ODS , data marts, and reporting layers. Support review, signoff and adoption of data models in collaboration with global businesses, architecture and delivery teams.
Experience with Master Data Management (Enterprise Customer, Account, Product, Employee Models) and Data Warehouse/Analytics Business Glossary implementation frameworks.
Required Qualifications, Skills & Experience
12+ years of data architecture related experience such as data analysis, data modeling, data integration, master and metadata management
Experience identifying business subject areas and providing a taxonomy of data domains across enterprise data warehouse subject areas.
Experience with Sales, Finance, Employee data in business applications such as Salesforce, SAP, Anaplan, Workday, etc
Partner with product owners, data engineers and business systems analysts to identify data mappings and generate enterprise analytics data models.
Document data models across the company in a centralized location that is highly visible to stakeholders
Work with platform, information security architects and data privacy leaders to design and enhance cloud data infrastructure to address security, PII and data reliability concerns.
Extensive hands on experience in leading large-scale full-cycle cloud enterprise data warehousing (EDW) projects
Extensive hands on experience in data warehousing design, ETL/ELT, BI process development
Excellent SQL and strong hands-on scripting ability.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout:
Macy’s is proudly America’s Department Store. For more than 160 years, Macy’s has served generations at every stage of their lives. Customers come to us for fashion, value and celebration. Now is an exciting time to join Macy’s, Inc. The face of retail is changing, and change requires innovation.
Macy’s Digital business is in the top 10 largest in the U.S. (#1 largest in NYC) and has driven 10 consecutive years of double-digit growth. We’re building a new type of customer-centric shopping experience - at the intersection of content, commerce, and technology - to help customers find and buy products they love.
Do you want to collaborate with a smart and talented team in a fun work environment? This is a unique opportunity to join an established company that is investing in development and growing digital business at scale. Gain first-hand experience defining the future of online and physical commerce. With a constant influx of exciting and challenging problems to solve - you'll never have a boring day at the office. We also offer many roles with the freedom to build and lead a team. Join Macy’s Digital to grow your career and help shape the future of an iconic brand.
Job Overview:
Macy's, Inc is building an Enterprise Data & Analytics team to further grow our capabilities in support of our mission to be a data-led, customer-centric company. This team will focus on accelerating impact from analytics, coordinating an enterprise-wide roadmap, and ensuring proper data governance and management. As a colleague on this team, the Lead Data Architect will help lead the charge to execute on our vision to build profitable lifetime customer relationships by embedding data & analytics at the heart of everything we do.

The Lead Data Architect will conceptualize and design how data will be structured, described, classified, stored, integrated and consumed to facilitate priority analytics use cases. The Lead Data Architect sets the standard data architecture and pipeline integrity of governance principles. The Lead Data Architect translates the business and priority use cases into data architecture solutions, including conceptual, logical and physical modes.
Essential Functions:
Data Management & Preparation
Design and streamline enterprise data architecture and pipelines for prioritized downstream analytics that are supported by Enterprise Data & Analytics (EDA)
Adhere to processes to ensure data pulled from various sources meets quality standards, is curated and enhanced for analytical use and there is a "single source of truth"
Conceptualize and design data models, entities, relationships and rules governing the quality of data
Work with counterparts from Tech to communicate and deliver a long-term architecture roadmap that facilitates use by data scientists for priority use cases; EDA team focused on "last mile" transformations on select data required for use cases
Work with data engineers to troubleshoot application problems, resolve issues effectively
Formalize metadata descriptions and capture methods, registries, and workflow
Collaborate with Tech teams to future-proof data & analytics software, tools and architecture to reduce risk
Work with Legal and Privacy teams to adhere to data privacy and security standards
Work with Data Science team to understand data structure and sourcing needs to enable them to build out use cases as efficiently as possible
Culture
Community builder to foster data and analytics culture and to support data-driven thinking and discussions across priority analytics use case
Embody data-driven culture at Macy's
Bolster awareness, knowledge and conviction around data-driven practices and behaviors, increasing digital IQ of Business Units
Proactively raise data issues and act as the main point of contact to perform root cause analysis and resolve architecture incidents
Support user adoption of enterprise data repositories and leverage standardized data pipelines across use cases
Key Performance Indicators
Quantity, type, and quality of databases and pipelines, in partnership with Technology
Compliance with relevant laws and regulations , in partnership with Legal/Privacy
Automation of data cleansing and harmonization processes in refined/trusted zones
Qualifications and Competencies:
Bachelor's Degree from a 4-year college or university
5+ years related experience
Ability to define and establish principles and standards for data architecture, design, data domains, data models and data integration
Experience handling structured and unstructured data from many sources and deep knowledge about batch and streaming data processing methods
Deep understanding of conceptual, logical and physical data models, data warehouse design and data migration design
Experience in designing/implementing enterprise-grade user access and control
Ability to effectively share technical information, communicate technical issues and solutions to all levels of business
Able to juggle multiple projects - can identify primary and secondary objectives, prioritize time and communicate timeline to team members
Ability and desire to take product/project ownership
Ability to think creatively, strategically and technically
Ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and Company needs.
This job description is not all-inclusive, and Macy’s Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy’s Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionThe Career Potential
Ortho Clinical Diagnostics is committed to improving and saving lives with diagnostics. To do this we hire people who share this dream and are ready for new adventures. As a valued team member, you will carve your own career path and be part of building this company stronger and better than ever before. There is no limit to the experiences, opportunities and new directions you will have access to here at Ortho Clinical Diagnostics. More importantly, you will be driving the surge of a whole new direction in important medicine. That’s something we can all take pride in as we take this journey together.
Ortho is known in the industry as a leader in customer service and support. Deeply understanding and exceeding the needs of our clinical lab, hospital and blood bank customers is what we do. It’s who we are. If you join Ortho, no matter what your role, you will be expected to keep that Customer Excellence focus in your work.

The Opportunity
As we continue to grow, we are seeking a Global Manager, Customer Master Data to work in our facility. The Global Manager, Customer Master Data understands how customer master data impacts all stages of the customer buying journey as well as our internal sales and marketing journeys. The person in this role will focus on understanding the cross-functional processes where customer master data is created and used. You will work your IT Data Architect partner to create, implement, and maintain a global Customer Master strategy with consolidated, standardized data and processes, as well as a streamlined governance model. You will develop and enforce data management policies, standards and practices to ensure data quality and ensure security and privacy are maintained. Using a phased approach and a purposeful maturity model, you will lead and support the efforts to optimize how we manage and use customer master data at Ortho. You will leverage your expertise to execute change management plans, advise key stakeholders, hold teams accountable, and train users. As a key member of the Customer Service Excellence team, you will ensure that our new processes are designed with customer-centric thinking and you will be responsible for recommending innovative ways to use customer master data to support a 360-degree view of our customers.
The Responsibilities
Collaborate with key stakeholders and vendors to assess current state, define critical attributes, understand needs/use cases, create our global strategy, and ultimately implement enhanced customer master data processes and tools; Ensure adherence to the guidelines and proper maintenance/utilization of the data.
L ead and/or support the key projectives and initiatives associated with Customer Master including, but not limited to, the implementation of standardized global processes and tools; Work cross-functionally with other master data managers to ensure end-to-end alignment; Partner with IT Data Architect to select the necessary tools and define a systems landscape for Master Data management.
Function as the Order to Cash subject matter expert and global process owner of Customer Master; Track key performance metrics to measure quality and adherence to standards; Determine opportunities and help guide investment roadmap decisions.
Indirectly manage the people responsible for inputting and maintaining customer master data information; Assign data attribute owners/stewards; Train the teams on new processes; Write and maintain the relevant work instructions and process documentation.
Participate in other functional projects where Customer Master expertise is needed; Leverage insights and understand trends to identify innovative ways to utilize customer master data.
The Individual
Bachelor's degree in related field required: Marketing, Business, Data Science or Analytics, or other field. Graduate degree preferred.
A minimum of 5 years in Master Data, Sales Analytics, Commercial Enablement, or other related field.
Experience in a data environment- facilitating requirements gathering sessions, documenting requirements, analyzing and evaluating possible solutions to meet requirements - is critical, as is a deep understanding of requirements gathering processes and business process mapping.
Experience with customer master maintenance and/or certification in data governance and management a plus.
Strong oral & written communication as well as effective collaboration skills a must.
Experience in managing global, complex projects critical.
Proven ability to drive projects to successful completion and manage the associated changes.
Ability to build strong relationships with cross functional teams and influence without authority.
A ctive listening skills to understand business needs that drive teams to make decisions that have broad impact that meet company and project goals.
Experience in healthcare strongly preferred.
Project management experience a plus.
Proficient with Microsoft programs.
Required travel 10% domestic and international.

Are you ready to step up to the New and take your technology expertise to the next level?
Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. GCP Data Architect and Engineering Lead - Senior Manager will be responsible for architecting transformation and modernization of enterprise data solutions on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) integrating native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies. A solid experience and understanding of considerations for large scale architecting, solutioning and operationalization of data warehouses, data lakes and analytics platforms on GCP is a must. We are looking for candidates who have a broad set of technology skills across these areas and who can demonstrate an ability to design right solutions with appropriate combination of Google Cloud and 3rd party technologies for deploying on Google Cloud.
Racking up those air miles will have to wait, as weekly non-essential travel to client sites is currently suspended. For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only.
Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts.


Key responsibilities may include:
As a lead architect, work with implementation teams from concept to operations, providing deep technical subject matter expertise for successfully deploying large scale data solutions in the enterprise, using modern data/analytics technologies on premise and cloud
Through a formal sales process, work with the Sales team to identify and qualify Google Cloud Platform (GCP) opportunities.
Lead cloud solution and scoping to generate estimates and approaches for proposals and SOWs for customers.
Create detailed target state technical, security, data and operational architecture and design blueprints incorporating modern data technologies and cloud data services demonstrating modernization value proposition
Lead detail technical assessments of current state of enterprise data and architect a path to transformation into a modern data powered enterprise
Demonstrate experience presenting technical topics in front of an audience
Conduct full technical discovery, identifying pain points, business and technical requirements, “as is” and “to be” scenarios.
Compare solution alternatives across both technical and business parameters which support the define cost and service requirements.
Apply Methodology, reusable assets, and previous work experience to deliver consistently high-quality work.
Deliver written or oral status reports regularly.
Stay educated on new and emerging technologies/patterns/methodologies and market offerings that may be of interest to our clients.
Adapt to existing methods and procedures to create possible alternative solutions to moderately complex problems.
Understand the strategic direction set by senior management as it relates to team goals.
Use considerable judgment to define solution and seeks guidance on complex problems.
Prepare and deliver product messaging to highlight value proposition and unique differentiators.
Manage small teams of pre-sales Solution Architects and/or work efforts (if in an independent contributor role) at a client or within Accenture.

Basic Qualifications:
Minimum of 7 years of technical solutions implementation, architecture design, evaluation, and investigation in a cloud environment.
Minimum of 5 years architecting, developing, and deploying scalable enterprise data analytics solutions (Enterprise Data Warehouses, Data Marts, etc)
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, including data warehouse technical architectures, infrastructure components, ETL/ ELT and reporting/analytic tools and environments (such as Apache Beam, Hadoop, Spark, Pig, Hive, MapReduce, Flume)
Minimum 1 year of designing, building and operationalizing large-scale enterprise data solutions and applications using one or more of GCP data and analytics services in combination with 3rd parties - Spark, Cloud DataProc, Cloud Dataflow, Apache Beam, BigTable, Cloud BigQuery, Cloud PubSub, Cloud Functions, etc.
Minimum 1 year of hands-on experience analyzing, re-architecting and re-platforming on-premise data warehouses to data platforms on Google cloud using GCP/3rd party services
Minimum 1 year of designing and building production data pipelines from ingestion to consumption within a hybrid big data architecture, using Java, Python, Scala etc.
Minimum 1 year of architecting and implementing next generation data and analytics platforms on GCP cloud
Minimum 1 year of designing and implementing data engineering, ingestion and curation functions on GCP cloud using GCP native or custom programming
Minimum 1 year of experience in performing detail assessments of current state data platforms and creating an appropriate transition path to GCP cloud
Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. If Associate Degree, must have minimum 6 years work experience

Preferred Qualifications:
Minimum 4+ years of experience in architecting large-scale data solutions, performing architectural assessments, crafting architectural options and analysis, finalizing preferred solution alternative working with IT and Business stakeholders
2+ years of hands-on experience designing and implementing data ingestion solutions on GCP using GCP native services or with 3rd parties such as Talend, Informatica
2+ years of hands-on experience architecting and designing data lakes on GCP cloud serving analytics and BI application integrations
Minimum 1+ Experience in designing and optimizing data models on Google cloud using GCP data stores such as BigQuery, Bigtable
Minimum 1+ years of experience integrating GCP or 3rd party KMS, HSM with GCP data services for building secure data solutions
Minimum 1+ years of experience introducing and operationalizing self-service data preparation tools (e.g. Trifacta, Paxata) on GCP
Minimum 2+ years of architecting and operating large production Hadoop/NoSQL clusters on premise or using Cloud services
Minimum 1+ years architecting and implementing metadata management on GCP
Architecting and implementing data governance and security for data platforms on GCP
Designing operations architecture and conducting performance engineering for large scale data lakes a production environment
Craft and lead client design workshops and provide tradeoffs and recommendations towards building solutions
Author blog entries and whitepapers on GCP data solutions, architecture and strategic topics
Google Certified Professional Data Engineer

Professional Skill Requirements:
Proven ability to build, manage and foster a team-oriented environment
Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
Excellent leadership and management skills
Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment.

Racking up those air miles will have to wait, as weekly non-essential travel to client sites is currently suspended. For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout:
Macy’s is proudly America’s Department Store. For more than 160 years, Macy’s has served generations at every stage of their lives. Customers come to us for fashion, value and celebration. Now is an exciting time to join Macy’s, Inc. The face of retail is changing, and change requires innovation.
Macy’s Digital business is in the top 10 largest in the U.S. (#1 largest in NYC) and has driven 10 consecutive years of double-digit growth. We’re building a new type of customer-centric shopping experience - at the intersection of content, commerce, and technology - to help customers find and buy products they love.
Do you want to collaborate with a smart and talented team in a fun work environment? This is a unique opportunity to join an established company that is investing in development and growing digital business at scale. Gain first-hand experience defining the future of online and physical commerce. With a constant influx of exciting and challenging problems to solve - you'll never have a boring day at the office. We also offer many roles with the freedom to build and lead a team. Join Macy’s Digital to grow your career and help shape the future of an iconic brand.
Job Overview:
The Senior Business Insights Analyst will execute analytics and develop insights, tools and reports for prioritized use cases. The Senior Analyst will perform advanced analytics and build key dashboards for business users to leverage in a usable format to drive business decisions and key operational processes. In this role, the Senior Business Insights Analysts will partner with executive level business stakeholders and technical partners to successfully support use case delivery. Perform other duties as assigned.
Essential Functions:
Analytics
Translate business needs into well-defined analytics projects.
Execute advanced analytics, business intelligence (BI), and reporting that aids data-driven business decision making and process automation.
Identify trends from sources of raw data to increase the efficiency of the organization.
Cross-communicate between analysts and business teams, including senior leaders.
Think logically toward problem solving with keen insights for business solutions and the analytical steps required to execute them through dashboards and reports.
Design and enable dynamic dashboards that allow users to "double-click" on key aggregated values to see the next level of detail.
Provide support to Data Architect and Data Engineer to define and develop the required data structures and databases that help to simplify and accelerate BI reporting.
Provide support to business to ensure successful use case delivery in Business Units.
Culture
Community builder to foster data and analytics culture and to support data-driven thinking and discussions across priority analytics use case.
Support businesses in data & analytics capability building.
Embody data-driven culture at Macy's.
Support user adoption of analytical tools and methods and embrace data in strategic business decisions.
Bolster awareness, knowledge and conviction around data-driven practices and behaviors, increasing digital IQ of BUs.
Key Performance Indicators
Use case value delivery to business.
Development of reports and dashboards.
Usage of reports and dashboards in strategic business decisions.
Qualifications and Competencies:
Bachelor's Degree from a 4-year college or university
3-5 years direct experience
5+ years of work experience, and at least 3 years of demonstrable experience in the role’s relevant technologies and field of expertise.
Demonstrated track record of proficiency working in advanced analytics, experience with SQL, writing code and using data visualization, BI software and/or reporting tools (e.g. PowerBI).
Experience in leveraging data cleaning, transformation, analytics and reporting from large data sets to support use cases and drive business value.
Ability to effectively share technical information, communicate technical issues and solutions to all levels of business
Able to juggle multiple projects - can identify primary and secondary objectives, prioritize time and communicate timeline to team members
Ability and desire to take product/project ownership
Ability to think creatively, strategically and technically
Ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and Company needs.
This job description is not all-inclusive, and Macy’s Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy’s Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAt Cepheid, we are passionate about improving healthcare through faster, more accurate diagnostic tests. With our GeneXpert® System, we’ve taken the most sophisticated molecular technology and packaged it into an automated, easy-to-use format that has quickly become the platform of choice worldwide. From the largest laboratories to small physician offices, our game-changing solution delivers critical answers when clinicians and patients need them most. Through strong molecular biology capabilities and ongoing product innovation, we are focused on developing tests for healthcare-associated infections, sexual health, critical infectious disease, virology, and oncology applications. Come join our vision for a better way and help make life better for us all! For more details, visit us at www.cepheid.com or follow us on Twitter (@CepheidNews).

**NOTE: This position is remote from any location in the United States**

The SFS Architect will be working with both Business and IT team members to document, design and build product solutions, support business needs, follow strong architectural principles, use system resources efficiently, and integrate cleanly with the user interface and server components of the SFS application and technical architecture. Responsibilities:
Be recognized as functional specialist in Salesforce Field Service Lightning
Translate business requirements into well-architected solutions to best use the Salesforce platforms and products
Provide detailed level of effort estimates for proposed solutions. Articulate the benefits and risks to a solution’s feasibility and functionality
Define business outcomes and success criteria
Engage with Business Partners, Project Management, Product Owner, and our internal delivery team to design, build and execute the best possible solution
Perform Fit/Gap Analysis between customer requirements and Salesforce capabilities.
Build solution design documentation, including user stories and process flows
Configure the Salesforce solution (clicks not code) while working with our extended team for any needed custom development Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree
Field Service Lightning Consultant-Certified
3+ years of Salesforce Field Service implementation experience
6+ years of CRM industry experience

Confirmed ability to design and optimize business processes and integrate business processes across disparate systems
Excellent client-facing written and oral communications skills
Active Salesforce Consultant certifications (Strong preference for Field Service Lightning, Service Cloud, and Community Cloud)
Proficiency in writing user stories to collect Salesforce requirements
Experience with data migrations from third-party systems to Salesforce
Experience with adopting Agile methodology for development
Active Salesforce Certifications (System/Data Architect strongly preferred)

Danaher is a global science & technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life worldwide. Our world class brands are leaders in some of the most demanding and attractive industries, including life sciences, medical diagnostics, dental, environmental and applied solutions. Our globally diverse team of 71,000 associates is united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, which serves as our competitive advantage. We generated $19.9B in revenue last year. We are ranked #162 on the Fortune 500 and our stock has outperformed the S&P 500 by more than 5,200% over 25 years.
At Danaher, you can build a career in a way no other company can duplicate. Our brands allow us to offer dynamic careers across multiple industries. We're innovative, fast-paced, results-oriented, and we win. We need talented people to keep winning. Here you'll learn how DBS is used to shape strategy, focus execution, align our people, and create value for customers and shareholders. Come join our winning team.

Are you a Data Analytics specialist? Do you have Data Warehousing, Hadoop/Data Lake experience? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale (billions + records) data challenges in the world today? Do you like to work on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high impact projects that use the newest data analytic technologies? This role will specifically focus on large scale data warehousing and data warehouse modernization. Our consultants will develop, deliver and implement data warehouse projects that help our customers help our customers leverage their data to develop business insights. Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionEvolutionIQ
Evolution IQ is revolutionizing the insurance industry by changing the way claims analytics are done. We are bringing bleeding-edge technologies to one of the world’s oldest industries.
Evolution IQ is developing a next-gen platform for the insurance industry. We develop machines with deep comprehension and vast data access to guide humans to the optimal decisions over large numbers of claims. Our training data includes all parts of historical insurance claims, as well as data we source externally. Our findings are presented in intuitive products to streamline the claim investigation process. The result is potential savings in the hundreds of millions, increased fairness and added precision to insurance pricing.
We’re working to make the insurance industry faster, fairer and cheaper for everyone.
Our Team
We are founded by a senior Google AI expert and a Bridgewater Associates Algorithmic Investor & Stanford MBA. We’re not looking for employees. We’re looking for partners in work, partners in culture-building, and partners in the future of data-driven insurance. The development team consists of world class engineers and leaders from companies like Google and Bloomberg. Each individual has had great success building large scale enterprise software and is now excited to try their hand at transforming the insurance industry.
Our investors include First Round Capital (seed investors in Uber, Square, Looker), FirstMark (Airbnb, Pinterest, Shopify) and Foundation Capital (Lending Club, CoverWallet, Netflix) and we have deep support within each of their organizations. You will also have full access to their networks and counterparts at portfolio companies for advice, ideas and community.

Your Role
Who are you? A senior data engineer who is excited to work on challenging ML infrastructure problems. You'll be the technical owner of EvolutionIQ’s Machine Learning Platform working closely with the ML Team to understand data science workflows and build a scalable, robust and developer friendly platform that can support multiple different products and use cases.
OutcomesWork with Data Scientists to map ML workflows to a scalable platform
Setup a reliable continuous model deployment infrastructureSetup centralized data storage to support ease of data access and EDASetup reliable and secure client data ingestionRefactor core algorithms for improved efficiency, readability and test coverage
Role CompetenciesDesigned and Implemented ML platform used for building and shipping multiple productsOwned, deployed and maintained ETL pipelines in productionExperience in deploying & maintaining distributed learning frameworks (TensorFlow preferred)Extensive experience in deploying systems on GCP or AWSExpert developer who uses writes clean, efficient, easy to understand code with unit tests, functional design patternsExpert in Python 3 and Pandas or equivalent data manipulation libraryExpert data architect eager to solve complex, multi dimensional big data problems with advanced strategic leverage of databases, data assets and DAG pipelineExcellent document writing skills
Extreme creativity and resourcefulness, appetite to solve previously unsolved problems
OtherExtreme self-starter and self-motivatorHolds self to extremely high standards, and inspires others to do the sameOpen to giving and receiving critical feedbackAble to handle the ups and downs of early startup lifeEnthusiasm for team work and pair workKind, empathetic, polite and professional

Job detailsSalary$150,000 - $225,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionMy name is Tony Bruno, and it's been awhile since we have reached out to you from our firm, but wanted to inform you about an exciting position we are working on for a growing client. They are a Healthcare/Pharma Tech company in the New York area looking for a Senior-level Data Engineering and Architecture. You will run their own projects and so much more. If you feel you have these skills, please reach out to me for more information ASAP.
Here are the job specs I have as of today:

Thank You, Tony Bruno/Career Developers
201-962-3563; tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com
#21-00039-Data Bricks/H2O.ai Data Engineer/Architect - (Full Time/Perm Job)

Location: Remote Only until the policy is lifted (4/1/21), then to work Onsite in Midtown Manhattan. Must be local to NYC/NJ. No Relocation available,

Salary: 150-225K (No C2C calls, please)

Additional Info:
Must have a current background and experience with H2O.ai.
Functional on hands Data Engineer & Architecture/Project Management.
Must have some Machine Learning Engineering/Algorithms, Data Science, Python coding, Azure a plus.
PHD is a Plus, MS would be the minimum needed.
Healthcare or Pharma background is a Strong Desire/Plus.


POSITION OBJECTIVE:

The Manager, Data Engineering and Architecture will partner with the VP Data Strategy and the IT organization to enable deployment of Data Science assets (data, model, business rules) into business workflows. The Manager, Data Engineering and Architecture (DE&A) is responsible for creating playbooks and modular code to enable the adoption of best practices within the Data Science organization. This role is responsible for contributing to the development of the data architecture, assisting in the selection of tools, and mastering the use of selected tools to advance the objectives of the company. This role will be responsible for deploying the architecture on the Microsoft Azure cloud platform. The Manager, DE&A consults on use cases to provide a high-level view of cost, time and effort associated with project objectives and delivery goals. This role is responsible for guiding the Data Science practice to allow for faster, cheaper, consistent, and reliable deployments while enabling transparency and reproducibility of modeling assets.

In this dual responsibility role, the DE&A will also serve as the Machine Learning Engineer responsible for hands-on deployments of data science artifacts into business workflows and will work closely with the Data Scientists to understand the inputs and outputs of the models. The engineer will also establish the testing criteria for validating the model deployments in collaboration with the Data Scientist and VP Data Strategy. The engineer must have an understanding of model deployment pipelines incorporating data from internal systems and third-party sources.

Further, this role will have responsibility for adopting and contributing to, the data governance model established by the parent company (XXX). In this role he or she will collaborate with colleagues throughout the organization to adopt and adhere to the standards developed by the organization.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Understand sources of data within the company and work with SME's to describe and understand data lineage and suitability for a use case.
Create summary statistics/reports from data warehouses, marts, and operational data stores to establish testing criteria and create model training and validation data sets.
Produce code artifacts and documentation for reproducibility and hand-off to the data science team.
Contribute to the design, implementation, and evaluation of Client models in production in an agile framework. Execute testing (integration, performance, regression).
Prototype new approaches and productionize model code to be deployed to business applications.
Adhere to requirements for scale, performance, and availability.
Support implementation and testing of assets into production work and manage and estimate work to deliver the requirements for each project.
Describe technical work to non-technical audiences.
Establish best practices for code management, issue management, data, and storage management.
Perform code review and mentor engineers on team, set timelines and delivery scope and develop success criteria for project increment delivery.
Interact with systems engineers, data architect, product owners, and asset owners to propose a technical solution and provide work estimates to deliver the software. Call out risks and issues and establish escalation criteria for product based on final solution.
Provide L3 support for production assets in conjunction with IT production support teams, Data Scientists, and the model Product Owner.
Basic knowledge of modeling tools and data science platforms is preferred.
Ability to provide input as a consultant on projects as a technical expert.
Ability to identify and investigate potential data errors during model development or deployment phases.
Ability to respond to change, interested in continuous learning, adopting new technologies to enable data science asset deployment into production.
Understand tiered application architectures, understand and implement API based predictive and scoring services.
Establish production support documentation and process with Information Technology staff and third-party providers.
Configure deployments in containerized environments.

job_descriptions.834491f0b98ce344:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionEvolutionIQ
Evolution IQ is revolutionizing the insurance industry by changing the way claims analytics are done. We are bringing bleeding-edge technologies to one of the world’s oldest industries.
Evolution IQ is developing a next-gen platform for the insurance industry. We develop machines with deep comprehension and vast data access to guide humans to the optimal decisions over large numbers of claims. Our training data includes all parts of historical insurance claims, as well as data we source externally. Our findings are presented in intuitive products to streamline the claim investigation process. The result is potential savings in the hundreds of millions, increased fairness and added precision to insurance pricing.
We’re working to make the insurance industry faster, fairer and cheaper for everyone.
Our Team
We are founded by a senior Google AI expert and a Bridgewater Associates Algorithmic Investor & Stanford MBA. We’re not looking for employees. We’re looking for partners in work, partners in culture-building, and partners in the future of data-driven insurance. The development team consists of world class engineers and leaders from companies like Google and Bloomberg. Each individual has had great success building large scale enterprise software and is now excited to try their hand at transforming the insurance industry.
Our investors include First Round Capital (seed investors in Uber, Square, Looker), FirstMark (Airbnb, Pinterest, Shopify) and Foundation Capital (Lending Club, CoverWallet, Netflix) and we have deep support within each of their organizations. You will also have full access to their networks and counterparts at portfolio companies for advice, ideas and community.

Your Role
Who are you? A machine learning engineer who wants to work in the areas of machine learning, natural language processing, information extraction, graph models, and AI architectures. You want to join a close-knit group and make a big impact. You thrive in an ambiguous environment and are intrinsically motivated and “just figure it out.” Be the technical owner of a new, complex machine learning project, working closely with Evolution’s ML product manager. Your mission starts with mapping out the opportunity and continues to launching a solution in production.
OutcomesWork with PM to map business requirements to a machine learning solutionIngest and clean raw client dataIntegrate into Evolution’s machine learning platformBuild, tune, evaluate models (create custom evaluation strategies)Reproduce ML prototype in a live production environment
Role CompetenciesWorks well with PM to map business requirements to ML architectures on a novel problemActed as owner of applied ML project from conception to shipping (1 or more)Acted as part of an ML team that shipped a productExpert developer who uses writes clean, efficient, easy to understand code with unit tests, functional design patternsExpert in Python 3 and Pandas or equivalent data manipulation libraryExpert data architect eager to solve complex, multi dimensional big data problems with advanced strategic leverage of databases, data assets and DAG pipelineExcellent document writing skills
Extreme creativity and resourcefulness, appetite to solve previously unsolved problems
OtherExtreme self-starter and self-motivatorHolds self to extremely high standards, and inspires others to do the sameOpen to giving and receiving critical feedbackBelieves in the mission of the company, cares about fundamental fairnessAble to handle the ups and downs of early startup lifeEnthusiasm for team work and pair workKind, empathetic, polite and professional

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionUnit Description:

Sodexo is seeking a Human Resource Specialist – Contact Center with our Corporate Human Resources Group. This position is based out of Cheektowaga, NY OR Maitland, FL office. This position will support the Monday through Friday shift from 9:30 AM - 6:00 PM (EST).
Reporting to the PeopleCenter Senior Manager, this position will manage a large variety of human resources questions with the ability to manage and resolve or escalate as appropriate in accordance with Sodexo policies and service level agreements.
Responsibilities are as follows:
Receives and manages large volume of diverse human resources requests through three primary contact channels (phone, email, and web-to-case)
Understands and communicates proper Sodexo policy and procedure to employees in spirit of timely and effective resolution
Manages service request assignments and identifies and escalates priority issues when necessary
Maintains a focus on customer service and company values through a commitment to customer service, dependability, and reliability.
Ensures proper service request documentation and management to ensure capture of all relevant information and integrity of case records
Maintains strict confidentiality for employee information
Applies up to date HR practices and guidance, strong written and oral communication, commitment to customer service and problem solving, as well as working well in a team-oriented dynamic.
Preference for bilingual candidates; the ability to speak Spanish language will assist in managing this workforce.
The ideal candidate will have the following preferred background/skill set:
2-4 years’ experience, preferred in Human Resources related field
Experience working in a virtual call center/contact center preferred but not required
Working knowledge of SLAs preferred
Experience working with large volume or transactional based requests by web, phone and email
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work individually and with others
Strong time management skills and ability to effectively resolve problems
Experience with Microsoft Office including Outlook, Word, Excel & Power-Point, Salesforce, ADP Enterprise HR (EV4)
Strong focus on customer service and demonstrated experience serving clients & customers
Learn more about Sodexo’s Benefits
Working for Sodexo:
How far will your ambition, talent and dedication take you? Sodexo fosters a culture committed to the growth of individuals through continuous learning, mentoring and career growth opportunities.

Position Summary:

Identifies and addresses human resources (HR) related questions, issues, and concerns from internal Sodexo customers. Ability to diagnose root HR issues and determine when and how to escalate within HR functional areas. Manages multiple lines of communication from the field (email, web, phone, and voicemail). Responsibilities include knowledge of phone and case management system, knowledge base portal, benefits toolkit, company policy manual and working knowledge of Ingenium, ADP, eTIME, EDW, payroll, PTO, and ER related areas.

Basic Education Requirement - High School Diploma, GED or equivalent

Sodexo is an EEO/AA/Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran employer.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout NYC Health + Hospitals

NYC Health + Hospitals/Bellevue is America’s oldest public hospital, established in 1736. Affiliated with the NYU School of Medicine, the 844-bed hospital is a major referral center for highly complex cases, with its 6,000 employees including highly skilled, interdisciplinary clinical staff. It sees more than 110,000 emergency room visits and 500,000 outpatient visits annually. Bellevue is an academic medical institution of international renown. We have served as an incubator for major innovations in public health, medical science, and medical education. Bellevue is a Level I Trauma Center delivering around-the-clock care in adult, pediatric, psychiatric and pediatric psychiatric emergencies as well as in the nationally-designated categories of cardiology, neurology, toxicology, and neonatology. In addition to providing comprehensive inpatient and outpatient state-of-the-art care Bellevue is a city-wide medical specialty referral source. Bellevue’s clinical centers of excellence include: Emergency Medicine and Trauma Care; Cardiovascular Services; Designated Regional Perinatal Center and Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (ICU); Comprehensive Children’s Psychiatric Emergency Program; and Cancer Services.

Job Description

Analyze and document program requirements and processes; articulate requirements to plan data collection methods and construct efficient work flows and other processes.
Interview end users and stakeholders to assess business and clinical needs; create business, functional, and technical requirements documents based on captured data and, in accordance with departmental protocols and standards.
Convert information gathered into specific details including data sources, data and user types, reporting needs and administrative system needs.
Provide program team with identified risks, concerns, and ambiguities discovered during the gathering of requirements; assist team in developing solutions.
Contribute to continuous process improvement and process optimization initiatives.
Contribute to cross-functional collaboration, decision making, and goal setting in assigned programs.
Administer data collection processes based on methods and work flows as established; coordinate data collection from secondary sources and other departments and operating units as necessary; resolve submissions of incomplete and/or inaccurate data sets, or escalate to supervisor as necessary.
Utilize effective controls and established methods to ensure accurate and complete collection and compilations of required data sets.
Utilize password protections, adhere to IT security and privacy standards, and meet regulatory requirements in compiling and patient related clinical data.
Suggests changes and additions to data capture and storage methods to supervisor.
Prepares requested data thoroughly and accurately for statistical analyses and required reporting.
Provides descriptive and analytical reports, including tables, graphs, and figures; adheres to deadlines for regular periodic reporting and fulfills ad hoc requests for targeted data requests and analysis.
Access and use appropriate data reporting functions of hospital's medical records system to modify and generate formatted reports and/or download data sets for subsequent analysis.
Accountable to troubleshoot and resolve apparent data reporting errors and discrepancies.
Organizes, manages and assures security of reports library.
Attend and complete training in medical records systems, software applications, and reporting programs as directed by supervisor and as necessary to fulfill the requirements of this position.
Complies fully with the hospital's Infection Control policies and protocols, emergency preparedness plans, fire/disaster plans, hazardous materials plans/SDS information sheets, and environmental care plans.
Adheres to the EPIC Cannon of Ethical Principles, NYS OMH regulations, and TJC standards, among other compliance, regulatory and legal requirements.
Completes other projects and tasks as assigned
Completes mandatory hospital wide and Psychiatry training and annual attestation by all program staff of NYS Justice Center Code of Conduct.
Minimum Qualifications

1. A Masters degree or advanced clinical degree from an accredited college or university; or
2. A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university and one (1) year of experience gathering and documenting business, clinical, and/or functional requirements for software applications development and implementation in a clinical, allied health, non-allied health, behavioral health, information technology, information services, business, analytics or related area; or, one (1) year of experience in a relevant clinical and/or healthcare administration role/function; or
3. A satisfactory combination of education, training, and experience.
4. Specialty certification(s) issued by a national commercially available program, state, professional society, academic or technical institution in an area(s) listed above, may be credited on a month-to-month basis toward the required work experience for a total of one (1) year.

Department Preferences

Demonstrate intermediate level expertise or higher primarily in Microsoft Excel spreadsheet software (including PivotTables and other advanced calculating data presentation functions).
Microsoft Office: PowerPoint, Visio, Word
Hands on experience with report writing software (e.g.Crystal Reports, database management and/or statistical software a plus.
Detail oriented and organized regarding timely collection and reporting of accurate, verificable date from multiple varied sources, e.g. medical records systems, paper reports, logs.
Understand calculations and appropriate applications of basic statistics.
Good communicator and presenter capable of working collaborarively with colleagues in positions of varied authority and discipline.
How To Apply

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

Job Description Summary

The Business Analyst is responsible for providing business process and system analysis, as well as scope definition for the Cushman & Wakefield Deal Management initiatives. Responsibilities include helping ensure the project team can efficiently deliver solutions to our internal clients that meet or exceed expectations.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities:
The Business Analyst will have the primary responsibility of helping to define and ensure that the Deal Management solutions support the stated objectives as defined in the program. As such, this individual will collaborate closely with the project team, respective stakeholders, and business subject matter experts to understand current business processes and translate new requirements into actionable solutions to achieve defined business unit business objectives, KPIs/success metrics.

The successful candidate will be collaborating with the business, program teams, and build team to define innovative technology solutions & process improvements to support business objectives, by clearly documenting business requirements, user stories, and/or use cases on paper and proof-of-concept configuration. A key focus of this role will be the deployment of new tools and processes into the business, and has such should be experienced in communicating with users to understand needs and convey requirements, constraints, benefits, etc. Specific responsibilities will include:

Work with the technology and operations teams to understand project objectives, priorities, timelines
Work with service lines and end-users to understand their business and champion solutions to meet their needs
Escalate risks, issues and roadblocks to the project team
Clearly document business and functional requirements
Define ‘as-is’ state for complex enterprise solutions, model ‘to be’ state, identify and assess gaps and propose improvements
Work with the business requesters to develop change, training and adoption strategies and tactics
Direct and participate in the creation of content (training materials, user communications, etc.)
Support internal reporting needs from the platform, and help identify data anomalies and deficiencies
Partner closely with program leadership to create executive briefings on key topics
Responsible for system control documentation.

Qualifications:
In light of the important role the Business Analyst will play at Cushman & Wakefield, we seek an outstanding talent who will bring strong analytical, communication and leadership experience along with the personal qualities well suited for the challenge. Specifically, the successful candidate should possess:

Functional Skills

Good technical or business foundation to include an undergraduate degree in a Business, Information Systems or a related field.
Critical thinker/problem solver with logical thought process
Strong communication skills, including presentation development and delivery
Strong cross-team collaboration skills
Strong attention to detail
Stakeholder communication and expectation management

Business Experience

The successful candidate must be comfortable juggling multiple assignments and possess the agility and tenacity to collaborate and deliver on tight timelines with aggressive growth objectives.
Past experience working in a customer-centric company is strongly preferred. With a commitment to putting the customer first and providing world-class solutions, the successful candidate would benefit from having exposure to a similar culture and business model.
10 years’ experience implementing and deploying outstanding end to end solutions, with strong bias to Salesforce Cloud

Personal Characteristics

Given the pace of change at the company, the successful candidate must be comfortable in a dynamic and fast-paced culture.
A strong service and delivery mentality is required. Candidate must actively seek to understand internal and external customers’ needs, perceptions, and show a “can do” attitude to make IT an enabling partner.
The successful candidate must have strong business acumen and intellectual curiosity. A passion for truly understanding the business and keeping it simple will be required to effectively integrate into the culture. An ability to translate client needs into the IT roadmap and strategy is critical.
Good collaboration skills are important. The successful candidate must be able to offer new ideas and help build support for making significant changes. Fostering an environment for open exchange, asking good questions, and listening to gain input and insight is expected.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills are integral for success. Candidate must be a clear and concise communicator and must effectively communicate at Managerial levels and cross-functionally.
Cushman & Wakefield provides equal employment opportunity. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job Description
Bachelor's Degree
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
3+ years relevant experience in financial/business analysis

The Campaign and Creative Services (CCS) Finance team is seeking an experienced Business Analyst based in New to support the Design Scaled Services (DSS) organization.

DSS supports designing all standard (GA) products, including static and dynamic banners, landing pages, brand stores, and advertisements running across all Amazon devices. Design scope includes production and design conceptualization work, inclusive of motion design. The team strives to continuously innovate on their processes across sites, enabling them to be the most scalable and customer centric design team. You will have the opportunity to design, collect, analyze and present findings to business partners to drive customer-centric change.

As a Business Analyst you will lead data collection and analysis for the organization across multiple product lines and geographies. Your work will have a direct impact on how business partners shape improvement initiatives to improve customer experience and operational efficiency. We have a great, diverse team that thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic, and innovative environment. We are looking for a new team member that brings a strong analytical skill set and is not afraid of new challenges.

Responsibilities include:

Own the design, development, automation, and maintenance of ongoing and ad-hoc metrics, reports, analysis, and dashboards to drive key business decisions
Work closely with leadership to identify key data for projects and extract and aggregate data from available data sources across Amazon into digestible and actionable formats
Coordinate with internal teams and stakeholders to understand reporting needs and deliver insights
Proactively identify opportunities for innovation and improvements by diving into operational metrics and campaign performance data
Design and influence operational best practices for reporting and analytics to enable the team to scale as we grow
Validating data to ensure accuracy in the output
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of SQL; basic knowledge of other programming language
Ability to synthesize data into written narrative and communicate findings to diverse audiences (e.g., technical, non-tech, executive); requires strong verbal and written communication skills with some experience facilitating discussions with both large and small audiences
Advanced knowledge of Excel is required, including use of lookups and pivot tables
Relevant work experience in an analytically oriented, data, or quantitative role e.g., business metrics reporting, finance, consulting, or marketing research
Robust quantitative and qualitative analytical skills with large data sets; understand the basics of both descriptive and inferential statistics
Ability to think out of the box to automate manual processes
Knowledge of QuickSight

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJob Summary:
This role will collaborate cross-functionally with the Business Operations team, the entire Disney Streaming Services organization, as well as groups & stakeholders from business units across The Walt Disney Company, to generate scalable, efficient, & replicable process improvements across the organization.

This individual will analyze existing processes, identify improvement opportunities, design new workflows, & define technical requirements for new systems, features, & integrations. The individual will also effectively track the execution, communicate the status, & help deliver on these multiple interconnected projects throughout the business. The successful candidate will blend strong business & process expertise with effective stakeholder management & communication skills.

Responsibilities:
PROCESS DESIGN & IMPROVEMENT

Assist with business process creation & optimization projects for the Business Operations group, working across the organization to help streamline our business process & ensure the continued successful launch of our products globally
Document data flows
Work with other business groups in performance analysis & identifying improvement areas, in order to ensure delivery & improvement of relevant KPIs
Work closely with product managers to ensure seamless integration of software solutions; Coordinate with stakeholders & users to gather detailed product integration requirements
Collaborate with Finance team to establish cost & efficiency measurements & create optimization plans
Work with data analytics team to ensure reporting for volume, efficiency & other relevant KPIs & metrics
Standardize request methods & build processes to enable self-service
Support program managers in setting up workflows for new projects & stakeholders.
Establish efficient standards & guidelines
Create, communicate & manage detailed project plans, dependencies, resource plans, schedules & deadlines
Partner with Disney Streaming Services Enterprise Program Management to effectively complement their efforts, closing gaps with minimal overlap, with a focus on managing projects from a Disney DTC service organization perspective
Build effective working relationships with the Disney DTC Marketing, Product teams to create high levels of visibility & predictability across all Disney DTC projects
Partner with the various TWDC business units in order to effectively track projects across those organizations that impact the Disney DTC service
Execute & deliver in a highly matrixed & distributed environments

BUSINESS OPERATIONS
Project management of initiatives including establishing project plan, tracking progress, & documenting milestones
Implementation & documentation of business processes across multiple stakeholders
Translate policies & key decisions to executive memos & process documentation to support a number of functions including customer service, legal, finance & marketing
Other duties as assigned & as necessary to support a growing operation & product launch schedule
Other business operations duties as assigned & as necessary to support a growing operation & product launch schedule

Basic Qualifications:
2-3 years in similar roles in technical, consumer facing environments with a digital marketing & process focus
Track record that shows you’re ready to excel in meeting the extraordinary challenges of this role
Proven experience in process optimization / transformation in order to increase process efficiency, reduce time-to-market & support scalability
Experience with Lean/Six Sigma methodology
Development & execution of project plans according to project methodologies
Great communication skills, able to work with, influence & align with multiple stakeholders
Strong business aptitude, clear thinking & communicating, & great decision making
Strong attention to detail
Expert knowledge to anticipate a wide range of future needs & opportunities & facilitate development of complex solutions
Creatively & collaboratively disruptive
Strong negotiation & issue resolution skills
Self-motivated, high-energy, tenacity
Ability to determine resource needs & recommend solutions

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout The Company:
Integra Partners is a leading Healthcare Benefit Management Company focused on community-based care. The Company’s expertise is in the Durable Medical Equipment, Orthotics, Prosthetics, and Medical Supplies space (DMEPOS). Working collaboratively with Health Plans, Plans Sponsors, and DMEPOS Providers, Integra facilitates care for hundreds of thousands of patients each year. We have experienced excellent growth and are looking for talented, service-oriented business professionals to continue building our high-performance organization and help fuel the Company’s next phase of growth.
Integra is an innovative company with an entrepreneurial culture focused on One Team that values each other and pushes the boundaries to drive results while having fun.
About the Position:
 The Business Analyst will support Operations analytics for Integra Partners. This person will develop, implement, and manage strategic Operations focused reporting, define business metrics, perform analyses, and measure progress against financial targets.
Responsibilities and Duties
Establish, build, update and manage standard assumptions in Operations analyses to support the overarching Finance Operations team objectives
Assist with setting and evaluating the company’s Claims strategy - evaluation of performance, ROI analysis, benchmarking, feedback from Operations
Design and build models to measure and analyze impacts at various collection points to support Finance Operations decisions
Provide support by developing client-specific reporting needs
Develop reporting to keep a pulse on improvement within operations metrics
Build and maintain a pipeline model to track all strategic initiatives
Engage in performance measurements and analysis by leading projects that will identify, evaluate, recommend and execute Operations improvement plans
Conduct detailed analysis on the costs per customer, product category, etc. versus planned levels and provide post-mortem performance summary, with performance improvement recommendations
Identify and recommend opportunities to improve financial performance (margin and profit) through the analysis of metrics/KPIs, market data, and customer trends
Demonstrate analytical insights and partner with business leaders to pursue growth opportunities and address areas of improvement by correcting underlying root-causes and contributing factors
Present findings on operations optimization topics to senior management, and develop an implementation plan
What will you learn in the first 6 months?
In the first 6 months, you will learn our claims submission processes, identify pain points, evaluate areas for improvement, determine how various systems impact claims submissions and collections, understand what helps improve collections, determine what can hurt collections, review workflows and claims assignment steps.
What will you achieve in 12 months?
Quantifiable improvements to our collections rate through initiatives led by this new hire
Design and implementation of operations improvement initiatives
Establish reporting to measure collections improvement projects
Establish reporting to track adherence to updated workflows
Required Experience:
Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
2-4 years of analytic and project management experience including consulting, finance, business decision support or strategy roles
Advanced Excel and PowerPoint are a must – Tableau, SQL, R, Python a plus
Strong verbal and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to present proposals to senior executives
Must be highly motivated, dependable, excel with verbal and written communication skills, and be able to work independently under pressure
Effective at summarizing complex operations and financial performance into actionable information, using MS Word, MS Outlook and MS PowerPoint as communication media
Experience applying analytics to complex business problems involving a wide array of data sets and conveying results, challenges, direction, and timelines to management
Knowledge and understanding of cost components and the ability to analyze the influence and implications of different variable/fixed/semi-fixed structure
Possess the willingness and ability to get beyond the obvious causes of outliers and poor performance, and investigate, identify, and correct the underlying root causes.
Comfort with ambiguity and ability to effectively multi-task, make tradeoffs, take initiative, and prioritize within a fast-paced, demanding environment
Efficient time and resource management skills to ensure that the service level provided exceeds expectations with a strong commitment to team success and team goals.
*** Please note applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future.
Benefits Offered
Competitive compensation and annual bonus program
401(k) retirement program with company match
Medical, Vision, and Dental benefits
Paid Time Off (PTO)
Paid company holidays and floating holidays
Quarterly company-sponsored events
Health and wellness programs
Career development opportunities
Our Story
Founded in 2005, Integra Partners is a leading health benefits management company specializing in Orthotics, Prosthetics, and Durable Medical Equipment. Our mission is to reduce friction in healthcare and we do so by working with medical equipment providers and health plans across the nation to deliver high-quality patient care.
With locations in New York City, Michigan, and a remote workforce across the United States, Integra has a culture focused on collaboration, teamwork, and our values: One Team, Drive Results, Push Boundaries, Value Each Other, and Have Fun. We’re looking for energetic, talented, and dedicated individuals to join our team. See what opportunities we have available; there may be a role for you to engage in a challenging yet rewarding career in healthcare. We look forward to learning more about you.
Integra Partners is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please don’t hesitate to reach out. We celebrate our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJOB TITLE: Business Analyst - Content

REPORTS TO: VP, Content and Product Strategy

JOB SUMMARY:

Bartleby is seeking a versatile Business Analyst to incorporate user and content analytics and insights into bartleby’s content and product ecosystem. The Business Analyst will play a key role in analyzing data from target consumer and subscriber behavior to uncover insights that optimize existing offerings and discover new ones. Applicants should pride themselves on their excellent communication and collaboration abilities and should share in bartleby’s mission to use technology and teaching experts in order to help students in high school and college succeed.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Perform data analysis of content used by our target consumer (college students) to more effectively serve them
Perform competitive analysis of digital learning tools and lead initiatives to benchmark bartleby offerings vs. competition
Participate in market research (quantitative and qualitative) initiatives to uncover and connect insights from the data with the voice of our target consumers
Collaborate with a cross-functional team in the development of new offerings and content tools
Find insights and strategies to help us continue to innovate in how we serve our audiences
Additional responsibilities as required
Complies at all times with the Standards, Policies and Code of Business Conduct and Ethics as outlined in the Employee Handbook

REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS:

BA/BS or equivalent work experience required
Has strong analytical and quantitative skills and the ability to extract, manipulate and analyze data
Brings strong business intuition to make sense of complex business data
Has proficiency in one or two data wrangling tools for tabular data, ideally SQL and Excel
Familiarity with Google Analytics and BigQuery
Shows attention to detail and the ability to gather requirements, plan an analysis and manage a project end-to-end
Has empathy to see things through the eyes of multiple stakeholders, such as prospective customers, content creators and faculty
Has excellent written and verbal communication skills to translate data analysis for non-technical audiences
Is curious, coachable, reliable, and driven for growth
Some experience in a consulting, product management or business/data analysis is ideal
Strong interpersonal skills and team player mindset; has the ability to influence and motivate others
Proven ability to think ahead, engage proactively and take initiative

KEY RELATIONSHIPS:

VP, Content Management and Operations
Director, Content Strategy
Manager, Content
Manager, Technical SEO
Manager, Product
Manager, Content Finance
Manager, BI
Manager, Marketing
