Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionResearcher – Business Intelligence
In this critical role on AlixPartners’ Corporate Services team, you will work closely with senior practice leaders as well as the Business Intelligence Center team. Your role will include providing strategic support on special projects and helping to deliver excellent service to our industries, communities and markets.
The Researcher – Business Intelligence (known internally as a Business Intelligence Specialist) is a full-time role located in Chicago, Illinois, Dallas, Texas or New York City, New York and reports to a Business Intelligence Director or Senior Vice President. Paid relocation is not available for this position.
Who We Are:
AlixPartners is a results-driven, global consulting firm that specializes in helping companies successfully address their most complex and critical challenges. You’ll play an integral role from day one, working alongside some of the most experienced practitioners in the industry, being recognized for your expertise and expanding your knowledge, with the freedom to chart your own career path.
Because we believe diversity is essential, we invite our people to bring their whole selves to work, contributing a wider range of insight, experience, and perspective. We want you to help shape the future of business with us. Are you ready to make a difference? More information is available at www.alixpartners.com.
Key Responsibilities:
Conduct research using various research tools including Capital IQ, Bloomberg, Factiva and Statista.
Perform analysis using various data sets and work with external research providers to ensure quality and timely delivery of financial, situation and performance analysis and research.
Provide support to Industry/Service offering teams to support new business opportunity identification/screening and track opportunities through closure.
Review connections to potential target clients and communicate results to consultants.
Support in developing client presentations to pitch for new business opportunities.
Provide ad hoc business development support and research assistance to the various communities.
Additional responsibilities as identified.
Qualifications/Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree required with strong preference for business/financial concentration.
Minimum 2 years of professional experience in a research role preferred, preferably in professional services or industry or Master's in Business Analytics
Financial acumen and ability to analyze company performance gained through undergraduate studies.
Experience with Retail or Private Equity a plus.
Strong analytical skills.
Adept at multi-tasking and working with multiple stakeholders.
Excellent PPT, Excel and research database skills are fundamental to success in this role.
Experience with programming, (python, alteryx), data visualization (Power BI, Tableau, and data management (SQL) a plus.
Database experience with Capital IQ, Bloomberg, Factiva and open sources are preferred.
Must be familiar with, and promote and abide by, all Firm values as defined by the AlixPartners’ Code of Conduct and in terms of Ethics, Diversity and Inclusion.
Ability to work full time in an office and remote environment; physically able to sit/stand at a computer and work in front of a computer screen for significant portions of the workday.
This description is not designed to encompass a comprehensive listing of required activities, duties or responsibilities.
In addition to a positive workplace, the firm offers a competitive compensation package including an excellent benefit program (health, vision, dental, disability, 401K, tuition reimbursement).
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, (age), status as a protected veteran, or disability. AlixPartners is a proud Silver award-winning Veteran Friendly Employer.

job_descriptions.a933bbb978402746:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionWe seek outstanding applicants for full-time researcher positions at Microsoft Research NYC. We are hiring in the areas of Computational Social Science; Economics and Computation and Microeconomics; Fairness, Accountability, Transparency, and Ethics in AI (FATE); and Systems. We seek junior as well as more experienced applicants, with the passion and ability to craft and pursue an independent research program. We encourage candidates with both theoretical and applied interests to apply. The earliest start date is July 1, 2020.

Microsoft Research NYC offers an exhilarating and supportive environment for cutting-edge research, both theoretical and applied, with access to an extraordinary diversity of big and small data sources, an open publications policy, and close links to top academic institutions around the world. We are particularly proud of the interdisciplinary work that MSR-NYC has been able to foster, and welcome applications from those interested in working across disciplines. For more information on the lab's members and their interests, see the lab's webpage.

As a community, we are committed to building an inclusive, diverse, and pluralistic research environment. We work collectively to make MSR a welcoming and conducive space for all researchers.

To be assured of full consideration, all application materials, including reference letters, need to be received by December 1, 2019. Applications received after that date may or may not be considered.

A complete application packet should include:
A cover letter, indicating the focus area(s) the applicant is relevant to, and emphasizing potential connections and synergies with the lab. 1-2 paragraphs usually suffice.
CV, which lists all peer-reviewed publications.
At least 3 reference letters (typically, one will be from your dissertation advisor)
Research statement (approximately 3-4 pages) that outlines your research achievements and agenda.
2 writing samples: conference or journal articles, book chapters, etc., that you are most proud of and which best demonstrate your expertise.

To get started with your application, press the “Apply now” button above. When prompted, provide names and contact information of your references. Upload your cover letter, research statement and the two writing samples as separate attachments. Remember to press the “Submit” button at the last screen.

After you submit your application, the system will send a request for letters to your list of referees on your behalf. Note: The application system will not request reference letters until after you have submitted your application. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance so that they will be ready to submit your letter by our application deadline of December 1, 2019. While you will not be able to view the letters themselves, you can check the status of individual reference requests within your application.
Responsibilities
As a researcher, you can define your own research agenda, driving forward an effective program of basic, fundamental, and applied research. In addition to driving your own research agenda, we highly value collaboration and building new ideas with members of your research group as well as others. You have the direct opportunity to realize your ideas in products and services used worldwide.
Qualifications
Required:
PhD in relevant field completed or close to completion.
A strong research program demonstrated by journal and/or conference publications
The ability to work in a highly collaborative and interdisciplinary environment
Strong communication skills

Preferred:
Demonstrable experience and leadership, such as service on conference program committees, workshop organization, teaching or tutorials, or outreach activities.
Strong computing skills (for CSS and Systems applicants)

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionApplied ML Researcher

Job Number: 3166657
POSTING DATE: Feb 17, 2021
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Development
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Vice President

DESCRIPTION
Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals.

As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back.

Technology

The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets.

Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients businesses and to our own.

Institutional Securities Technology (IST) develops and oversees the overall technology strategy and bespoke technology solutions to drive and enable the institutional businesses and enterprise-wide functions. Our clients include Fixed Income, Equities, Commodities, Investment Banking, Research and Global Capital Markets.

We are also responsible for Pioneer and Application Infrastructure groups that look to develop foundational strategies, tools and technologies that are leveraged across Technology, as well as standardized data and enterprise-wide services to provide leverage to the Firm's businesses.

Position Description:

Morgan Stanley's Machine Learning Center of Excellence is responsible for working with business units and technology teams across the firm to solve mission-critical problems. We are a highly motivated and collaborative team of scientists, technologists, and market practitioners.

We are seeking someone capable of independently tackling previously-unsolved research problems that have commercial applications.

Successful candidates will have a track record of exceptionally creative, hands-on, high-impact machine learning research and applications. We welcome candidates from both industry and academia, and at various levels of seniority, from Ph.D. students nearing graduation to established researchers. Broad experience across multiple fields is a plus

QUALIFICATIONS
Required:
Development experience in Python or R (C, C++, Java, etc is a plus)
Deep understanding of statistical learning methods
Strong communications and organizational skills
4+ years of applicable research experience
Bachelor's degree required, Ph.D. desired

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout the Company
Beyond Identity eliminates passwords and radically changes the way the world logs in without requiring organizations to radically change their technology stack or processes. By replacing passwords with fundamentally secure X.509-based certificates and enabling continuous, risk-based authentication, the company's patents-pending approach creates an extended Chain of Trust™ that dramatically improves security and provides a frictionless login experience. Beyond Identity’s cloud-native solution and advanced, standards-based architecture drastically reduces implementation time and costs–enabling customers to increase business velocity, implement new business models, and reduce operating costs.
Beyond Identity was founded by two industry titans (Jim Clark - founder of Silicon Graphics, Netscape, myCFO, Healtheon/ WebM; Tom “TJ” Jermulok - former COO/ President at Silicon Graphics and former General Partner at Kleiner Perkins) and is funded by leading investors, including Koch Disruptive Technologies and New Enterprise Associates (NEA).

About The Role
At Beyond Identity, the Product Design & UX (PDUX) team is a centralized group of designers and researchers who create user-empowering experiences based on data-driven decisions and vetted through a pragmatic design process. As one of the first dedicated user researchers to join the PDUX team, you will help establish and organize the user research function at Beyond Identity. In this startup environment, you will have the opportunity to design and conduct studies ranging from highly exploratory topics to low-level usability reviews. You will study the product space, seek out subject matter experts, and run studies, both qualitative and quantitative in nature.
Responsibilities
Work with the head of PDUX to identify potential opportunities and improvements across the product teams of Beyond Identity.
Partner with product managers, product designers, and product marketing managers to identify study opportunities for features in the exploratory stages of development.
Coordinate and conduct user research studies with end users, buyers, stakeholders, and subject matter experts as necessary.
Run multiple studies of varying scopes and/or topics, analyzing qualitative and quantitative data across IAM B2B and consumer spaces.
Share findings and insights regularly with Product and Engineering teams.
Create user research artifacts to promote user research and shared understanding, from user journeys and lifecycles to persona sets across the B2B and consumer landscapes.
Establish and maintain a user research cadence in collecting and analyzing user data and behavior through existing and new feedback channels
Covid-19 Note: This role is based in New York, NY where travel & commute are expected to resume when it is determined safe to do so. In the meantime, this role will be remote.
Qualifications
4+ years of user research and/or user experience roles using a blend of methods across:
User research interviews
Contextual inquiry
Usability testing
Customer satisfaction metrics
Surveys
User journey mapping
User behavior tracking software
Demonstrated in-depth understanding of user research methods and user behavioral trends across one or both of the following areas:
B2B Enterprise SaaS software
B2C Consumer
Proven record of conducting studies that led to new features and enhancements
Demonstrated execution of data analysis across qualitative and quantitative data sets
Strong collaborator with product design, data science, product marketing, and customer-facing functions such as customer support and sales.
Experience working and thriving in a fast-growth startup environment
Understand how to leverage experience and intuition while adapting to new situations
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Comfortable presenting your work to executive, technical, or customer-facing audiences

job_descriptions.0579f6aa23e740db:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionMany of the most pressing global policy challenges today have technical problems at their core (e.g. tech competition with China, AI infrastructure investment, global internet standards, and algorithmic fairness). Yet the top policy research groups and think tanks driving new policy ideas lack technical expertise on staff or within their networks. Solving these challenges requires technical insight, which can uniquely be produced by exceptional technical talent.

We are seeking “Computer Science + policy” researchers to help build a next-generation technical strategy group from the ground up to solve this by producing cutting edge knowledge products on tech strategy questions to drive decision making for policymakers and philanthropic investment.

This is a one-year position based in New York, NY with full-time salary and benefits. Researchers will be based in the Schmidt Futures offices in New York and be able to travel within the U.S. and internationally on a regular basis as needed.

As a Plaintext Researcher, you will:

Produce cutting edge research: Work with customers (i.e. decision makers in policy and philanthropy) to identify the most important topics for strategic analysis. Write the analysis itself with actionable outcomes in mind (e.g. policy proposals / grants / investments). Topics might include: tech competition with China, AI infrastructure, tech standards, algorithmic fairness.
Influence key decision makers and investments: We see direct impact through our grantmaking and extended network.
Work with the best people: Within both Schmidt Futures and our broader network we work with leading experts at the intersection of tech and policy. Leverage the broader network to build working groups of subject matter experts, run the working groups.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong technical literacy: Candidates must be fluent with a variety of computing topics. The role will not involve coding, so detailed knowledge at the implementation-level is not necessary, but researchers will need to “know what they don’t know” and who to ask about it. Comfort with data analysis is a plus. The technical expertise required is analogous to a product manager.
Strategic acumen: The ability to synthesize large amounts of raw information into actionable insights.
Exceptional written and spoken communication ability: Writing samples will be required in the application process.
Comfort in ambiguous unstructured environments: We are building a new form of organization. The environment is highly dynamic, and there are no precedents. Doing anything new comes with significant ambiguity and we want people that are excited by that environment and can thrive in it.
Project management: experience turning ambiguity into concrete tasks and delegating that out.
Experience applying metrics and objective-driven approach to solving problems: Comfort measuring outcomes, using OKRs etc.
Experience or strong interest working at the intersection of technology and the public interest sector.
Entrepreneurial mindset: Experience building something from the ground up (e.g. a club, a new team at their job, an event).

Requirements

Received a computer science degree or related technical degree at an accredited university.
Demonstrated interest or experience in projects at the intersection of technology and the social sector.

Who We Are

Schmidt Futures is a philanthropic initiative, founded by Eric and Wendy Schmidt, that finds exceptional people and helps them do more for others together. We knit talent into networks, bet on the most promising ideas through diverse forms of competition and support, and equip people to scale through partners and modern tools. To realize this vision, Schmidt Futures uses a broad set of tools — including gifts, grants, investments, and startup activity — for charitable, educational, and commercial efforts with a public purpose. Our initiative brings together the efforts of various charitable and non-charitable entities to improve our potential impact by making diverse types of capital available to the efforts we support.
job_descriptions.5c17d803f55edff7: Job detailsSalary$85,000 - $120,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeNumber of hires for this role1QualificationsBachelor's (Required)Full Job DescriptionPrincipal Research Analyst About Mumford Sole Partners Mumford Sole Partners is a New York City based research and advisory company dedicated to supporting companies make meaningful, measurable progress with digital transformation.Our mission is to support members of the Mumford Sole community by providing both big picture and immediately actionable insights based on independent, thoroughly researched content. We explore ideas, unpick challenges, and deliver perspective through conversations that cannot be had elsewhere.Our work culminates in events that are designed to exchange ideas and drive momentum for measurable organizational change. This happens in the form of personal ‘aha’ moments and through the regenerative effect of curated conversations with peers whose experience and ambitious goals are inspiring and transformative.We are looking to grow our research and content team in order to support the company’s growth of its existing offerings as well as to help us launch some exciting new things that we have in the pipeline.Our team is passionate in our mission. We are always looking for ideas from inside and outside of the company about how we can do this better and more effectively. It’s time for new approaches in the research market, and for building different types of community. We have a lot of experience and a strong record of being successful with research programs, and our goal is to build on what we know works. We are also designing a digital 21st century proposition delivering content for today’s consumers in the way they want to consume, and growing a thriving community that leverages human and digital best practice.The company’s culture is positive, open, supportive, enabling, and collaborative. Our philosophy is best summarized by the phrase ‘freedom within a framework’ there is plenty of leeway to exercise your full potential to help us creatively fulfill our mission. Bureaucracy is low and not welcome.Job Description Job Title Principal Research AnalystReports to Chief Content OfficerSalary $85,000 – $120,000 p.a. plus bonusLocation Home office (for now)Benefits Full healthcare package, 401k including company contributions, life insurance, etc.The primary aspect of the job is to lead the core research that we deliver to Mumford Sole clients. We aim to differentiate based on the quality of our content, which includes how well we address the research topics (the quality of our insights), and how effectively we communicate our insights. We do all this within schedules and timelines agreed upon ahead of time with clients.When we say that we are dedicated to supporting companies to help them make meaningful, measurable progress with digital transformation, that is exactly what we mean. The stable aspect of how we do this involves conducting research, writing reports, and holding events to gather the members of the Mumford Sole community to explore and digest the insights. However, we do not limit ourselves to delivering on our value proposition in that way. Our primary goal is to deeply understand the needs of our clients, to see the idiosyncrasies and the common challenges among them, and to deliver insights in the way that helps them to best make use of them. Often this involves thinking up non-traditional delivery methods—new tools, new content formats, new methods of distribution.Principal Research Analyst – Core Responsibilities Lead research studies with original Mumford Sole thought leadership and best practice (paper report + graphics + presentation + supporting models and frameworks)Produce, or manage production of lead-in and follow-on content from core research, including articles, sponsored white papers, podcasts, videos, subsidiary reports etc.Work with Mumford Sole editing and design partners to produce exciting and fresh representation of contentLead annual survey, including but not limited to interview design, digital publication, and follow-on deliverablesManage activities with third party vendors related to the aboveContribute to topic selection and general research directionRepresent the content team in supporting business developmentAssist in the role specification and hiring of new content team membersManage junior research and content team members, once hiredAssist in codifying smart Mumford Sole research approach and standards— we need these things to scale, but we are conscious of avoiding process for process’s sakeContribute to other projects and activities as they arise such as website design and evolution, content management processes and systemsWhat We Are Looking For Curiosity-driven researcher with experience conducting original researchBroad interest in the biggest issues facing business leaders todayA team player who can work comfortably with partners, clients, and with oversightAbility to identify the question behind the questionsAbility to see what is unresolved beneath conventional wisdomAbility to connect the dots using logic and evidenceWillingness to go beyond the typical sphere of knowledgeAbility to start from the foundation of our existing research and enrich/extend/update it in valuable waysIntellectual rigor—ability to explain why and to accept/reject ideas on solid logicStrong writing ability with a clear voiceCommunication skills—the ability to get complex ideas across in a digestible way (written and verbal)Strong relationship skillsAbility to separate ego from the work. We iterate quickly on every piece of content and a sense of personal detachment is critical to this process. We align as a team around prioritizing the best outcomes for our clients, which requires us to create and recreate and recreate ideas again. We differentiate on quality of our ideas and in the effectiveness of how we communicate them, which are both things that happen best as a team effort. We can push back and disagree, but things go smoothest when the pushback is about the idea and not about being defensive.Job Type: Full-timePay: $85,000.00 - $120,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k) matchingHealth insuranceLife insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payCOVID-19 considerations:We are working remotely at this time.Education:Bachelor's (Required)Work Location:One locationCompany's website:https://mumfordsolepartners.comBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionIntroduction
IBM Research Scientists are charting the future of Artificial Intelligence, creating breakthroughs in quantum computing, discovering how blockchain will reshape the enterprise, and much more. Join a team that is dedicated to applying science to some of today's most complex challenges, whether it’s discovering a new way for doctors to help patients, teaming with environmentalists to clean up our waterways or enabling retailers to personalize customer service.

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Research seeks a researcher to join our quantum computing team at IBM Thomas J. Watson Research Center in Yorktown Heights, NY.

IBM is developing a full-stack quantum computer, consisting of all relevant hardware and software solutions. We are looking for a researcher to join the Compilers team (broadly interpreted to include quantum algorithm design, quantum circuit synthesis, quantum circuit optimization, quantum circuit placement/scheduling, libraries), a key area in finding the most efficient ways to utilize our quantum computational hardware. Fruitful collaboration with other members of the team is expected.

This position is located in the Yorktown Heights, NY area.




Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Graduate degree in Physics or Electrical/Hardware Engineering
Familiarity with or interest in quantum computing;
A proven record of achievements in research or coding.
At least 2 years of experience in quantum computing



Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

At least 5 years research experience in Physics/Hardware Engineering, Quantum computing device fabrication and test
Proven record of research and development

About Business Unit
IBM Quantum is an industry first initiative to build universal quantum computers for business, engineering and science.

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement
IBM intends this job to be performed entirely outside of Colorado.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.
job_descriptions.7a2471eda24efeb3:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionThe Information is seeking an editor to oversee our new Opinion section and related projects, editing leading entrepreneurs, executives, and thinkers of our day on technology, business, and media topics.

This person will also play a key role in a series of new yet-to-be-announced products that curate high quality opinion and analysis for our readers.

Our Opinion editor will shape the conversation around the most complex and important issues in business, science, and policy. It’s a chance to edit some of Silicon Valley’s luminaries, as well as to highlight the work of lesser-known voices—and join a team of highly experienced and talented journalists.

Our goal is through Opinion pieces to surface for our readers the conversations we hear executives having with colleagues and competitors, and connect the dots on emerging issues. The Information’s subscribers include decision-makers at many tech, finance, entertainment, and media organizations.

The ideal candidate will have a deep knowledge of technology and business, and connections to the companies, executives, entrepreneurs, funders, researchers, and thinkers driving the industry. He or she will also have extensive editing experience, and having worked on Opinion pieces is a plus. This role requires real persistence and organization and an interest in rolling up your sleeves to work through ideas and copy.

This is an opportunity to join the growing team of journalists at The Information, who cover what’s important in tech and media for a discerning audience. Founded in 2013, The Information has attracted tens of thousands of paying subscribers—putting the business on firm footing. Our subscribers include some of the most influential people on the planet. Our editing team includes alumni of the Wall Street Journal, Bloomberg and the New York Times.

We strongly encourage people from traditionally underrepresented communities to apply, particularly people of color. We are committed to diversity and to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and ages.

Benefits

Company-paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their dependents
Basic life insurance
Generous paid leave that increases over time
A parental leave policy for new parents
401(k)
Flexible Spending Account
Commuter benefits
A gym and fitness stipend
A highly professional, inclusive, diverse workplace with a zero-tolerance policy for harassment
job_descriptions.188af589e05ad239:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionFULL-TIME JOB VACANCY
SENIOR RESEARCHER ON THE RIGHTS OF OLDER PEOPLE

Location Flexible
Application Deadline: March 18, 2021

Human Rights Watch ("HRW") is seeking applicants for the position of Senior Researcher on the Rights of Older People. This position will be responsible for leading our research and advocacy strategies on the human rights of older people. The location is flexible, with a preference for one of the following HRW offices: New York, Washington DC, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Toronto, Sao Paulo, London, Brussels, Berlin, Johannesburg, Nairobi, or Beirut.

Due to COVID-19, many of our global offices are currently closed or operating in reduced capacities. The successful candidate may be required to work remotely until our offices fully re-open. We recognize that this moment, during the pandemic, is a uniquely difficult time for most people, particularly those with caregiving responsibilities, and we aim to be as flexible and supportive as possible in both the recruitment for and onboarding of this position.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Lead Human Rights Watch's work on the rights of older people, through research, advocacy, partnerships, external representation, and internal collaboration.

2. Research, monitor, and document human rights abuses against older people around the world by collecting and analyzing information from a wide variety of sources including victims, witnesses, journalists, diplomats, governments, local media, NGOs, and others.
3. Write and publicize in-depth analytical research reports, briefing papers, letters, news releases, op-eds, and submissions to international bodies.
4. Develop and implement innovative and impactful advocacy strategies to advance the human rights of older people in specific countries and globally.
5. Prepare, in collaboration with HRW's Communications team, compelling multimedia products to advance advocacy on the rights of older people.

6. Respond promptly to queries from the media, government officials, and external partners.
7. Work closely with non-governmental organizations (NGOs); international organizations; and other partners to ensure that HRW's work on older people complements and enhances their own work.
8. Travel to different countries around the world to conduct on-the-ground fact-finding missions, and advocacy, representational or fundraising activities.
9. Develop the knowledge and capacity of colleagues in our programmatic, communications, advocacy, and fundraising departments to advance the rights of older people.

10. Support fundraising efforts.
11. Carry out other duties, as required.


MANAGERIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. Establish clear work plans for any staff or consultants and communicate priorities clearly and effectively. Provide oversight and take responsibility for assignments delegated to others.
2. Operate in compliance with organizational regulations and rules, including the policies of applicable employee agreements.
3. Ensure that the workload of any staff and consultants are manageable.
4. Manage and guide staff by listening, having two-way communication, sharing pertinent information, responding appropriately, and delegating appropriate responsibilities.

5. Provide appropriate and timely feedback on staff performance and provide guidance, coaching and training, as necessary.

Qualifications

We are eager to hear from candidates who can perform the essential functions of this role even if they do not meet all of our desired qualifications – particularly if they are from backgrounds underrepresented in the human rights field.

Education: An advanced (graduate) degree in international relations, journalism, law, social sciences, or related studies is required.

Experience: Minimum seven years of relevant experience in human rights research and advocacy is required.

Related Skills and Knowledge:
1. Demonstrated knowledge of key issues and major developments concerning the rights of older people in specific country and regional contexts, as well as globally, is required.

2. Demonstrated leadership in advancing the rights of older people through human rights research and advocacy is required.

3. Ability to regularly conduct rigorous fact-finding research in a wide range of geographic, cultural, and other settings is required. Sensitivity to conduct interviews with a range of people, including victims and witnesses of human rights abuses, is required.

4. Ability to efficiently analyze large amounts of research and information about the rights of older people and identify trends and strategic priorities is required.

5. Ability to identify, develop and implement effective and impactful national, regional and global advocacy strategies on the rights of older people is required.

6. Ability to engage strategically and innovatively with global and local media to further advocacy goals is required.
7. Ability to demonstrate leadership within HRW to advance the capacity and knowledge of others in the organization to contribute to research and advocacy on the rights of older people.

8. Strong initiative and follow-through, the capacity to think creatively and strategically, excellent writing and editing skills, and a dynamic public speaking ability are required.
9. Knowledge of and familiarity with international human rights law is required.
10. Excellent oral and written communication skills in English are required; proficiency in another language is highly desirable.
11. Strong interpersonal and leadership skills in order to work collaboratively within HRW, as well as with external partners, are required.
12. Ability to multi-task, work effectively under pressure, plan, and organize effectively are required.
13. Experience in fundraising, including communicating effectively with existing and prospective donors, preparing donor proposals and reports, and identifying potential donors is desirable.

Salary and Benefits: HRW seeks exceptional applicants and offers comprehensive compensation and benefits. HRW offers a relocation assistance package and will assist employees in obtaining necessary work authorization, if required; people of all nationalities are encouraged to apply.

How to Apply: Please apply immediately by visiting our online job portal at careers.hrw.org and attaching a letter of motivation and CV, preferably as PDF files. No calls or email inquiries, please. Only complete applications will be reviewed and only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

If you are experiencing technical difficulties with your application submission, please email recruitment@hrw.org. Due to the large response, application submissions via email will not be accepted and inquiries regarding the status of applications will go unanswered.

Human Rights Watch is strong because it is diverse. We actively seek a diverse applicant pool and encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply. Human Rights Watch does not discriminate on the basis of ability, age, gender identity and expression, national origin, race and ethnicity, religious beliefs, sexual orientation, or criminal record. We welcome all kinds of diversity. Our employees include people who are parents and nonparents, the self-taught and university educated, and from a wide span of socio-economic backgrounds and perspectives on the world. Human Rights Watch is an equal opportunity employer.

Human Rights Watch is an international human rights monitoring and advocacy organization known for its in-depth investigations, its incisive and timely reporting, its innovative and high-profile advocacy campaigns, and its success in changing the human rights-related policies and practices of influential governments and international institutions.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeContractFull Job DescriptionEngineering
Web
The Freemium R&D team oversees the entire user journey on Spotify and ensures we engage with people in innovative ways, every step of the way. Our team grows Spotify’s audience by finding future listeners around the world and delivering the right value to them, at the right time. With research, product development, product design, engineering, and marketing all collaborating in one organization, we’re able to quickly create meaningful features and services for millions of people around the world, resulting in joyful, long-lasting relationships with Spotify.
Location
New York, NY
Job type
Full Time Contractor
Growth Opportunities is an R&D department of Spotify that focuses on new users, new markets, and new experiences. The squad strives to grow Spotify’s user base via organic search traffic by crafting a technical foundation, new content experiences, and evangelism for the wider web community.
We are an autonomous growth product team, proactively finding opportunities to drive MAU (monthly active users) and captivate our users' attention by bringing awareness, engagement with our brand.
Our work is experimental in nature, where the engineering team is responsible for building outstanding technical solutions and is also deeply involved in the ideation part of the process. We work closely with user researchers, data scientists, and designers to build hypotheses around opportunities related to specific cultures, regions, or markets. These hypotheses are tested by building A/B tests and prototypes and rolling it out to our millions of users.
We are looking for a thoughtful, well-rounded web engineer to join our team and help build web properties millions of people use every single day to discover and listen to music and podcasts. You will join in a healthy and high-performing team, continuously improving our engineering practices, delivering state-of-the-art technology while keeping it fun.
Above all, your work will change the way the world experiences audio.
What you'll do
Work across the entire web stack, with modern web frameworks (Next.js, React and Node.js), distributed computing and public cloud platforms (GKE)
Ideate and implement technical SEO foundations
Build top of funnel user experiences to drive sign-ups and activate users
Scale up others’ skills and provide mentorship along the way
Evangelize SEO for the wider web community and guide other Spotify teams to help them improve their visibility on Search Engines through SEO
Who you are
Passionate about software engineering best practices and love to have an impact on a large-scale tech problem
Have 3+ years experience in software development
Have a background in building web products at scale and experience working in a high-growth tech company on a consumer-facing product
Have an intermediate to sophisticated understanding of JS concepts and web architecture patterns
You have a quality approach, delivering high-quality products and supporting others to maintain a high standard
Comfortable working collaboratively on a cross-functional team and reaching out and working with different squads.
You enjoy learning as well as mentoring and passionate about your work, aspiring towards the goals of the team and, ultimately, the Spotify mission - “giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the opportunity to enjoy and be inspired by it"
Where you'll be
We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them!
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the Americas region in which we have a work location
Prefer to work in an office environment? Prefer to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here.
Working hours? We operate within the Central Eastern time zone and Eastern Standard time zones for collaboration.
Perks of being in the band
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.
Learn about life at Spotify
You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 345 million users.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeContractFull Job DescriptionKepler Fi is the independent, radical innovation arm of one of the world's largest sovereign wealth funds, focused on moonshots within institutional asset management. We perform strategic investments, joint ventures, and internal development of ambitious ideas to transform the asset management space.

We are looking for a Senior Quantitative Researcher with Machine Learning (ML) expertise to provide technical oversight of a radically innovative machine learning driven investment platform. The goal is to develop strategies mimicking Fundamental investors' mindset and approaches.

This role is a great opportunity for an experienced individual with an entrepreneurial mindset looking to leverage their quantitative and machine learning skills to build out new strategies inspired by Fundamental heuristics and investment approach.

This is a FULL TIME CONTRACT-TO-HIRE opportunity.

Responsibilities:

The Senior Quantitative Researcher will focus on the integration and analysis of quantitative and fundamental data in the production of investment recommendations and portfolio risk management
Codify Fundamental investment heuristics and approaches
Build data ETL pipelines, robust machine learning systems to support the quantification of Fundamental investment processes
Apply ML techniques in a multi variables and multi-steps framework to forecast financial statements' line items to derive the intrinsic value of a stock
Adapt ML techniques and apply them to replicate long-term fundamental investing approaches

Must Haves:

10+ years of quantitative research experience in investment management industry
Advanced knowledge of Machine Learning
Practical application of ML concepts within finance industry
Strong verbal and written communication skills in order to present findings to larger team
Proven track record of academic and/or professional achievement

Nice to Haves:

Quantitative Research experience on the Buy-Side
Experience managing large institutional portfolios
Knowledge of fundamental investing principles

So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionCompany Description
Publicis Media is one of Publicis Groupe’s four solution hubs, aligning all of Publicis Groupe’s media agencies and operations. Publicis Groupe (Euronext Paris Exchange: FR0000130577; CAC 40 index), is the world’s third largest communications group. The Data, Technology and Innovation Global Practice was created to deliver best-in-class programmatic solutions as well as to consolidate Publicis Media’s data and technology to transform our business from a service business to a platform business.

Job Description
Do you love people, psychology, design, data and combining it all with your UX design and research chops? Our growing Product Design team is seeking a full-time User Experience Researcher with a passion and hands-on ability to help turn complex industry challenges into useful, usable and desirable advertising technology experiences. You will work along a smart, passionate, and empathic team to concept and design industry-changing digital products that enable our agency teams to win in a very competitive marketplace.
A successful candidate will be curious, creative innovative with a zest for problem solving and ongoing learning and growth.
Role Objectives:
Conduct, collect and analyze user behavior through concept testing, usability tests, user surveys and interviews, benchmark studies, competitive analyses and A/B testing.
Work with Product Designers, Product Managers, Data Scientists, Engineers and other key stakeholders to prioritize and conduct research opportunities in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into research and project planning.
Test product and/or feature requirements and synthesize these into a concise document to help drive direction, scope and purpose.
Collaboration, Communication and Process
Play an active part in the creation and refinement of UX research processes, deliverables and capabilities.
Be able to effectively communicate and articulate ideas and concepts, while also being open to receiving feedback and direction
Embraces and encourages a culture based on team work, collaboration, and intellectual curiosity
Assist in educating other team members

Qualifications

3-5 years of experience as a User Researcher (or Equivalent) conducting user research such as surveys, user testing, A/B testing and competitive analysis.
Strong business acumen: the ability to relate, understand, grasp concepts, and interpret client/user needs.
Ability to develop surveys, polls and other methods to allow for actionable insights and optimization to occur
Demonstrated experience in understanding and solving for usability problems
Capability to write effective surveys, polls, research scripts that elicit insights
Proficiency in Powerpoint & Excel.
Ability to work with minimal supervision on multiple concurrent projects
Strong ability to work independently as well as in groups
Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionCondé Nast is a global media company producing the highest quality content with a footprint of more than 1 billion consumers in 32 territories through print, digital, video and social platforms. The company’s portfolio includes many of the world’s most respected and influential media properties including Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler/Traveller, Allure, AD, Bon Appétit and Wired, among others. Condé Nast Entertainment was launched in 2011 to develop film, television and premium digital video programming.
Job Description
The New Yorker is seeking a UX Writer to design the voice of its digital products, including the Web site and native mobile applications.
In this role, you will help guide readers through The New Yorker’s online offerings, including audio, puzzles, games, and, of course, their next great read. As a member of the brand’s Product Design team, you will partner closely with designers and UX researchers, as well as cross-functional teams, to develop a deep understanding of New Yorker readers, facilitating the onboarding of new visitors and building upon relationships with loyal subscribers. As the brand invests heavily in digital experiences, you will balance its foray into the twenty-first-century media landscape with the need to remain true to the voice of The New Yorker .
This role will report to The New Yorker’s UX Writing Lead, who oversees the voice of the brand’s digital products, and will coördinate with Web and copy editors on the Editorial team.

Responsibilities include:
Serving as a steward of The New Yorker voice, promoting consistency with its house style guide and evolving its UX writing style guide
Owning the voice of various New Yorker digital products, including language in the interface, product names, documentation, and more
Building and maintaining close collaborative relationships with designers, researchers, product managers, engineers, marketers, support representatives, and editorial colleagues
Aligning our content strategy with the user experience, working cross-functionally to help identify the value propositions, product designs, channels, and targeting that resonates most with readers
Articulating decisions to stakeholders across departments, and providing feedback in return
Identifying opportunities to use data, testing, and research to validate and improve your work
Advocating for UX writing across The New Yorker and the broader design community
The ideal candidate has:
A finely tuned ear for the English language and rigorous attention to detail, ideally with a background in editorial or copy editing
3+ years of experience designing the voice of digital products, with an understanding of the nuances of Web versus mobile experiences
An understanding of product development and design processes, and how UX writing fits in
The ability to design systems of language, creating a consistent user journey
Experience with design tools, preferably Figma
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written), with the ability to define and defend the rationale behind decisions
Familiarity with the history, style, and values of The New Yorker

A note: research indicates that women and individuals from marginalized groups tend to apply only when they meet all of the criteria. If you believe you’re qualified, but don’t necessarily check every box, please submit an application.
About The New Yorker
The New Yorker is a multi-platform media enterprise, spanning print, digital, audio, video, and live events. Founded in 1925, The New Yorker is considered by many to be the most influential magazine in the world, renowned for its in-depth reporting, political and cultural commentary, fiction, poetry, humor, and cartoons. In addition to the weekly print magazine, The New Yorker has become a daily digital destination for news and cultural coverage, crafted by its staff writers and other contributors. In print and online, The New Yorker stands apart for its commitment to truth and accuracy, the quality of its prose, and its insistence on exciting and moving every reader.
What happens next?
If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply below, and we will review your application as soon as possible. You can update your resume or upload a cover letter at any time by accessing your candidate profile.
Condé Nast is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status and other legally protected characteristics.
job_descriptions.a022266b067380d7:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAt Marketcast, we believe in the power of fandom. Whether you’re a gaming company creating your next must-play game, a studio developing the next blockbuster, a streamer changing the game, or a beverage brand seeking to disrupt the grocery aisle, we deliver data-driven research and insights to move the needle.
As a truly full-service agency – research, insights, tracking, social, data science and more – we are perfectly positioned to solve unique (and fascinating) business challenges. We’re looking for passionate, curious, hungry people to join the team and help change the world – one research question at a time.
We’re looking for:

Someone who is excellent at managing insights projects from start to finish.

Folks who can see data and tell a story; who know how to find actionable insights and know how to move beyond a ‘he said, she said’ reporting approach.

Someone who can lead and mentor a team on every stage of the research process – who is both generous as a leader and not afraid to roll up their sleeves and jump in.

Someone with experience in pushing every aspect of the work to get the very best out of the process – leaving no stone unturned and no insights story untold.

Practitioners who love the work, and also want to build client relationships.

Team players – we are stronger together – we like to work in groups.

Creative thinkers – if you come bursting with ideas, can see patterns in data, and know how to inspire this in others, we’re excited to talk!

Curious minds, especially when it comes to people and what makes them tick.

Strategic brains – we're problem solvers – harnessing the core question, bringing to life the research narrative, having an eye on the detail, and understanding the big picture are all musts.

Strong communicators – written and verbal. Being able to find the right words to articulate the question, the story, and everything in between perfectly, is a really big deal for us.

Someone interested in either the Entertainment landscape, the Tech world or the universe of Lifestyle Brands – we work with some of the biggest names in each category.

It’ll be helpful if you have:

At least 7yrs experience in custom / ad hoc research – we dig templated projects, love tracking, but in this group, we're all about the unique business questions, so custom experience is key.

At least a Batchelor’s degree in the Social Sciences, Economics, Business, Marketing, Statistics or related fields. Masters and Ph.D.s are great too!

A pretty good handle on Microsoft Office. We use it a lot.

A desire to live in LA or New York – that's where we’ll be back to, when we can.

Qual or Quant?

If you are a Qual practitioner, we’d expect you to have mastered and be great in all aspects of Qual project design, moderating and analysis. We're looking for masters of the methodology, able to bring to life the insights through talking to people.

For Quant practitioners, we’re looking for folks who excel in all areas of quant practice from survey design to data analysis, able to tell the story with actionable outcomes. (Also, if you know how to do a segmentation or a conjoint, we’re going to be super pumped).

Are you a true hybrid? Awesome – don't be shy, tell us all about focus groups and survey design.

Benefits and Perks:

Medical, Dental, Vision
401(k) with company match
Freedom Leave
Wellness plan and events
And, more
Our purpose:
Fandom connects people with shared passions and builds communities around them. It offers them space to express their joy and love, whether that’s for superheroes, sports teams, or even small batch whiskeys.
At MarketCast, we believe in the power of fandom. It’s as important for brands as it is for action heroes.
And, we do fandom research, data science and analytics better than anyone on the planet. This obsessive focus on fans helps the world’s top creators, media platforms, and sports leagues transform followers into fanatics and investments into impact.
Our Values:
Curiosity Makes Us Tick
Our love of learning manifests in everything we do - from the surveys we field and the datasets we analyze to the technology we develop. Where others pause, we push forward, uncovering hidden meaning and answers. Always learning, always looking for more.
Reward the Hustle
We attract and cultivate talent who roll up their sleeves and get things done, no matter the task, timeline or challenge. In return, we recognize and reward their performance and commitment. It’s an approach that keeps our teams tight, hands-on, and consistently delivering.
Trust is Everything
Our research and perspectives move markets, fuel creative decisions and impact millions of fans daily. This kind of influence requires trust and responsibility, something bestowed on us by our clients. It is earned, honored, and never taken for granted.
Value the What and the How
It’s not enough to be exceptional in your role if you can’t play well with the team. We honor great work by looking at what is accomplished and how we work together to achieve results. This ensures great performance never comes at the cost of behavior that can harm our culture.
Diversity will be Our Superpower
Our differences make us stronger. As researchers and data scientists, we have a responsibility to reflect the diverse audiences and communities all around us. Understanding people, opinions and life experiences fuels our insights and deepens our perspectives.
At MarketCast, we don't just accept difference - we embrace it, support it, and thrive on it for the benefit of our global culture and success. MarketCast is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
CCPA NOTICE: In accordance with the California Consumer Privacy Act, please note that we collect some or all of the below categories of personal information from you as part of the application process and use it for the purposes indicated. Category of Personal Information: 1. Name, Contact Information (phone, email, address) Purpose: To be able to contact you 2. Information on work history and education Purpose: To be able to assess qualifications for the role 3. Race/ethnicity information (optional) Purpose: To comply with governmental reporting obligations 4. Veteran and military Status (optional) Purpose: to comply with governmental reporting obligations
job_descriptions.64b4f42db81a9a51:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionYour role

Are you detail-oriented multitasker? Do you know how to make sure things run smoothly?

We’re looking for an Executive/Team assistant to:

manage calendars including conference calls, vacations and client meetings
provide backup support to current admins and support the Chief Investment Office (CIO) head in the Americas
arrange travel bookings, itineraries and visa coordination
support office administration, like ordering supplies, handling mail and managing conference logistics
coordinate the production of presentation books and reports, meeting prep packets etc.
assist with finance management, including processing of invoices and expenses
assist the business management team with coordination tasks such as onboarding and off-boarding of employees
assist Fixed Income/Sustainable Investing teams with support as it relates to creating spreadsheets, researching topics, creating charts for research publications
look for opportunities to improve and stream line current processes

Your team

The CIO team was established in 2006, CIO GWM draws upon financial market analysis from investment specialists around the world and is responsible for the investment strategy for all UBS Wealth Management clients. Since inception, CIO GWM has been a key part of UBS GWM's aim to bring institutional quality advice to our private wealth clients. UBS CIO GWM's global network of approximately 160 researchers, strategists and economists covering key markets and asset classes support this process. You’ll be working in the Chief Administration Organization (CAO) within the Chief Investment Office (CIO). CIO is a global team. The CAO team is a team whose main responsibilities are ensuring the day to day business runs smoothly. This includes but is not limited to functions pertaining to Legal, Compliance, Human Resources, Production of research, distribution of research, social media, internal and external technology platform support to name a few.

Your expertise


successful administrative experience in a fast-paced large enterprise
proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
keen attention to detail, organized and able to seamlessly multitask
proven written and verbal communication skills
comfortable interacting with colleagues at all levels
flexible, adaptable, can-do attitude
open to leaning and helping all individuals on the team

About us

Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?

Join us

job_descriptions.ee90eb8baf0dac45:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout Ipsos

Ipsos is the world’s third largest market research company, present in 90 markets and employing more than 18,000 people. Our passionately curious research professionals, analysts and scientists have built unique multi-specialist capabilities that provide true understanding and powerful insights into the actions, opinions and motivations of citizens, consumers, patients, customers or employees. We serve more than 5000 clients across the world with 75 business solutions.

Founded in France in 1975, Ipsos is listed on the Euronext Paris since July 1st, 1999. The company is part of the SBF 120 and the Mid-60 index and is eligible for the Deferred Settlement Service (SRD). ISIN code FR0000073298, Reuters ISOS.PA, Bloomberg IPS:FP www.ipsos.com


Senior Researcher

The Senior Researcher demonstrates mastery of UX research skills and manages projects from initial client objectives, to identifying an approach, to project execution, analysis, delivery, and presentation to the client. They perform these activities with autonomy, skill, and competency for communication with clients. This position is responsible for a mix of research and design consulting projects and leads client interactions and engagements. The Senior UX Lead Researcher is also responsible for training Researchers and Lead Researchers to deliver client objectives.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND Responsibilities

The Senior Researcher manages and owns core project activities. They are expected to lead all aspects of projects, including preparation, data collection, analysis, and report/deliverable creation. The Senior Lead Researcher plays an active role in training and mentoring their Researcher & Lead Researcher colleagues on project work and through other team engagements—frequently serving as a formal mentor to more junior Researchers. They demonstrate efficiency in complex UX activities and use non-project related time to produce original thought leadership and activate/lead other internal initiatives. Senior Lead Researchers may specialize either in industry or methodology/technique and utilize their expertise to support the larger team. They play a leadership role in project work and internal team initiatives and consistently find ways to add value and innovation to the team.

EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS
Strong decision-making skills and flexibility to adapt to client needs
Solid experience with managing, clients, stakeholders, and/or cross-team collaboration internal/external
Project management expertise with the ability to oversee all aspects of project execution and the project team
Demonstrated ability to manage a variety of project types and apply different UX techniques
Demonstrated competence in sales activities such as proposal writing and bidding with oversight of a Director or senior leader.
3-5 years of experience in User Experience or a related field (e.g. qualitative or quantitative research), required.
5+ years of experience in User Experience research or design is highly preferred. Agency/consulting experience preferred.
Purpose of the Role
The Senior Researcher demonstrates mastery of UX research skills and manages projects from initial client objectives, to identifying an approach, to project execution, analysis, delivery, and presentation to the client. They perform these activities with autonomy, skill, and competency for communication with clients. This position is responsible for a mix of research and design consulting projects and leads client interactions and engagements. The Senior UX Lead Researcher is also responsible for training Researchers and Lead Researchers to deliver client objectives.
SPECIFIC Responsibilities

Lead large teams and complex projects with senior leader oversight.
Ability to translate research objectives to proposed methodologies and help clients define needs and propose solutions
Act as a leader in preparation activities, including logistical planning, screener development, recruiting and facility vendor management, discussion guide development, and piloting activities.
Autonomous execution of client deliverable to include data collection and moderating session, interview activities, analysis, and report creation.
Produce final client deliverables including design creation, recommendations, justifications, and final deliverable support.
Engage in client business development work by supporting a Director or senior leader.
Lead/support bids and proposals with oversight of a Director or senior leader.
Manage set budget with senior lead, including time management of their project team members and budget accountability with their project manager or senior leader.
Produce thought leadership pieces, internal trainings and support Senior Leadership in executing internal initiatives.
EDUCATION
Bachelor’s degree or higher in human factors, HCI, behavioral sciences or equivalent experience, including Bachelor's in Fine Arts (BA), preferred

Ipsos’ Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

Ipsos recognizes the necessity of building an inclusive culture that values each employee’s individuality and diverse perspectives. For more than 40 years, our mission has been to generate and analyze data about society, markets, brands, and behaviors to provide our clients with the insights that elevate their understanding of the world. This could not be fulfilled without Ipsos’ diverse employees who compile and analyze this data—they are the essence of who we are and what we do.

We are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees, creating an environment that promotes inclusion, and allowing employees from all walks of life to flourish. Ipsos encourages our employees to act in a respectful and responsible manner, in line with codes of best practices concerning diversity and inclusion, human rights, equality, and civility for every individual.

Ipsos is An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other protected class and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Required Skills

Required Experience

Based in Hicksville, NY, the company conducts pioneering research for diagnostic services. We employ NGS, targeted PCR, LC-MS/MS, enhanced microbiology techniques and algorithm-based software to develop new diagnostic solutions.The Molecular Research Scientist is a core member of the R & D team that will develop new diagnostics within a highly dynamic team environment. We are looking for researchers that apply scientific rigor, creative thinking, disciplined experimentation, and an enthusiasm for learning. Job detailsSalary$69.35 an hourJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionOur Customer’s mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through their family of apps and services, they are building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together.

Wearable location products are part of the AR Spark team within the Social Media Reality Labs organization, tasked with defining and building new products and technologies powered by location for emerging wearable devices for AR/VR, as well as various social media platforms.

We are seeking an UX Researcher on a contract basis to come and help shape the wearable location products team and lead the research to inform product development, long-term strategy and prioritize product opportunities around areas like map navigation and location sharing products.

Research is paramount to this team’s success - formative research is needed to identify the right latent needs or problems in the world to tackle with product solutions, iterative design research is needed to mold early product ideas into testable prototypes, and creative evaluative research is needed to improve and prepare those products for market.

What You’ll Do:

Collaborate closely with researchers, designers, PMs & engineers to identify, define and deliver meaningful products into the world.
Collaboratively and independently develop and execute research roadmaps.
Lead various research studies throughout all the phases of the product development cycle.
Contribute to product strategy, execution and go-to-market plan.
Manage research vendors to help augment the work of the research team.

Must Haves:

Experience with a range of research approaches and tools, including but not limited to internal and external literature review, qualitative methods (observation, contextual inquiry, interview) and usability.
Verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, customer service and interpersonal skills.
Strong ability to work independently and manage one’s time.
Experience with storytelling to get traction with various audience.
Experience with autonomy and decision making to balance demands.

Education: BA/BS in a human behavior related field, such as human-computer interaction, psychology, sociology, communication, information science, media studies, computer science, or economics.

Hours & Location:
M-F, 40 hours/week. This role will be remote while Covid restrictions are in place. The expectation is to be onsite at New York, NY location once it is deemed safe to do so.

Now for the Perks!


Health Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k, FSA, Commuter Benefit Program
Accrued PTO: Up to 15 days per 12 months on assignment.
New Child Benefit: Up to $4,000 for the birth or adoption of a child while on assignment (conditions apply)

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJob Description:
The Prospect Researcher will provide vital support to the Assistant Vice President of Fundraising in building a new and robust fundraising program through identifying and growing a pipeline of donors from foundation, corporate, and individual sources. This position requires flexibility, strategic thinking, and the ability to provide deep, targeted research on new opportunities for support. As a member of the Fundraising team, the Prospect Researcher will support the continued development of moves management, prospect tracking, and ensure that related processes and procedures are upheld.
Schedule: Full Time
Regular hours entail 9am-5pm, Monday-Friday. Evenings and weekends required. Must be flexible to meet program needs.
Functions:
Monitor trends in overall grant making and individual philanthropy; distill key industry news and information for Assistant Vice President of Fundraising and Board of Trustees
Develop expertise in agency programs and develop resources to monitor and track industry-specific changes relevant to Cayuga Centers’ mission. Identify RFPs and other emerging opportunities for grants
Research current donor lists to identify pipelines for growth through biographical and financial research on potential corporate, foundation, and individual sources of support including identifying connections with Cayuga Centers’ Board of Trustees
Provide input on the formulation of policies for prospect assignment, management, and tracking

Assist with the development of an internship program within department
Actively participate in professional conferences and seminars

Required Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in related field required; Master’s degree in a related field preferred
Minimum of 3-5 years’ experience in prospect research or similar work for the non-profit sector required
Experience working with grants and/or sponsorships strongly preferred
Knowledge of the greater philanthropic landscape, including foundations and corporate giving
Experience with subscription research tools to conduct detailed background research on individuals, businesses, and organizations, including relationship mapping (Foundation Directory Online (FDO) and LexisNexis) required. Knowledge of IWave, RelSci, Inside Philanthropy preferred
Experience with donor databases and prospect management systems
Working knowledge of donor research best practices and ability to exercise discretion with sensitive and confidential data
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as strong presentation skills
Ability to take initiative and work independently
Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills
Ability to analyze and synthesize large quantities of data and effectively communicate key information to development staff and Board of Trustees in a variety of formats
Willingness to learn new tools, technologies, and skill sets, and adapt to a growing and changing development environment

From: Cayuga Centers

Job Summary:
A postdoctoral research position is available in the laboratory of Theresa T. Lu MD, PhD to examine immune cell-mediated regulation of skin, lymph nodes, and the musculoskeletal system in the context of autoimmune diseases such as lupus, inflammatory arthritis, and scleroderma. See our recent papers in Science Immunology, Science Translational Medicine, and Journal of Clinical Investigation. The projects are basic to translational in nature and use disease models as well as patient samples. The work is at the exciting intersection of immunology, vascular biology, mesenchymal cell biology, fibrosis, and rheumatology, and candidates should have experience in at least one of these areas. We are at the Hospital for Special Surgery Research Institute on the Cornell Medical School campus in an interactive scientific community that also includes Memorial Sloan Kettering and Rockefeller University. There are excellent benefits. Interested applicants should email Dr. Lu directly at lut@hss.edu with a cover letter, CV, and a list of references.
